name: Cran-Gose
description:
Based on the traditional Gose brewing style, we added heaps of pureed cranberry to brew our refreshing Cran-Gose.  Light and Fruity, Cran-Gose is pink hued with a cranberry aroma and a naturally tart finish.  Light, Tart, Fruity.
Easy! Quick! Mobile! Our Daypack Series features sessionable beers to put in your daypack and head out to craft your adventure.

name: Cran-Spruce Juice Ale
description: This beer has an old ale base with spruce tips added directly to the boil.  After fermentation, it aged on 84lbs of cranberry puree!

name: Cranberry
description:
Flavoured half dark lager 12° of Bavarian type with 5,2% content of alcohol, bottom-fermented.
It contains: water, barley light malt, Bavarian malt, caramel malt, hops from Žatec, cranberry aroma.
Characteristics: rich caramel colour with a cranberry touch, higher fullness, bite and rich foam
Flavour: slightly cranberry-caramel with fine bitterness and mild dying out.

name: Cranberry
description: NW Sour wheat ale barrel aged for up to 12 months with cranberries, orange peel, and cinnamon.

name: Cranberry Apple
description: Sweet and tart blend of our traditional Apple Hard Cider with the addition of Cranberry Juice.

name: Cranberry Berliner
description: Our ode to summer. By implementing a sour mash procedure in our kettle an intense lactic and sour character emerges, complemented by the addition of cranberries. The beer is then fermented with our lager yeast. Finishes fruity, citrusy, dry, and quite tart.

name: Cranberry Biere de Table
description: A refreshing break from the heavy stouts, barleywines and strong ales of winter. This Belgian-style petit saison was fermented on Oregon Coast cranberries and allowed to lightly sour through a natural lactic fermentation. It’s a flavorful low alcohol brew!

name: Cranberry Blend
description: A lot of cranberries grow in Massachusetts and an unnamed member of Downeast Cider has an affinity for them, dried cranberries, cranberry juice, and most of all, Cranberry Blend. This interesting twist on Original Blend won't make your lips pucker but will bring a smile. As always, our cider is GLUTEN FREE!!

name: Cranberry Chutney Wheat Beer
description: Fruit Wheat Beer

name: Cranberry Cider
description: Racy and fresh, this cider is perfect for lovers of both sweet and tart.  We blend fresh pressed cranberry juice into an already upbeat blend of fermented apples.  Bold and bright on the palate with all the freshness of ripe, red, summer fruits.

name: Cranberry Gose
description: Brewed with cranberries from the Bluewater Farms in Massachusetts, coriander and a splash of salt. The result is a refreshingly tart and effervescent cranberry concoction built to fuel your warm weather-inspired wanderlust.

name: Cranberry Pumpkinfest
description: Pumpkin beer with a slightly tart cranberry flavor forward

name: Cranberry Road
description: Check it out. Take it further. Get them all on your wave-length. Put a Cranberry Road crown on your day. Find a few thirsts to quench. Steal a few hearts along the way. Let it all hangout with cranberries belonging to a decidedly different hard apple cider. Cranberries from shallow bogs filled with early morning mist. A refreshing tart and sweet splash walking down a magic street most can't resist.

name: Cranberry Special Ale
description: Black River Falls is in the heart of cranberry country, and this fall seasonal is a German ale brewed with real Wisconsin cranberries. Not your typical, sweet fruit beer, our Cranberry Special is well balanced with a refreshing tart finish.

name: Cranberry Vert
description: This earthy and rustic brew features the highlights of jammy cranberries and a drier finish.

name: Cranberry Wit
description: A new twist on an old favorite, Cranberry Wit! We started by brewing up a classic Belgian-style witbier with coriander and orange peel, to which we added juicy cranberries. The result is a lively, refreshing beer with a slight tart finish.

name: Cranberry Wit
description:
We took our Great White Buffalo and aged it on cranberries, rosemary and juniper for a witbier that is both refreshing and festive for this draft only release.
Easily drinkable and straight to the point with a light citrus note to compliment the soft malt-backbone.

name: Cranbretty
description: Brettanomyces fermented with cranberries.

name: Crane Ale
description: A slightly better behaved sibling of Hop-Bearer, this pale ale dials down the hop-punch and lets the lightly sweet maltiness feature a little more prominently. An exercise in perfect hop/malt balance (i.e. hops first).

name: Cranium Crush Waffle Cone Raspberry Cream Ale
name_display: Cranium Crush Waffle Cone Raspberry Cream Ale

name: Cup O’ Joe
description:
OATMEAL ESPRESSO STOUT
An easy-drinking, dark, medium-bodied oatmeal stout infused with roasted coffee during the conditioning stage. Made with eight different types of grain and balanced with a healthy dose of hops. Cup O’ Joe has a rich, complex flavor that ends with a nice silky finish.

name: Cupid's Woody
description: Our Barrel aged Cupid (chocolate cherry stout) with Brett

name: Curbside
description:
Burnt honey color, biscuit and fruity aroma, hop and toasty flavor, crisp bitter finish. 

* Winner of the 2016 Day of the Living Ales Golden Tut Award

name: Cure-All Cream Ale
description: Pleasant to drink and magical in its effects! Dr. Darren’s homespun Cure-All Cream Ale will soothe your session-able cream ale needs…and most anything else that “ales” you! Light, clean, crisp, and refreshing, this traditional cream ale was crafted using the best corn and rice. Low in alcohol; little to no hoppiness. This “cure-all” relieves your thirst INSTANTANEOUSLY! 100% Guaranteed.

name: Curieux
description: Allagash Curieux was the first foray into barrel aging. Curieux is made by aging our Tripel Ale in Jim Beam bourbon barrels for eight weeks in our cold cellars. The aged beer is then blended back with a portion of fresh Tripel. The resulting beer is soft with coconut and vanilla notes, with hints of bourbon.

name: Curim Gold Celtic Wheat Beer
description: Bright and sparkling Curim Gold celtic wheat beer is brewed using a blend of pale malt torrefied wheat and caramalt. It is lightly hopped using Challenger, Mount Hood and Cascade varieties resulting in a refreshing light fruity beer with hints of peach, banana and plum.

name: Curio
description: Tart, yet refreshing. Hints of grapefruit and citrus pith. Quenchingly delicious.

name: Curiosity
description: This traditional spring farmhouse ale is bright and floral with Mt. Hood hops added heavily for flavor and aroma. Two toast levels of Munich malt give this Biere de Mars a beautiful orange tint, as well as a balanced maltiness just perfect for warmer, balmy Oregon spring weather. The wheat malt and German style ale yeast fermented at cool winter temperatures give this ale a smooth mouthfeel and crisp finish. We pursue the continual exploration of flavor, concept, and tradition by tributing the rover currently exploring Mars as we enjoy a brew on planet Earth. May it inspire you for the journey ahead!

name: Curiosity
description: Let your curiosity run wild in the sweet, mysterious layers of our Belgian Dark Ale. You’ll find luscious flavors of plum and raisin from Belgian candi syrup, melding into hints of tootsie roll from gently roasted carafa malts, all tinged with suggestions of sweet spices from our Trappist yeast strain. Gently hopped for unparalleled smoothness. Dark and intriguing, yet strangely inviting… the only way to know is to try.

name: Curiosity
description: Curiosity is made by aging our wildflower honey mead in barrels for 2 years, where wild funky yeasts went to work, now we can't tell you about where we obtained the barrels for fear that it would be misleading, but we wish we could, #ChangeTheGame. You will note the lightest sour tang on the sides of your tongue, with slight impression from the oak of soft hints of coconut and vanilla.

name: Curiosity Fourteen
description: CURIOSITY FOURTEEN - (American IPA 6.8% ABV) - Our burst of Curiosity persists… !  Brewed with a massive dose of Northwest American hops, Fourteen pours a brilliant hazy orange in the glass with a dense and creamy head.  We experience intense flavors and aromas of sweet orange, jackfruit, papaya, guava, and mango -  Perhaps the most purely tropical beer we’ve ever brewed…!  The finish is strong, providing balance to the sweet fruit flavor. Your patience will be awarded, as Fourteen’s complexity opens up as she warms...

name: Curiosity IPA
description: Bitter and balanced. A West Coast style IPA. Brilliant bouquet of grapefruit and tropical fruit on the nose, with hints of peach and lemon zest.

name: Curiosity Twenty
description: As the Curiosity series moves from adolescence to adulthood, we went back to basics with this single hop Double IPA featuring Mosaic!  The intent with Twenty was to capture the essence of Mosaic as purely as possible, thus a dead simple malt bill of just 2-row, light crystal, and dextrin malt bill was paired with a super neutral ale yeast yielding a perfectly complementary base upon which Mosaic can shine!  We smell and taste orange find, mango, and a bit of berry punctuated by a lemon peel finish. Soft, dry and delicious - be warned, it drinks like a pale ale!

name: Curiosity Twenty Six
description: The 26th installment of our Curiosity Series is an American Pale Ale featuring primarily El Dorado with a splash of Citra hops! Curiosity 26 is built on a sturdy malt base of 2-row, carafoam, and medium crystal providing a deep orange hue and a solid backbone to a supremely hop saturated pale ale! The aroma is potent and citrusy, leading our palates to flavors of orange, mango, and a mixed bouquet tropical fruit. The finish dissolves in a soft mouthfeel and rounded pithy bitterness, vanishing quickly from the pallet and priming the next sip. A real crusher of a Curiosity, indeed!

name: Curiosus
description: This curiously tart wheat beer was sour-mashed for 24 hours in pursuit of knowledge. The results remain unclear and sparkling. A virtuous weisse with a charming sour bite.

name: Curious Apple
description: A pure expression of Kent from apples sourced from the Garden of England offering the most refreshing long drink. Unlike almost all commercial ciders, there is no concentrate used or water. This is 100% pure Kent apple juice, gently carbonated and extremely refreshing.

name: Curious Brew
description: A premium lager brewed in England and re-fermented with Champagne yeast for a curiously distinctive, clean and refreshing lager beer.  No taste of corporate cardboard. No whiff of market research. Just modern lager beer made to refresh and delight.

name: Curious Cricket Cucumber Basil
description: The heat of summer begs for lighter beers to enjoy while the temperatures rise. Lighter refreshment does not require an absence of complexity and flavor in beers and our latest from Linsey’s Lab is an excellent example. The Kölsch-style ales popular in Germany’s summer work well in Colorado as well, however with this new beer, we attempt to expand the profile of our deliciously refreshing Kölsch-style ale working with subtle additions of cucumber to bring a bright freshness of flavor along with a hint of basil. The combination of these two seasonal ingredients – we waited until the cucumbers were ready here in Northern Colorado – creates a wonderfully crisp aroma combination. Light flavorful cucumber characteristics are complemented by the clear basil notes both present in the effervescent body of the beer. Overall a refreshing twist on the traditional Kölsch style that makes a wonderful summertime beer.

name: Curious IPA
description: Curious IPA is a powerfully hoppy India Pale Ale brewed using the finest pale ale malt and three complementary hops.  We're winemakers and so apply the classic practise used by Champagne, Cotes du Rhone and Claret who blend three grape varieties to create balance and depth. We use traditional English Golding; the fresh, sweet, delicate king of English hops, Bramling Cross; a forest fruity beauty, and Chinook; the punchy, spicy yet aromatic hop.

name: Curious Porter
description: Curious Porter is a beautiful nutty black beer that has the winemaker’s ‘ooffle dust’ applied in the form of French vanilla oak chips to add a creamy soft sweetness to this naturally bitter beer.  One of England's finest Porters.

name: Curious Traveler
description: We proudly introduce our flagship Shandy, the CURIOUS TRAVELER™. Curious Traveler is an American craft wheat ale brewed with fresh lemon and a touch of lime, delivering a crisp, light-bodied flavor with a juicy citrus aroma.

name: Curlew's Toasted Coconut Porter
description: This brown porter base is loaded with tons of roasted malts giving it a plethora of flavors from coffee to chocolate to toffee.  Coconut is added to the boil and to the aging tanks putting a tropical twist on this traditional style.  Curlew is a mostly sand island secluded just far enough away from the main Chandeleur Island chain that it is almost untouched.  There have been many a coconut found on the surfside of this little piece of heaven.

name: Curly Horse IPA
description: An IPA based on the style of the pacific northwest. Intense hop aroma, citrusy hop flavour, dry finish

name: Curly's Gold
description: As our lightest offering, Curly’s combines a subtle malt sweetness with soft bready wheat, which finishes dry making this flavorful beer go down easy.

name: Curmudgeon Old Ale
description: This Old Ale conjures up thoughts of classic sea fairing ports, there local pubs and the weathered fisherman that frequent them. In traditional style Curmudgeon is brewed with an intense focus on the malt bill creating a very strong, rich, malty characteristic and a sweetness indicative of its cousin the barleywine. We are especially proud of the balance in this beer making it deceptively smooth and drinkable at 9.3% alcohol by volume.

name: Currfee Purrmkin Purr
description: Lacto porter with coffee and pumpkin spice

name: Curse of Muldoon
description: Double Milk Stout

name: Curse of the Rye-Wolf
description: Our Curse of the Rye Wolf  Roggenbier  is a German Rye ale brewed with German Pilsner and spicy Rye malts and fermented with our Hefeweizen yeast, yielding a malty, slightly tangy flavor with a clove-like spice finish … our liquid bread in a glass!

name: Curse the Goat
description: Dopplebock aged in bourbon barrels.

name: Curse the Goat
description: Dopplebock aged in bourbon barrels.

name: Cursed
description: Our first experiment in fermentation with our new house culture — a blend of saccharomyces, brettanomyces, lactobacilli, and wild yeasts. This provides a great balanced acidity and a medium level of funk while still being what we consider to be a fairly clean sour. We then dry hop this beer judiciously to complement and not overpower the character provided by this house culture.

name: Cursed Kettles
description: A collaboration with Prairie Artisan Ales in Oklahoma, Cursed Kettles pours a deep reddish brown with ruby highlights. The initial aroma is of dark cherries with biscuit and raisin notes from a spectrum of toasted malts. Cherry, Raisin, fig, and date character dominates the flavor on top of a refreshing tartness and mild funk of Brettanomyces. The finish is dry and tart with lingering dark fruit.

name: Curses Batch #1
description: Each version features a different selection of hops. This batch contains Simcoe hops.

name: Curses Batch #2
description: Each version features a different selection of hops. This batch contains Falconers Flight hops.

name: Curses Batch #3
description: Each version features a different selection of hops. This batch contains Mosaic hops.

name: Curses Batch #4
description: Each version features a different selection of hops. This batch contains Mosaic, Chinook, and Falconers Flight hops.

name: Curses Batch #5
description: Each version features a different selection of hops. This batch contains Amarillo hops.

name: Curses Batch #6
description: Each version features a different selection of hops. This batch contains Green Bullet hops.

name: Curses Batch #7
description: Each version features a different selection of hops. This batch contains Experimental Hop #05256

name: Curses Batch #8
description: Each version features a different selection of hops. This batch contains Amarillo hops.

name: Dark Chocolate George Hunter Stout
description: A variation on our George Hunter Stout.  We added cocoa nibs and lactose to give our stout a sweeter, more chocolately finish.  Quickly becoming a favorite!

name: Dark Chocolate Sea Salt Stout
description: A rich flavorful stout brewed with pink Himalayan sea salt. This beer has heavy roasted barley flavor with tones of coffee and chocolate.

name: Dark Cloud
description: Steeped in a long history dating back hundreds of years, this "old-fashioned" beer is again in vogue. Lager is the German word meaning "to store," so this beer ages three times longer than our ales do. "Dunkel" means dark in German, but don't let the color fool you, it is by no means heavy, overbearing or bitter. In fact, it proves to be a very drinkable session beer.

name: Dark Construct
description: Dark was the inspiration to make this stout. A great divine power flowed through our bodies as we mashed this baby in for the first time. This thick bodied sweet stout is great all year long. This beer is the first one we have created after having opening and logging around 100 brews on our little system. We confess it to be our most mature beer as we have had ample time to refine our process.

name: Dark Construct
description:
Dark was the inspiration to make this stout. A great divine power flowed through our bodies as we mashed this baby in for the first time. This thick bodied sweet stout is great all year long. This beer is the first one we have created after having opening and logging around 100 brews on our little system. We confess it to be our most mature beer as we have had ample time to refine our process.

2013 Bronze Medal Carolina Championship of Beer
2012 Gold Medal Carolina Championship of Beer

name: Dark Crystal
description: As the name suggests, a Cascadian dark ale. Deliciously hoppy, also hugely roasty-toasty malty. Get on in here and give it a try!

name: Dark Crystal IPA
description: he Crystal in the name refers to the hop that is the focus of this beer. We used Caramel, Carapils, and Blackprinz malts combined with Nugget, Cascade, and Crystal hops. Crystal is the aroma addition and then used again to dry hop. The result lets the spice, herbal, fruit, and floral aroma and flavors shine through.

name: Dark Day Black IPA
description: "Dark Day refers to an event that occurred on May 19, 1780, when an unusual darkening of the day sky was observed over the New England states and parts of Canada. The darkness was so complete that candles were required from noon on." Dark Day IPA is a collaboaration with Dave Richardson from Gardner Ale House. Herbal hop aroma is complimented with roasted malt character. American de-husked roasted barley does not lend a bitter acrid flavor but imparts a roasted character that melds with low level caramelized malts. Big herbal, citrus hop flavors and bitterness clash with roasted and mildly sweet malt. Try Dark Day IPA and then drive to Gardner to try its sister brew Nightcrawler IPA.

name: Dark Days
description: As dark as the name implies, Dark Days is one formidable Imperial Stout. This beer is so dark, that not even light can escape its cold, frothy embrace. And it’s probably the reason why so many people are caught off guard by how smooth and velvety it is. So it’s no surprise that it has the uncanny ability to turn even the most devout light beer drinker to the dark side. Since we believe that it’s not enough to just brew the stuff, we age it in barrels until it reaches the maxim of decadence and smoothness.

name: Dark Days
description:
As dark as the name implies, Dark Days is one formidable Imperial Stout. This beer is so dark, that not even light can escape its cold, frothy embrace. And it’s probably the reason why so many people are caught off guard by how smooth and velvety it is. So it’s no surprise that it has the uncanny ability to turn even the most devout light beer drinker to the dark side. Since we believe that it’s not enough to just brew the stuff, we age it in barrels until it reaches the maxim of decadence and smoothness.

Aged 18 months in Caribbean rum barrels.

name: Dark Days Black IPA
description: We first brewed this beer to kick off the Latona’s Winter Beer Series in 2009. Proprietor Bob Brenlin asked us to make a special beer that he could serve at the Latona, Hopvine, and Fiddler’s Inn, and since it was set to debut on the Winter Solstice, the darkest day of the year, especially here in Seattle, we were only too hoppy to oblige: we squished together the best aspects of Porter and IPA, keeping the dark malt complexity while pairing it with the assertive hop spiciness of Centennials. Black India Pale Ale is oxymoronic, of course, so we like to call this a Cascadian Dark Ale, to reflect the fact that our weather here is generally dark and we like our beers with hops and introspection. O.G. 17 P, 6.5% ABV, 75 IBU.

name: Dark Devotion Black IPA
description: It is a dark India Pale Ale (IPA) that combines a rich malty character with locally sourced hops from The Rhizome Republic of Freeville, NY.

name: Dark Dog
description: Falconer's Flight hops.

name: Dark Domestique
description: Dark saison

name: Dark Doppelbock
description: Loaded with a great depth of malt complexity. Huge and rich as can be, yet exhibiting a great smoothness on the palate.

name: Dark Dream
description: A jet black Imperial Stout that throws a thick tan head with aromatics of dark fruit and chocolate. Aged on cherries, expect ripe fruit, dark chocolate, and coffee undertones to dominate the flavor.

name: Dark Dungeon
description: Our rich, bold, dark-roasted Bourbon Coffee Stout with a smooth, creamy white froth. Wonderful flavors of bourbon, coffee, vanilla, molasses and oak aging that intensify as the beer warms in your hand. Great served with many foods or for after dinner with a good cigar.

name: Dark Dwarf IPA
description: Forward Ale

name: Dark Earth
description: A stout brewed with a virtual cornucopia of malts, among these are three different heavily roasted malts, both oats and rye, a nice trio of caramel malts, all blended with a nice base of pale malt. This roasty beast is balanced out by a nice mixture of Chinook, Galena and Target hops. A special addition of wood fired, donkey milled, local Sorghum in the whirlpool caps off this brew, that weighs in around 6% abv.

name: Dark Engine Stout
description: Equal parts of roast, black and dark chocolate English malts provide a great aroma and flavor for our full bodied stout.

name: Dark English Ale
description: Iron Flamingo’s Dark English Ale is a beautiful, yet simple beer. A perfect blend of six malts, including crystal, chocolate and a small percentage of roasted barley produce a full bodied ale. Willamette hoops add a slight hoppiness on the palate and in the nose.

name: DARK FATHA BARREL-AGED ’15
description: This distinctive hybrid beer style combines the crisp, clean feel of a light ale with the dark, cocoa, roasted smoothness of a stout. Big and booming with a delicately light soul. A deep, rich and velvety stout, Dark Fatha is like drinking a whiskey-soaked chocolate cake.

name: Dark Flowers
description:
Herbs and Spice - Spring Brown Ale

In the dark of the night is made this darker roast brown ale. A little caramel malt for roundness of flavor is added, but it ends crisp and clean.  A healthy amount of cardamom and Turkish fennel play with a little astringency from mugwort - requisite for all magical ales of this character.  Kaffir lime leaves add some bright character to the finish to balance the darker spices.  Our gnomes have been seen taking pint-sized wooden jugs of Dark Flowers into their candle-lit lairs to sip as they carouse and make musical merry.

name: Dark Force
description: From a country far, far away, comes the only imperial Wheat stout in the known universe. This Imperial really strikes back. Made with wheat malt and wheat yeast.

name: Dark G-Free
description: Suffolk grown, Sovereign bittering hops provide the floral notes for this full bodied beer, which is Gluten free and suitable for coeliacs.

name: Dark Galaxie
description: Dark grains contribute rich notes of chocolate, coffee, and molasses to this stout that gets its creamy mouthfeel from a generous hand of oats and lactose.

name: Dark Hammer
description: A massive beer brewed with German, Belgian and French malts and imported Belgian Candi Syrup. Its 9.8% AVB is carefully hidden under layers of caramel and dark fruit esters.

name: Dark Heathen Triple Bock
description: The Dark Heathen Triple Bock is a ruby red lager beer. Brewed using the decoction process using Munich and Vienna malts to provide a very malty, smooth complex flavor.  First brewed as a collaboration in 1999 with Bret Kuhnhenn of the Kuhnhenn Brewery also located in Warren Michigan.

name: Dark Helmet
description: The Dark Helmet is a delicious schwarzbier (black beer) that treats the drinker to an ultra-smooth, velvety lager that features chocolate and coffee notes.  Finishing very clean, this easy-drinking, moderately hopped black beer lends itself to session consumption… in other words, go ahead – have another.

name: Dark Helmet
description: A true TBK original, we kick this German-style black lager up a couple notches. Big clean malty flavor with just a hint of roasted malt. "May the Schwartz be with you!"

name: Dark Helmet
description: Dark Helmet is a German-style black lager (or Schwarzbier) brewed with 10% malted rye. Chocolate and Carafa malts give this beer its dark color and ludicrously smooth, roasty flavor. May the Schwarz be with you!

name: Dark Helmet Schwartzbier
description:
This German-style black lager has a rich aroma of coffee, chocolate, caramel, and toasted malt, medium-full body, and a roasty yet smooth finish.

Bronze medalist in the Great American Beer Festival.

name: Dark Helmüt
description:
Dark Helmüt is an extra-strong version of a German black lager. It displays a mellow roasted character that is juxtaposed with the enjoyable lager crispness. We first brewed this beer in 2012 for our annual Vankleek Hill Oktoberfest, and it was a huge hit with festival goers! The recipe for Dark Helmüt was designed by Beau’s brew team member Kevin James.
History & Style

Schwarzbier is the name for the German black lager style. These beers have a smooth malt character and typically finish rather dry. Dark Helmüt has refined mocha inflections and a surprisingly subtle roasted flavour for a beer as dark as the furthest reaches of the galaxy. Malt depth maintains a pleasant balance and keeps the bigger alcohol presence nicely integrated.

Tasting Notes

Malty, bready notes (think pumpernickel without caraway) provide the backdrop to this clean, crisp beer. The finish is bright and crisp.

name: Dark Heron
description: Expressive IPA released for Emerald City Comicon 2016. 2-row pale, honey and C-15 malts with oats and HBC 438, Mosaic and Chinook hops.

name: Dark Hollow
description: The mystery of great beer challenges the spirit of adventure in all who seek a higher level to this ancient brew. Dark Hollow blends the miracle of two crafts—brewing and distillation—to create a work greater than the sum of its parts. Our imperial stout has been aged in charred American oak bourbon barrels, patiently breathing in and out of the wood, gaining complexity, depth and character.

name: Debbie Downer Dunkelweizen
description:
Don't fight it. Spite it!

Debbie Downer is a traditional German Dunkelweizen made with a base

of wheat and Munich malt. A touch of black malt is added to give this

beer its dark hue. The malts are complimented with a single addition

of imported Hallertauer Hersbrucker hops. Add in some German yeast

and you get a crisp, effervescent beer sure to quench your thirst

and lift your spirits, after you encounter the miser of your

Debbie Downer.

name: Debut #12 - Denali Double IPA
description: This double IPA features Denali hops from the Pacific Northwest, which bring huge pineapple and berry notes and nicely complement the citrus flavors of additional hops. Hop character is balanced by a smooth malt backbone and subtle bitter finish.

name: Debut #8 - Barrel Aged Tripel
description: This is Starr Hill’s own take on the classic ale made famous by the Trappist breweries in Belgium. Fruity flavors complement spicy yeast character, while barrel aging adds notes of oak, vanilla and bourbon, creating a complex beer perfect for sipping.

name: Debut Barleywine
description: A full-bodied beer with massive caramel malt notes reminiscent of burnt sugar and toffee. Malty sweetness and fruity flavors lead into a warming finish. This high gravity brew is the perfect way to get cozy on a cold winter night.

name: Debut Du Monde
description: Named for using about triple the amount of a grain that is used for a regular Belgian Trappist ale, ours has a slightly fruity sweetness with a yellow to gold color and a thick, creamy head. Smooth, clean and unassumingly strong, this is a true to form example of the style that gets its distinctive flavor from candi sugar and Belgian strong ale yeast.

name: Débutante
description: Brewed with a combination of Spelt & Rye, accented with a blend of Heather, Honeysuckle, and Hyssop. The result is a rustic farmhouse ale displaying earthy tones & floral characteristics while maintaining intricate balance.

name: Decade
description: Max's Taphouse

name: Decade India Pale Ale
description: Our special 10th anniversary beer is the biggest IPA we have had the nerve to make. Almost all Pale malt, with less than one percent each of Carastan and Wheat makes a beer quite pale for its size at 19 plato OG. We added Chinook, Centennial and Cascade hops just about every place and every way we could think of - giving it lots of hop flavor and aroma and enough bitterness to complement the telltale sweetness of the malt. One patron says "It makes you smile so your mouth's big enough for the beer". 6.25% alcohol by weight 7.8% by volume.

name: Decade-ence
description: An American Double IPA made with 10 different types of hop strains, each contributing 100 IBU’s of bitterness to a 10% ABV beer. It’s a decade of Decade-ence! Made by brewers Sean Redmond and Shane Welch.

name: Decadence
description:
Decadence is our Tenth Anniversary spiced amber ale. This is a very limited production, brewed only once, to celebrate ten fantastic years in business.

This ale weighs in at 13% ABV and is a fantastic sipper, especially after dinner or consider paring it with a good book on a cool fall evening.

Decadence is brewed with honey, cardamom spice and gentian (a rare botanical!) This ale is very unique and will develop finer character when aged at cellar temperatures.

name: Decadence
description:
Decadence was first released in 2005 to celebrate our 10 year anniversary. AleSmith has released a new version of Decadence each year around our anniversary date in late fall. The style chosen each year is different, but you can be sure that it will always fit the description of Decadence!

Previous styles of Decadence include: – 2005: Old Ale – 2006: Imperial Red Ale – 2007: Imperial Porter – 2008: English Barleywine – 2009: Dunkel Weizenbock – 2010: Old Ale – 2011: Maple Smoked Barleywine – 2012: Belgian Quadrupel – 2013: Doppelbock - 2014: Wheat Wine Ale - 2015: Belgian-style Amber Ale

name: Decadent Dark Chocolate Ale
description: Beer lovers and Chocoholics unite! It’s a decadent Atwater ale that ends with a dark chocolate kiss.

name: Deceit
description: Inspired by Belgian Tripels and Golden Strong ales, this light-hued beer uses a high percentage of Pilsner malt and a unique Belgian yeast strain to present a sweet lemon character in the aroma. This citrus quality carries into the flavor and finishes with a slight tartness.

name: Deceit Aged In Cognac Barrels
description: Our award winning Belgian-style golden ale Deceit was aged in cognac barrels produce this strong yet deceptively smooth brew. Spicy notes in the flavor are complimented by tantalizing and complex characteristics pulled from the cognac barrels. Slight fruit notes balance these elaborate flavors and transition into a dry and inviting finish.  Developed alongside over a dozen Single Hop Imperial IPAs, the Truth was three years in the making and has some of the most unique hop varieties available today.

name: December IPA of the Month
description: ‘Tis the season to celebrate, as we wrap up 2014 with the gift of a double IPA. Caramel and midnight wheat malts lend a festive reddish hue, while a Santa-sized triple dry-hop with Chinook and Simcoe™ delivers flavor and aroma by the sleighful. A dose of holiday cheer that belongs under your tree – whether you’ve been naughty or nice.

name: Deception
description: Deception’s unique flavor profile sets it apart from your typical BLONDE ale. It’s a rich, creamy, golden colored ale that is incredibly refreshing and smooth. With hints of coconut and lime, this beer is another example of Black Market taking a traditional style and putting their own unique touch on it.

name: Deception
description: This rare, experimental Belgian Quad was brewed in 2003 and has since become a unicorn for beer collectors and conisseurs. Full-bodied and hazy gold with a lingering off-white head, Deception combines Belgian candy sugar and honey for a sweet taste and smooth mouthfeel that balances and masks the high alcohol content. Like most “big beers”, the flavor palate changes and matures with age making cellared bottles an entirely new experience… if you can find one!

name: Deception
description: New Zealand Nelson Sauvin dry hops contribute aromas of white wine and grape skins, a nice compliment to the complex spicy, citrus character derived from the Belgian yeast. Deceivingly strong at 9%, this beer coats your mouth with soft, airy fullness. Caution while enjoying, this brew can sneak up on you!

name: Deception
description: Black Rye IPA

name: Deception Golden Ale
description: A smooth and refreshing, full bodied ale with a distinct hop bitterness from the traditional English and modern American hops. Subtle fruit flavours and a crisp, lingering finish.

name: Deciduous XPA
description: To be deciduous is to shed your leaves at maturity. This is strictly a seasonal process something that is natural. A process that is tied to the change in seasons when light rains begin to fall and the leaves turn to red. We brewed this beer to reflect that amber color of the leaf that is halfway though the trip. Giving way to something lighter and bright to reflect the first few rains of the fall. The brilliant hop character is like dried fruits, ripe with pineapple and apricot that are something you might enjoy at a holiday gathering. This beer is brewed for fall sessions with family and friends.

name: Decimation
description: Zurich Lager – Caramel, sweet toffee, currant, raisins, (limit 2 per person)

name: Decision Maker
description:
This year’s beer shoppe anniversary ale is what we are calling a DPA – Decisive Pale Ale, which is
the quick way of saying that it is a northwest, hop-forward, malt-balanced pale ale that
doesn’t leaving you guessing what it is. Dry-Hopped with Mosaic hops, the aroma
will make you want to do unspeakable things to yourself, which you shouldn’t question, because you
just had a Decision Maker, and you now know what to do. Yes, it’s a beer that knows what you want.

name: Deckins Indulgence
description: A full bodied brown ale with peanut butter roasted chocolate and hints of dark fruit flavors. The amazing aroma keeps no secrets, with a  perfect balance between sweet and bitterness this complex ale is easy to find yourself indulging in.

name: Declaration
description:
Declaration is a Belgian Style IPA which packs a hop presence we’ve never seen in this style before.  There is a massive hops profile from our heavy-handed dosing of American hops, yet still enough room for our Belgian yeast to make an appearance. Dark golden in color and light in body, Declaration will dry you out and make you want more with each sip.

In fact, Declaration may just be one of the hoppiest Belgian style beers ever — but don’t take our word for it.

name: Declaration
description: Every August we celebrate our brewing independence with the release of Declaration. Copious amounts of citrus hops dominate the aroma and palate. Light malt flavors and delicate Belgian yeast notes round out this unique anniversary ale.

name: DeclarationALE
description: A perfect copper-colored American India Pale Ale abundant with juicy fruit-filled hop aromas. Malt sweetness takes a back seat to a medley of lush hop flavors, ranging from dank wet earthiness to bitter herbs and greens. The finish is punctuated by a clean and dry grassy bitterness.

name: Deco IPA
description: A light blonde citrus tasting beer, very easy drinking for its strength.

name: Decompression
description: Decompression Double India Pale Ale is a hazy, golden yellow Double IPA with a simple and compact malt bill. We used Falconer's Flight, East Kent Goldings, Palisade and Experimental Pine Fruit hops to provide a complex and intricate hop profile. Decompression DIPA is a heavy hitter, weighing in at 9.0% ABV and 91 IBUs while still retaining its balance. Be sure drink this brew responsibly!

name: Decompression Session
description: After a long day of work, its time to Decompress. Have a pint of Decompression Session IPA and let the day melt away. This Session IPA is 4.5 ABV, with a subtle citrus nose. Each sip brings out the citrus and tropical fruit flavors. Cheers!

name: Deconstruction
description: A Method of brewing based on isolating first principals and making pronounced through pilot brewing the desired elements that contribute to the overall flavor. A Golden Ale created by blending the final recipe with its own barrel aged pilot beers fermented with wild yeasts. Each individual barrel contributes a unique flavor from the wood chosen and the cultures resident to achieve subtle complexities that develop(ed) over time. A beer which starts sweet, filling the mouth with fruit-like esters and a mild spiciness, changing to a tart and lingering flavor reminiscent of grapefruit living amidst an earthy, citrusy hop aroma. Define flavor for yourself in this constantly evolving liquid expression.

name: Deconstruction
description: A SMaSH pale brewed with Cascade hops.

name: Decoy
description: 100% hull melon-hopped lager; golden & bright, decoy shows clean balance & subdued flavor nuances on the palate; notes of toasted bread & honey mingle with herbal, spicy aromas, bolstered by subtle hints of strawberry & sweet melon; lagered for 14 weeks in stainless steel tanks.

name: Decoy
description: At his restaurant, Eleven Madison Park, Chef Daniel Humm makes an extraordinary five spice roast duck. The genesis of Decoy is our notion that those spices would affectionate the fig notes of a Belgian Strong malt bill in the direction of a winter warmer. Cumin, coriander, lavender flowers, Sichuan red peppercorns and honey are added to Special B malts and Belgian candi sugars, with American ale yeast chosen because its esters enhance rather than dominate as would a Belgian. A strong, gently-spiced ale, Decoy is intended to sit next to or in place of a fire during the bracing cold of winter. Drink Decoy because life and spice…

name: Decoy Red
description: This red ale is hit with a 21 pound blend of cascade, centennial, and chinook hops in the whirlpool, which is where beer receives most of its flavor and aroma structure. No dry hop here, but still expect loads of awesome hop flavor complimenting the malty rich flavors of caramel malts.

name: Decrepit Old Ale
description: Malty sweet with hop flavors

name: Ded Moroz
description: Meaning “Father Winter” in Russian, Ded Moroz, is pitch black in color. It is an imposing beer that is best enjoyed by slow sipping to fully soak up this beer’s complexity. It has a very deep flavor profile of dark chocolate, coffee, graham cracker, overripe fruit, amongst others. To add to its complexity, it is generously hopped with a large portion of imported Brittish hops to balance the sweetness and keep it true to style. Ded Moroz is a decadent treat perfect for the cold winter months!

name: Diabolical Doctor Wit
description: Diabolical Doctor Wit is a limited release white ale brewed in the authentic Belgian style. This Belgian style Wit starts off with a wheat base and is left unfiltered. It is then carefully spiced with coriander and bitter orange peel and aged with lavender to introduce a unique floral bouquet that complements this complex yet refreshing fruity thirst quencher.

name: Diabolus
description:
Hemos mantenido a Diabolus encerrado durante 12 meses en una barrica de Bourbon. Ahora ha sido liberado... Estás avisado. Esta masiva y libidinosa quadrupel es una libación al mismísimo Diablo.

We kept Diabolus locked up for 12 months in a Bourbon barrel. He has now been liberated... You're warned. This massive and libidinous Quadrupel is a libation to the Devil himself.

name: Diamond Head Oatmeal Stout
description: A traditional oatmeal stout with an intense roast barley flavors and mildly hopped using Willamette and Nugget hops. The robust flavour is balanced with a smooth creamy finish. It is named for the razor's edge ridge that comes off the south flank of Mount Garibaldi's Atwell Peak.

name: Diamondback Ale
description: Brewed in honor of our friends at Hill Air Force Base, this copper ale soars with toasted malts, including hearty helpings of Special Roast, Vienna and (of course) Victory malt, with a Cascade hop finish to give it a bite.

name: Diamonds, Fur Coat, Champagne
description: Zesty, floral, refreshing. This tart wheat beer is fermented with lactobacillus and brewed with Meyer lemon zest, elderflowers, and dry-hopped with Nelson Sauvin. We wrote the recipe to mimic the floral, citrus, and grape character of brut champagne.

name: Dibble House
description:
Dibble House was inspired by Grant Wood's iconic painting American Gothic and is a hybrid style (an American kölsch) that marries assertive bitterness and a clean crisp finish. The kölsch style originated from Cologne, a landmark of High Gothic architecture, and we have added US hops (to give a higher IBU than a traditional kölsch) to create an easy-drinking refreshing beer.

Dibble House uses four different grains to give the beer an initial malty sweetness before giving way to a lingering bitterness. The yeast and hops add a subtle fruitiness whilst the light carbonation creates a light-medium and smooth mouthfeel.

name: Dibs Are for Dummies
description:
The wind howls. Snow piles up, melts, then freezes.
Days pass without direct sunlight. It's wintertime in Chicago.
You can forget about parking--all of the spots are taken,
saved by miscellaneous crap, known as "dibs."
The tradition is practiced by first-rate idiots.
So you park a mile away, shivering on your walk home.
But this will be waiting for you, ready to warm your bitter heart.
Our English-style Barleywine is chewy and rich, accented by an addition of honey.
Kick over that chair, dibs are for dummies.

name: Dibya Ceri
description: Sweet Cherry Sour Ale with Chipotle

name: Dick Fuggles Pale Ale
description: Dick Fuggles Pale Ale. A well-balanced and extremely refreshing pale ale. This beer flows through hop cones immediately before entering your glass with a device called a Randal. The hops produce a unique grassy aroma that should make Richard Fuggles proud.

name: Dick the Butcher
description: Dick the Butcher is a no-nonsense pale ale. Cascade hops deliver a fresh grapefruit aroma and a clean bitterness. Rye malt keeps this beer dry and drinkable. The first thing we do, is raise a glass to this refreshing brew.

name: Dick Tracy
description: The very first BentSpoke mash! We thought we’d keep it simple, so we made a fruity, nutty Belgo inspired hoppy brown ale.

name: Dick's Danger Ale
description:
Our flagship beer. A large percentage of black malt gives this distinctive ale its dark brown/black color and that slightly roasted flavor. Magnum hops provide a backbone of bitterness and large additions of Mt. Hood hops later in the boil come right through in the finish.

The result is a highly drinkable, non-intrusive dark ale which defies style guidelines and leaves you wanting more.

name: Dick's Mountain Ale
description: Classic amber ale; Dick’s style. Large quantities of two special varieties of lightly roasted malts contribute a deep malt profile to this very drinkable and attractive ale.  Larger additions of Northwest flavor and aroma hops give our amber its delicious finish which lingers on the palate.

name: Didgeri Dew Australian Ale
description: Originally brewed by our former head brewer, the notorious Dick Cantwell, who described it as "a compelling nod in the direction of the oeuvre of our compatriots Down Under. Light bodied, turbinado sweetened, the Dew tempts us to contemplate the drinkability reminiscent of a warm aboriginal forest stroll". Well, uh, you have to know Dick. OG 14 Plato.

name: Die Fizzy Yellow
description: Our American IPA differs from the traditional IPAs, it’s more modern: it has citrus Australian hops, besides a lighter body and, for not having caramelized malt, its color is lighter. The expression Fizzy Yellow is used to denominate the boring comercial beer, Fizzy for bubbly and Yellow for its color. We don’t like fizzy yellow.

name: Die Königin
description: Die Königin is an unfiltered, unpasteurized oak-aged Kellerbier.  This strong lager pours hazy, bright amber with a white head.  Lightly effervescent with assertive biscuit qualities and an adequate Tettanang hop presence, Die Königin is matured for several weeks on light toast oak, imparting a creamy mouth feel and a dry finish, accentuating sweet malt qualities.   This Stark Lager is produced in small quantities for lager connoisseurs with the most discerning palates.

name: Diebels Alt
description:
DIEBELS Alt is brewed according to the German Purity Law of 1516. Under this "Reinheitsgebot", only four ingredients are allowed: Barley malts, hops, yeast, and water. The dark-roasted special malt lends DIEBELS its unmistakable amber glow. 

Dark and Delicious. For a dark, flavorful beer, DIEBELS is surprisingly light and drinkable - a beer you can enjoy all night long. It isn't bitter like many ales, and it doesn't have the strong aftertaste of certain imports.

name: Diepolder Dubbel
description: Belgian born in Brooksville, FL. Sweet malt flavor with a touch of caramel and a dry finish with low hop bitterness.

name: Diesel
description: This undefinable black brew is part black IPA, part American Stout, but 100% Diesel powered. Robust chocolate and roasted flavors, with thick pine hop flavor and aroma.

name: Diesel Oil Stout
description: This beer is social lubricant, a beer that lives up to its name. This is a black stout beer with a firm brown head. We add a little bit of lactose for ballast. Columbus is home to Cummins Inc., makers of diesel engines. This beer is dedicated to the hard working men and women of Cummins!

name: Dig
description: Unearth your bottle-opener because this Pale Ale is something you can Dig. Sorachi Ace hops provides a fresh Spring zing with incredible lemon aroma. Nelson Sauvin is next in line with bursts of passion fruit, mango and peach. American favorites, Cascade and Centennial round out this crisp, clean Pale Ale. Dig in!

name: Diggable IPA
description:
Don't fight it, Spite It!

The most diggable beer ever brewed

for the most diggable dude,

the Chicago Beer Karma Ambassador.

We encourage you to take his lead and share beer with friends

because this Citra hopped India Pale Ale is totally crushable...


Just ask Nicky Parttime.

name: Dikaiju
description: Big nose full of canteloupe, pine, and citrus. Flavor is loaded with dried fruit and hop resin, with notes of black pepper and mint. A huge, intense double IPA that remains dangerously balanced and drinkable.

name: Dikke Lul 3 Bier
description: 1-2-3 en tot de 4. Het maakt niet uit, dikke lul drie bier! If you are not from the Netherlands please do not translate the name of this beer! (Obviously you are going to now!) However this extraordinary hoppy pale ale was named after a Dutch and even Haarlem’ saying (found out after we made the beer). Awesome hop forward and dry-ridiculously-hopped American Pale Ale. Light/medium bodied and a lot of dank hops in it. The good stuff ☺

name: Doppel BLUR
description: DOPPEL BLUR Imperial Hefe takes all the things you know and love about our BLUR Texas Hefe and kicks them up a notch. Creamy and refreshing with a nice little bite, this amped up hefeweizen overflows with citrus, banana, and clove notes. Kick back and relax with BLUR’s bigger, boozier doppelganger.

name: Doppel Bock
description:
A mighty lager-style brew, dark in color. Our Doppelbock brings a big malty sweetness together with the classic lager smoothness, topped off with a slightly evident alcohol flavor. A toasty brew to battle even the coldest winter nights.

Available at the Brewery and in bottles & cases from March - May.

name: Doppel Bock
description: A strong, dark red German style lager. Brewed with a large % of Munich Malt. This beer has a rich & malty flavor & body.

name: Doppel Bock
description: Traditionally brewed by Monks to sustain them while they fasted during lent; the Doppel Bock is a big-bodied and flavorful beer.

name: Doppel Bock Ultimator
description: A famous brewer once said, “The true test of a Bock is that a drinker should not know the beer’s strength until he stands up.” This tasty Bock passes the test, drinker beware. Roasted malts create a reddish black color and flavorful hints of fig and raisin. A long lagering (cold storage) process provides a velvety smooth finish. A holiday favorite.

name: Doppel Dinkel Bock
description: Double down with this imperial spelt beer that features a generous amount of dinkel (spelt) malt in place of the traditional wheat malt. The result features aromas of bubblegum, banana, clove, citrus, and a slight spiciness. Smooth, full bodied and drinkable, Doppel Dinkel Bock will make the Bavarian in you proud!

name: Doppel Shot Doublebock
description: Doppel Shot Doublebock is a strong lager, brewed to showcase the inclusion of 100% freshly roasted Yellow Caturra coffee beans grown locally on the Ka’anapali Estate. The malt character is light with a slight sweetness to compliment the bitter, yet smooth character of the coffee.

name: Doppel Weizen
description: A Brand-Spankin' New Beer Inspired by Rolec: The Builders of our New Brewing System. They Sent Us a Traditional Yeast Sent From Their Friends in Bavaria & We Way-Overfed It To Take It All Up A Bit!

name: Doppelbock
description: Roasty and sweet, dark German lager. The residual sweetnes delivers a fullness that satisfies even on the coldest of days.

name: Doppelbock
description: Dopplebock is a stronger version of the traditional bockbier. Originally brewed in Munich by the Paulaner monks, it served as "liquid bread" during times of fasting. A true winter lager, our Dopplebock is dark and full-bodied. With its high alcohol content, you want to be careful how quickly you imbibe. The flavor is very malty with a hint of chocolate and roasted grain.

name: Doppelbock
description: A strong german lager. Dark brown, fruity esters upfront with a nutty finish.

name: Doppelbock
description: This dark amber lager beer has a rich, toasted malt character balanced with a slight amount of toffee in the finish.  Hop bitterness is rounded off with alcohol warmth.  Approximately 8.7% by volume.

name: Doppelbock
description: Dark & rich with a big beer taste, Doppelbock is an exceptionally smooth, full-bodied dark lager with a bold character that is sure to brighten your spirits

name: Doppelbock
description: Doppel means double and bock is a higher strength German lager. This style was originally created by Franciscan monks in Germany known as Paulaners. It was used as a source of nutrients during times of fasting such as Lent. Liquid bread, basically. It is a showcase for malt aromas and flavors. Being a lager, it is cold conditioned for long periods to smooth out flavors. Our Doppelbock has caramel–like aromas, very low roast, and a hint of licorice in the aroma.

name: Doppelbock
description: Doppelbock literally means double bock bier. Standing at 7.5% ABV, this full-bodied lager was designed for the colder days and a cozy fireplace. This beer required three batches of grain to achieve its hardy and complex flavors. Doppelbock is available in cans with blue tabs.

name: Doppelbock
description: Originally brewed by the monks of St. Francis of Paula (Paulaner Brewery today) as liquid bread for the fast during Lent, and dedicated to the Savior, or Salvator in German. As a nod to the original, all subsequent doppelbocks end in -ator. Thus, ours is called Creamator. It is very smooth, dark, rich, and malty. Doppelbock come in around 7.5 abv.

name: Doppelbock
description: A complex malt build and higher alcohol content combine to create a near religious experience. German Noble Hops do little to tame the strong full body developed by monks as a “liquid bread” to cleanse the soul during periods of fasting. Lagered for 12 weeks to provide a clean rich finish. Good things come to those that wait.

name: Doppelbock Dunkel
description: DoppelBock Dunkel has a pleasant full and creamy body, with a cofeeish aroma. Nicely warming with toffeelike malty sweetness, balanced by a hoppy-bitterness in the finish.

name: Doppelganger
description: This nice and crisp Belgian Blonde was brewed with Belgian malts. The Belgian yeast gives off flavors and aromas of bubble gum and faint banana finished with a light clove spiciness.

name: Doppelganger Hoppy Pale Wheat
description: Neither Pale Ale nor American wheat, Doppelganger emulates our favorite characteristics of both styles. Dry and slightly bitter with a distinct hoppy nose. A light body gives way to a refreshing wheat finish. We recirculated the bright, cold beer through dry hops before kegging, which imparted a much earthier, floral hop character.

name: Doppelgänger Wheat
description: The Doppelgänger  is a Bavarian-style weissbier (wheat beer) with some rye added to malt bill to give it some added spice notes.

name: DoppelHopper IPA
description: Limited release for 2013! Mustang DoppelHopper is a bold mix of five different hops that can only be supported by an extra helping of the finest American and European barley. This delightfully balanced IPA—incredibly balanced and brewed to palette-pleasing perfection at 75 IBU's and 7.5% ABV—is a masterful blend of rich, flavorful malts and strong, aromatic hops. Available on draft in select bars and restaurants throughout OK. It's a limited release, so get it while you can!

name: Doppelsticke
description: Doppelsticke  is a super strong double alt style beer made with hops from Rogue Farms.

name: DOPPELVISION
description: BARREL AGED DOPPELBOCK  A sweet malt forward lager with subtle hints of vanilla, coconut and bourbon.

name: Doppio
description: Robust Porter made to complement the Carabello coffee we added to this full bodied brew. Roasted and caramel malts add dark fruit flavors and aromas while the coffee adds to the complexity. This beer is great for breakfast or dinner!

name: Dopple Bock
description:
This dark lager was originally brewed as liquid bread to sustain Bavarian monks while fasting. Its sweet complex malt character comes from brewing with many varieties of dark roasted caramel malts and long periods of cold storage.

Malts: 2-Row Pale, Black Patent, Caramel, Carapils, Munich, Vienna
Hops: Chinook, Mt. Hood, Saaz, Tettnanger

name: Double White IPA
description: A hybrid of a White Ale and West Coast IPA and super-sized for your drinking pleasure. This Double IPA is brewed with Wheat to give it a pale white color and a slight sweetness in the finish. At its core this is a hop forward beer, bitter and heavily dry-hopped with a combination of Centennial, Cascade, and Simcoe hops. This blend of hops imparts notes of Spice, Citrus, and Pine in the aroma. A deceivingly drinkable beer despite its high alcohol content.

name: Double Wide I.P.A.
description: The classic India Pale Ale is a traveler’s beer, aggressively hopped to withstand the long, hot ocean voyage to the British East Indies. Our Double-Wide I.P.A. also travels well, and is right at home in the most exotic ports of call of the Midwest. While this modern-day prairie schooner may not resemble a graceful sailing sloop, our liberal hopping regimen does make her virtually “twister-proof,” with toffee and caramel notes balancing out the lingering bitterness. Enjoy this beer fresh to best appreciate the complex blending of hop aromas, ranging from minty to citrusy, with subtle hints of pine.

name: Double Wit
description: A Belgian Style Wheat brewed with orange peel, lemon peel and coriander.  Our celebratory spring time seasonal.

name: Double Wit
description: As the name implies - this is our pilot recipe used in Riverhorses' Double Wit.

name: Double Wit
description: Double Wit is our more muscular take on the beloved white ales of Belgium. Unmalted wheat and Belgian malted barley give the beer a light body and straw hue, while coriander and curaçao provide the traditional notes of spice and light acidity. This cloudy, deceptively drinkable creation should be enjoyed without the addition of fruit.

name: Double Wit Ale
description: Brewed in honor of 2013 Belgian Independence Day

name: Double Woody
description: A deep amber to brown.  Spicy & slightly fruity.  Not as much fruitiness as the Belgian Strong Dark Ale but some dark fruit aromas and flavors may be present. Mild hop bitterness with no lingering hop flavors.

name: Double Zilla
description: Twice the experience of Cascazilla, we brewed Double Zilla with too many malts to list and an excess of American hops. Russet color, aggressively hoppy aroma & flavor, rich body, and fiery finish.

name: Double ZZ Razzberry Ale
description: An unfiltered, lightly flavored raspberry wheat ale. Enjoy the same specially blended yeast as our own Harvest Moon Wheat. And we all know, chicks dig scars, the long ball and Double ZZ!!!

name: Doublecross
description: A vibrant reddish-black hue, substantial body and pleasant headiness give this dark Belgian-style ale an alluring first impression. The intense flavors of dark candi sugar conspire to deceive with flavors that remind us of preserved fruits and holiday spicing, but the true agent is the Trappist yeast—and a suspicious drinkability.

name: Doublejack
description: A full body double IPA. A great nose and heavy grapefruit finish but not too bitter.

name: Doubleplusgood
description: IPA dry hopped with Citra Hops.

name: Doublestein Lager
description: orange, vanilla, lactose lager

name: Doublicious IPA
description: Citrusy, balanced with bitterness and sweetness. Lots of peach,lemon and kumquat. This is Delicious IPA on steroids.

name: Doubloon Double Pale Ale
description: Doubloon DPA uses the finest ingredients on the market to give this 8.5% ABV double pale ale a great taste and smooth finish. Additionally, just like pirate ales of old, the Doubloon is unfiltered and naturally carbonated. While this increases the production time, it helps increase mouthfeel and adds robust flavor.

name: Doubting Thomas
description:
Jopen Doubting Thomas (aka Ongelovige Thomas) is our interpretation of a quadrupel. A distinct beer with rich malt as the main flavour. The American hops gives it a fruity character.
This beer is named after the apostle Thomas, who would not believe that Jesus had risen from the dead. Thomas has his name-day at the start of winter on 21 December. This reddish-brown beer is a genuine winter warmer. Surprisingly rich in flavour and ideal for sipping beside the fireplace. Believe it or not, this is a heavyweight.

name: Doug's Turbo Sarsaparilla
description: A rootbeer flavored beer. If you like rootbeer, light beers, or even fruit beers, you'll love it!

name: Dougan's Brown
description: Maris Otter, caramel, chocolate and biscuit malts give this English brown ale its rich nutty, toffee, caramel and biscuit flavors.  Brewed with man’s best friend in mind.

name: Dougie the Logger
description: Backside’s premier lager is designed to put a smile on Roseburg’s most famous logger.  Light, bright, I’ll have another

name: Dousman St. Wheat
description: Light-bodied and drinkable, this hazy straw-gold hefeweizen exhibits the distinctive fruit and spice flavor of special Bavarian yeast. As is Bavarian tradition, we serve this beer "mit hefe" ("with yeast") to enhance its distinctive flavor.

name: Dove Runner Red Wheat
description: Celebrating a free-spirited and scandalous time when “Soiled Doves” bathed on the banks of the Arkansas and Chisolm trail cattlemen raised a ruckus in Wichita’s Delano district, Dove Runner is made with over 50% red wheat and enough roasted barley to make the color. This beer proves that all dark beer isn’t heavy. It starts with a slight roasted flavor that quickly subsides once you catch the fruity esters from the Bavarian Hefenweizen yeast. Some detect plum, banana, perhaps cloves, others pick up hints of bubblegum. It is a complex beer, loved by many.

name: Dover's Black Day Porter
description: On Sunday, March 1, 1896, the Cochecho River had a major flood. This flood was so substantial that it destroyed several bridges and buildings in downtown Dover alone and closed the river to major shipping forever. The media dubbed this day "Dover's Black Day." We make our porter similar to the traditional style with a large amount of chocolate malt and some dark crystal malt for just a hint of deep toffee sweetness. Low hop aroma with a fair amount of flavoring and bittering hops to round out the dark chocolate and roasted barley flavors.

name: Down 'n Dirty Chocolate Oatmeal Stout
description:
Down 'n Dirty Chocolate Oatmeal Stout is big, black and rich. Brewed with cocoa nibs for a sublime chocolate experience.

When the railroad was completed between Madison and Milwaukee in 1882, mucky soils in the glacial. swamp near Lake Mills made the tracks most unsteady. A bridge-tender stood guard, 24 hours-a-day, to warn oncoming trains of the danger ahead and caution them to slow their pace. One engineer chose not to head this warning and the locomotive lost control and tumbled off the bridge into the mud below. The train is said to be forever entombed deep in the muck along the present day Glacial Drumlin trail. We brew Down 'n Dirty Chocolate Oatmeal Stout thick and black like the glacial muck.

name: DOWN CANYON STOUT
description: Full-bodied oatmeal cream stout with more pronounced chocolate and coffee notes, traditionally referred to as a ‘stout porter’. Contains lactose.

name: Down Deep
description:
Throw on the mask, pop up the dive flag and splash into a day of fun on the West coast of Florida. 
An adventure and a constant search to try and find as many tasty little gems as you can sums up the underwater treasure hunt that is scalloping off the West coast of Florida. It also sums up each attempt to find the hops we need for our west coast IPA.
The constant pressure of hop lovers across all oceans has made finding large amounts of hops like Citra, Mosaic and others tougher and tougher each year. For Down Deep™, we’ve put the bounty of our treasure hunt in your glass.
You’ll find deep grapefruit and resinous citrus notes in the aroma, supported by a subtle but clean aroma of sweet grain. The hop flavor presents itself as resiny grapefruit and tropical fruit, with a subtle sweet cracker support from the grain. Firm bitterness and a clean, dry finish leave you ready for another sip… and very proud of the result of our hunt.

name: Down Down
description: Juicy New England style hazy IPA with Citra, Galaxy, and Nelson Sauvin hops.

name: Down East Harvest Ale – SEASONAL
description: Shine on Harvest Moon!  We combined Nash County sweet potatoes with traditional fall spices to bring the warmth and comfort of Grandma’s sweet potato pie to a pint glass.  Coppery and clean, this amber ale is a nice contrast to traditional pumpkin beers.  Give thanks to your local hardworking farmer while tipping a glass of this truly southern ale.

name: Down Easy Pale Ale
description: And in the beginning, word came forth, “Let there be ale, and let it be the colour of barley in the summer sun, and let it paradoxically both quench and create great thirst.” Who are we to disagree? Sit back, take it easy, enjoy the slow ride.

name: Down in Kokomo
description: Very Dark, with chocolate and coffee notes, but balanced with lighter fruiter undertones.  This beers lighter body makes it a great dark beer for summer.  Finishes with a touch of sweetness.

name: Down the Hatch Green Chili Ale
name_display: Down the Hatch Green Chili Ale
description: What did you think? A craft brewery in West Texas with no southwestern twist? We hope you’ll find our Green Chili Ale piques your palate for that wonderful green chili enchilada hunger you get when you think “Tex-Mex”. This is a good malty beer with more chili flavor than hops. Slide one down for good all over refreshment with just enough heat to make you think about a little sweat.

name: Down To Earth
description:
Down to Earth is the natural evolution (pun intended) of Bitter American, our original session ale. We thought it would be fitting to bring our space chimp home and let him chill. Whether you have a long mission behind you or a full afternoon ahead, this session IPA will help keep things real. More relaxed than an IPA, but with all the hop aroma and flavor, Down to Earth is our tribute to unsung heroes and unplanned adventures. 
Down to Earth is available year-round in six-pack cans and on draft and pairs nicely with a variety of things, including lunch.

name: Down Under
description: IPA brewed with passion fruit juice.

name: Down Under Pale Ale
description: A refreshing Pale Ale using 100% Australian hops. Pale golden orange appearance, citrus and floral aromas, light biscuity and creamy mouthfeel with a piney resinous finish. Brewed with Gambrinus Pale and Munich malt, Castle Caramel malt, Australian Galaxy hops, and our proprietary English yeast strain.

name: Downfall
description: Downfall is an Imperial Milk Stout aged in Bourbon barrels with raspberries. This huge chocolatey stout is rounded out by a giant punch of tart berry and a warming Bourbon heat. Downfall pours a thick inky black with a creamy tan head.

name: Dubbeltime
description: Dubbeltime is a fantastic and creatively-brewed Belgian Style Dubbel.  Collaboratively brewed with Ale Syndicate, this dubbel has a delicate mix of light Belgian candi sugars and cocoa, with a classic subtle Belgian bubble gum finish.

name: Dubble Fantasy
description: Abbey ale with hints of bubble gum flavor.

name: Dubhe
description:
Toasted, chocolaty dark malts align with an astronomical amount of hops.

Named Utah’s Centennial star in 1996, Dubhe illuminates the front of the big dipper from 124 light years away. Dubhe, a red giant also known as Alpha Ursae Majoris, appears orange in color and has a mass 4x that of the sun.

name: Dubious
description: North Peak Dubious is a Dark Chocolate Stout that has the perfect combination of chocolate, roast and black malts resulting in a smooth rich beer. Judicious use of hops bring out a complex, yet subtle bittering finished off with a big Goldings nose. This swirl of aroma, flavor and body is underscored by the rich chocolate that is added at the end of the boil. This medium bodied beer is brewed in Traverse City, MI, on Old Mission Peninsula incorporating locally grown hops.

name: Dubrue Berliner Weisse
description: A sour German wheat beer, perfect for a hot summer’s day.

name: Dubrue India Black Ale (IBA)
description: Deep dark ruby red in color, with a strong hop profile our IBA is a craft drinkers dream. Citrus flavors of grapefruit and lemon are balanced with a strong malt back ground

name: Dubrue Pub Ale
description: An English style session ale with a lemon citrus aroma and a coy hop background. This beer has the chops to satisfy long time craft drinkers, but is still delicate enough to entice the non-initiated.

name: Dubrue Zinger
description: A classic English brown ale with a zing of ginger in the finish. Well balanced with a rich malt character, this beer warms the cold winter nights.

name: Dubs Dubbel
description: A COMPLEX BOUQUET OF RICH CARAMEL NOTES ALONG WITH A SLIGHT NOBEL HOP CHARACTER. BREWED WITH BELGIAN PALE MALT, ABBEY MALT, CARAMEL VIENNE, BISCUIT AND AROMATIC MALTS WITH A LATE KETTLE ADDITION OF BELGIAN CANDI SYRUP AND FERMENTED WITH BELGIAN ARDENNES YEAST.

name: DucAle
description: High alcohol, strong ale - a Belgian style meditation beer. Dark brown with ruby-red shades, it forms a tall head. Dried fruit notes are evident, along with toasted hazelnut. The mouth feel is sweet and round with a good body. The flavors are long lasting, leading towards cocoa and roasted notes. Extremley drinkable beer for its strength.

name: Duchamp
description: Tart Saison showcasing notes of bright lemon and tart apricot with a lively, peppery finish.

name: Duchamp
description:
An exquisite readymade farmhouse ale; classic Saison base repositioned with 
an ample addition of meridian hops & a secondary fermentation with brettanomyces 
claussennii; rustic, earthy aromas with notes of fresh herbs, sweet lemon & spice.

name: Duchessa
description: This beer is brewed using spelt instead of barley. Spelt is traditionally harvested in the Duchess Mountains Regional Park. Duchessa has a golden colour with orange hues, and it is slightly hazy with a plentyful and creamy foam. It has a wide nose, fruity (banana, pineapple, tropical fruit) and floreal, with a light and pleasant peppery flavor. Carbonation is elegant, with a little sharpness and an appropriate body. It is moderately hoppy, with a pleasant and refreshing finish.

name: Duchesse de Bourggogne Flemish Sour
description: (Belium)  This refreshing Flanders red ale is matured in oak casks; cognac brown, it smells almost winey with hints of port or sherry.  There's something sweet/sour going on that works beautifully.

name: Duchesse de Bourgogne
description: Duchesse de Bourgogne from Brouwerij Verhaeghe is the traditional Flemish red ale. This refreshing ale is matured in oak casks; smooth with a rich texture and interplay of passion fruit, and chocolate, and a long, dry and acidic finish. After the first and secondary fermentation, the beer goes for maturation into the oak barrels for 18 months. The final product is a blend of younger 8 months old beer with 18 months old beer. The average age of the Duchesse de Bourgogne before being bottled is 12 months.

name: Duchessic
description: A sort of “collaboration brew” with the famous Belgian brewery Brasserie Cantillon: an interesting experiment about spontaneous fermentations. Our traditional Duchessa - spelt beer - has been cut with a 20% of one year old lambic from Brasserie Cantillon. The result is a unique beer that extraordinarily merges the lambic sharp and sour characteristics with the gentle notes of Duchessa. A real gem not to be missed, as the former version’s great success confirms. Try it with different kinds of cheese, especially with blue cheese.

name: Duchovni
description:
2016 World Beer Cup Gold Medal Winner!

Our rendition of a classic Bohemian-style pils. This straw-colored lager is dry, quaffable, and liberally hopped with Czech Saaz for a bit of bite.

name: Duck Dive
description: This American Style Hefeweizen is unfiltered and naturally cloudy from the generous use of imported wheat malt. It has a refreshing, bready flavor and a distinct creamy, taste and texture.  This lightly hopped beer is very enjoyable and easy to drink with a great wheat after taste.

name: Duck Duck Goose Porter
description:
Don't judge a beer by it's color, especially this medium bodied English Brown Porter.  Bold coffee and chocolate malt backbone tempered with a slight spiciness from Saaz hops.  Finishes dry with notes of chocolate, coffee, and roasted malts.

(Silver Medal Winner: Maryland Governor's Cup 2010)

name: Duck Duck Gooze
description: In Belgian brewing there are fantastic wild ales brewed with naturally occurring yeast. These beers develop over time and are ready on their own terms. Duck Duck Gooze is our homage to these effervescent and wonderfully complex sparkling beers.  A blend of young and old barrel aged beers, this has been one of our most sought after beers year after year since it’s original release in 2009.  Alas, it is released in very small quantities only once every three years, so it’s extremely difficult to come by beyond the day we release it. It does, however, turn up on our Tasting Room’s Vintage List from time to time, so don’t despair.

name: Duck Duck Juice
description: The latest in our NE Style IPA series, Duck Duck Joose is decidedly different than our first two Hazy IPAs. Built with a 50 / 50 mix of wheat and barley, we added almost no bittering hops to the batch and added massive amounts of Pacific Gem, Huell Melon, Mosaic, Simcoe, and even whole leaf Belma hops to the whirlpool and in two separate dry hops. The resulting beer has a super smooth month feel and a refreshing finish with berry notes.

name: Duck IPA
description: Duck IPA is a part of our Dodgeball Single Hop Series. This Northeastern style India Pale Ale was brewed with 100% Hellertau Blanc hops, hand selected by our Assistant Brewer Maria.

name: Duck Pond Nut Brown Ale
description: Duck Pond Nut Brown Ale pours a deep ruddy brown with a creamy off-white head. Dark brown, but not black. Toasty and nutty characters persist through the entire glass and call for another glass.

name: Duck-Rabbit Amber Ale
description: The Duck-Rabbit Amber Ale is a medium bodied beer with a lovely tawny copper or bronze color. This brew emphasizes malt complexity with layered caramel malt flavors. We put a lot of effort into getting this amber ale just right and we're extremely proud of the result!

name: Duck-Rabbit Brown Ale
description: The Duck-Rabbit Brown Ale is an American brown ale brewed with loads of hops from start to finish (it’s hoppy and beautifully bitter). Amarillo hops in the boil provide a spicy citrusy bitterness. Saaz dry hops in the fermentor provide a refined flowery aroma. These hops are supported by a grain bill of seven varieties of malt. Oh yeah!

name: Duck-Rabbit Märzen
description: Pours a brilliant auburn color with a lacy head. Aromas of clean biscuit and toffee. Sweet toasted caramel flavors with rich toffee and essences of red apple and noble hops carrying to the finish.

name: Duck-Rabbit Milk Stout
description: The Duck-Rabbit Milk Stout is a traditional full-bodied stout brewed with lactose (milk sugar). The subtle sweetness imparted by the lactose balances the sharpness of the highly roasted grains which give this delicious beer its black color.

name: Duck-Rabbit Porter
description: The Duck-Rabbit Porter is very dark in color. This robust porter features a pronounced flavor of roasted grains reminiscent of dark chocolate. Also, Paul and Brandon add oats to the grist to give a subtle round silkiness to the mouthfeel. We’re confident that you’re really going to love this yummy porter!

name: Duck-Rabbit Schwarzbier
description: This is a traditional German style dark lager beer. Flavors of chocolate or coffee are common, but usually subtle. Just because the beer is dark, doesn’t mean that the flavors are. Expect the beer to be opaque and black, as the name would imply.

name: Duck-Rabbit Wee Heavy Scotch Style Ale
name_display: Duck-Rabbit Wee Heavy Scotch Style Ale

name: Duckabush Amber
description: Pilsner, Caravienne, and Chocolate malts give this beer its beautiful, deep amber color and malty aroma. The malts are nicely balanced by UK Golding hops.

name: Duckabush Brown Ale
description: A NW Style Brown Ale Brewed with caramel and chocolate malt for a rich brown color and a nutty, toffee character. Northwest Columbus hops add a distinctive floral finish.

name: Duckpin Pale Ale
description: This generously hopped pale ale is a strike in your mouth! Brewed with lots of Pacific Northwest & New Zealand hops this beer is ten frames of big citrus and tropical fruit aroma and flavor. A strong malt backbone rounds it out and makes this pale ale a delight for the senses. The pins may be small but the flavor is huge! In our town, we roll Duckpin—a true Baltimore original.

name: Duckstein Opal
description: Duckstein Opal Pilsener Grand Cru is a bottom-fermented premium pilsner, brewed from four selected hops and malt varieties. The Opal hop gives this beer a fruity note. The use of Cascade and Hüll-Melon aroma hops, as well as the cold-hopped Madarina Bavaria produce a lean, gold-coloured beer with a balanced hop bitterness and a pronounced hoppy aroma.

name: Easy Livin' IPA
description: Easy Livin' is an IPA that you can enjoy glass after glass. It has a huge nose with aromas of tropical fruit and pine. The mouthfeel is light and refreshing. Whether or not you are relaxing on the porch or by the fire, Easy Livin' IPA makes a fine companion.

name: Easy Morning Rebel
description: Beer concept from Jersey Dan, Sixpoint sales rep in Jersey/Philadelphia. Named after his love of My Morning Jacket and his culinary inclinations: Easy = low ABV; Morning = citrus juice, breakfast; Rebel = spice! So it’s a quaffable Belgian Wit-style beer, with spices and citrus.

name: Easy On The Eyes
description: Our take on a sessionable IPA, this light-bodied ale packs a ton of flavor and aroma from the Sorachi Ace and Centennial dry-hopping. It’s the one IPA to have when you’re having more than one!

name: Easy Peasy IPA
description: If there was ever an IPA made for summer, Easy Peasy is it! Brewed with tangerine and lemon peel, and Pacific Northwest aroma hops, this is one easy-drinking IPA that will leave you thirsting for more year-round.

name: Easy Rider
description: Put on your helmet and get ready for the ride. “Easy Rider” session ale is one smooth character of a beer.  Brewed with an abundance of Maris Otter malt and five different hops including Galaxy hops from Australia! This golden hued honey is laid back and free wheelin’.  The room filling hop aroma will take you back to your first hippie experience, while you savor the flavor of this 4.5% all day sipper.

name: Easy Rider
description: Easy Rider has a bright, wonderful hop aroma that has scents of pine, citrus fruits, and grapefruit. This beer has a very clean malt character with upfront hop bitterness and flavor. Not too sweet, Easy Rider is full of hop flavor and aroma while still being very drinkable and refreshing. This beer is well balanced, with just a hint of caramel malt to support the hop bitterness.

name: Easy Rye' Da
description:
An easy drinkin’ low ABV rye India Pale Ale
