Plenty of Munich and caramalts are used to give the beer that golden hue. There are fifty-six pounds of Cascade Hops used in each 50 barrel batch that is brewed! Then we finish the beer with Willamette & Warrior Hops, (Warrior is a high-alpha acid variety of hops).

name: Mainer Weisse
description:
Berliner Weisse style sour ale aged on Maine wild blueberries and cinnamon sticks

With late-season access to some Maine wild blueberries (thanks Boston Organics!), we captured a bit of “The Way Life Should Be” in this rich, full-flavored winter sour. Mainer Weisse has a nose of ripe berry and cinnamon spice, warming hints of the holidays. It sips fruity, tart, and bold, finishing with a sweet and surely-sour bite. It is blue, and it is beautiful.

name: Mainland Lager
description: A light straw colored lager brewed with Canadian prairie malt and hops imported from Germany and the Czech Republic. This is an exceptionally refreshing and quaffable beer.

name: Maisel's Weisse Original
description:
The careful selection of the finest wheat and barley malts gives Maisel's Weisse his glowing reddish amber color and the generations of brewers traditional brewing process of bottle fermentation with yeast from our own pure breeding gives it its unique character. The fresh smell of the lees and pleasant fruity notes connects to the Antrunk with mild wort from malt, fruit and clove aroma and a touch of nutmeg. Following then unfolds for Maisel's Weisse typical, slightly fruity, spicy wheat beer flavor. 
A predicate for a particular quality.
This top quality is always incentive and an obligation for us.

name: Maitrise
description:
Imperial Farmhouse Ale (IFA)
Maitrise (“May-treese” ; translates from French as “expertise” or “mastery”) is a new world farmhouse ale crafted as a tribute to the creativity, dedication, and ingenuity required by the profession of brewing. As a truly original blend of American & German wheat & barley malts, New Zealand’s Nelson Sauvin hops, and French saison yeast, Maitrise defies classification and convention. It’s an unexpected 9.5% ABV and 80 IBU, brilliant with tropical fruit, yet balanced with a tart palate that finishes soft and dry.

name: Maize
description:
A copper ale with slight corn sweetness balanced by tartness. An aroma of subtle fruit, earthy hops, and cedar.

Story: No longer does corn shine vibrantly with blues, reds, and yellows. The beauty was lost some time ago just as many great styles of beer were during prohibition. Maize revitalizes the long-lost Kentucky Common style originating just down the road in Louisville, Kentucky.

name: Maize To Black
description: Black lager inspired by Mexican street corn

name: Maize To Black
description: Black lager inspired by Mexican street corn.

name: Majestic
description: Gracefully swaying winter wheat donates its mellow, sweet malt and golden appearance. Cool, pristine waters from ancient glaciers provide the base. Rustling Willamette hops extend a subtle bitterness to the beers personality. Taken together, the ingredients create an easily quaffable, unfiltered brew that shares with you a little bit off the tranquility of Northern Michigan in every swallow.

name: Majestic Mullet Krispy Kolsch
description: Majestic Mullet Krispy Kolsch is a golden colored ale with notes of cereal & grain. Balanced by hints of floral hop aroma & an accentuating bitterness, the nuances of the yeast add a fruity, vinous note.

name: Majic Mild
description: Spring Special - 7 differnet malts give smooth roast malt flavours with hints of coffee. Spicey bitterness and a slightly fruity hop aroma. Available Mar-May

name: Major Big Time
description: Black as sin with noticeable caramel, dark roasted malt presence and irresponsible amounts of resinous, citrusy American variety hops.

name: Major Holmes DIPA
description: Just like Major Andrew Holmes himself, this Imperial IPA is a little bit of a mystery as we will be utilizing different hops in huge quantities in each version including blends of 5 different hops and experimental varieties as they come available. The Major finishes nearly dry, leaving the lingering fruitiness with a very slight bitter note letting you know it is really an Imperial IPA.

name: Major Oak Wee Heavy Ale
description: Aged for 6 months in American oak bourbon barrels, this full-bodied, Scottish-style ale features pleasant notes of vanilla, caramel, and toasted coconut.

name: Major Tom’s Pomegranate Wheat
description: As the days get longer and planes fly higher, Major Tom’s is as refreshing as a summer vacation. This unique creation of a fruit beer is infused with pomegranate and pink peppercorn. The result is a striking straw blonde color and sweet tart finish.

name: Major Violations
description:
The Major Violations Imperial Stout is brewed yearly to “commemorate” the lows of the past season. Here is our 2011 Version:

The summer of 2011 was a memorable one in the world of collegiate football. It all started with rumblings of tattoos in Columbus. Then we heard that a champion Tiger in Alabama was still being investigated. In Eugene they were paying big money for obsolete info or something. All the while, things were quiet out of Chapel Hill when they lost a coach. Then Yahoo! took its talents to South Beach and uncovered a real mess. Enjoy this strong imperial stout to forget about the craziest summer ever, or to celebrate the your rivals’ demise.

name: Makatea
description: Makatea is a West Coast Style IPA. This IPA will be dry and hop forward. The hops used are Columbus, Amarillo, Centennial, Cascade, and Simcoe.

name: Make Believer
description: Make Believer, our session IPA, is a delicate but hoppy ale that clocks in at just 5% ABV and is loaded with Citra and Galaxy hops.

name: Make It So (Batch No. 19) - Unchained Series
name_display: Make It So (Batch No. 19) - Unchained Series
description: An ESB infused with Earl Grey Tea? Make It So!

name: Make It So!
description: An homage to the Captain. This English-style ale is built on an American 2-Row base with biscuit, aromatic, and a bit of caramel malt.  We ferment this ale first, then infuse it with locally sourced Earl Grey tea and let it condition a little bit longer to integrate the flavors.  Instead of using any bittering hops, we rely on the tea to give this brew it’s bitters.  Complemented by just a touch of Tettnanger hops to accentuate the bergamot.  Engage!

name: Martinsville Pale Ale
description: This American brewpub staple is perfect when one wants a superbly-balanced, malted, hoppy brew, without the “hop attack” that comes with some IPAs. Three Pints’ brewpub was established in Plainfield, Indiana, and the Martinsville brewery opened a few short years later. The Martinsville Pale Ale represents everything Three Pints does best—develop delectable, local brews that highlight Indiana’s long-standing domination in the craft of brewing. IBU: 51. Tastiness Level: Hoosier Perfection.

name: Marty
description: Marty Belgian-style Blonde- Marty is the flagship beer of Black Cloister Brewing Company. Martin Luther, the 16th century rebel monk who spearheaded the Reformation, lived in the original Black Cloister with his wife Katie who was an accomplished brewer. Marty is a classic Blonde with medium body accompanied by Pils malt sweetness, subtle spiciness from Saaz hops, and notes of banana and clove.

name: Marty Stouffer's Wild America
description: A tribute Barley Wine to wildlife's quintessential badass, Marty Stouffer. When hoisted young, this beer is hop forward, but some time brings forward the grains and their sweetness.

name: Marty's Hamilton Ave IPA
description: Orangish gold color with minimal hop bitterness for an IPA, but tons of hop aroma and flavor to complement the honey and rich malt backbone. Six varieties of hops give this beer its bold fresh citrus and tropical fruit aroma and flavor. Hints of black pepper linger in the finish.

name: Marvellous
description: Brewed for Roy Shorrocks birthday (The Hawaiian shirt day) Plae ale single hopped with lots of Roy's favourite hop Cascade

name: Marvin the Marzen
description: This Lager might seem a little alien to those expecting an ale but never fear, Marzen (or Oktoberfest), is characterized by a malty aroma and not very hoppy at all. Yeah, Marvin is a little full of himself, but maybe he should be – after all, he is very filling and his hubris is kinda cute. Similar to a red Vienna Lager, but a little less robust.

name: Mary
description: Mary was Edward's mother and our great-grandmother. A German-style pilsner brewed with our well water, American 2-row malt, our favorite German hops, classic German lager yeast. 5.7% abv.

name: Mary Ann
description: Just in time for summer, a German-style lager brewed with generous amounts of freshly grated ginger. Refreshing and spicy. Delicious and bold. A perfect companion for getting stranded on your own personal island, because you can’t have Mary Ann without ginger.

name: Mary Hoppins English Summer Ale
description: Brewed with Maris Otter Pale, light crystal malt, and a spoonful of sugar, this beer goes down in the most delightful way, with an upfront malty roundness matched by an herbal, floral hop character from UK Sovereigns. It measures up to be practically perfect in every way. O.G. 12.5 Plato, 4.2% ABV, 30 IBUs

name: Mary Jane
description: Mary Jane IPA is a Trans-Atlantic India Pale Ale. Relying on the English hops for bittering, the star of the show is the North American hop aroma, deceptively smooth on the palate building to a hoppy crescendo. Based on the award-winning Yorkshire classic Mary Jane, it has a floral aroma, notes of honey and a pleasant lingering bitterness to finish.

name: Mary Shroom
description: Brewed with rosemary & a blend of 6 varieties of culinary mushrooms, this ale hearkens back to the days when hunters foraged for food whilst hunting for game.  Rich with earthy Umami character and spicy rosemary aromas on top of warming malts and herbal farmhouse yeast, this ale is perfect with a savory dinner!

name: Mary’s Maple Porter
description:
Mary Wiles joined our brewery team after spending 30 years brewing and doing quality control for a Very, Very Big Brewer. Mary evolved into a craft beer brewer, and now she’s doing our quality control, having fun while helping us make sure that Brooklyn beers are tasting great and ready to make you happy. But Mary has a bright thing lurking in her past, present and future – Mary has maple trees. A lot of maple trees. Actually, a ridiculous number of maple trees, acres of them, right northwest of us in upstate New York. And her family farm makes 100% real New York State maple syrup.
Real maple syrup tastes great on pancakes and waffles, but it’s awfully good in beer too. Porter is a classic British ale style that traveled to the United States, sustained George Washington during the Revolution, and later built London’s great breweries. Mary’s Maple Porter is a rich, dark ale featuring a large portion of her maple syrup in the kettle. After fermentation by our house ale yeast, the syrup is no longer sweet (yeast likes to eat maple syrup too), but the maple flavor shows through in a complex interplay with caramel, chocolate, and cof fee flavors from our blend of roasted malts. An earthy hop note rounds it all out.
For more information on Mary's syrup, visit the Cedarvale Maple Syrup Co.

name: März Attacks
description: Our März Attacks is a rich amber lager with a clean, toasty, and bready malt flavor and a subdued hop presence.

name: Marzen
description: The style is characterized by a medium to full body, a malty flavor, and a clean dry finish, while downplaying the hop level.

name: Marzen
description: The Blue Stallion Märzen, a rich malty beer with a hint of hop bitterness. The beautiful copper color reflects the caramel and pilsner malt in this seasonal brew. Märzen, also known as an Oktoberfest-style beer, originated for the celebration of King Ludwig I wedding in 1810 and has been a Bavaria tradition ever since. The Märzen/Oktoberfest style beer which is served during the celebration is often brewed in the spring and held cold over the summer to be tapped in spectacular fashion at the beginning of Oktoberfest in Munich. Our take on the style is slightly bitter with a pale head and is served in both liter and half-liter sizes.

name: Märzen
description: Märzen - German Style Lagers

name: Marzen
description: Highly malty coppery lager. This beer has a crisp finish with slight hop aromas.

name: Märzen
description: Brewers Collection

name: Marzen
description: This sweet, malty, caramel colored beer relies on traditional German lager yeast and two-thirds Munich Malt to produce its excellence. The flavor finishes dry in the true lager style and makes it an easy-drinker. A fan favorite only available twice a year in October and March. Anticipate and enjoy!

name: Marzen
description: A Smooth German style lager featuring a slight bready malt note and a clean smooth finish.

name: Märzen
description:
In former times the Brauordnung ("brewing ordinance") decreed, that brewing was allowed only from Michaelmas (29. September) to George (23. April). To bridge the resulting gap, brewers made a special beer, which was longer durable: The Märzen.
Some more hop and stronger boiling of the brew helped to cover the summer times. And we do the same now.

name: Marzen
description: A German style amber Lager also known as Oktoberfest. Deep orange in color with a medium body. Smooth, clean, rather rich and slightly toast, with a depth of malt character. Brewed with 2-Row Malt, Pilsner Malt, Vienna Malt and Dark Munich Malt. Hopped with Tettnang and Hallertau hops and German lager yeast. Marzen is a Seasonal and contains 4.9% ABV.

name: Marzen
description: Märzen, the German word for "March" was historically the last beer brewed in the spring. Traditionally, Märzenbier is a pale lager that originated in Bavaria before the 16th century and was consumed throughout Oktoberfest at the end of September. Our Märzen is a vibrant orange color. You will get caramel and biscuit aromas leading to a malty, mellow, and mild taste. Enjoy this seasonal while it lasts.

name: Menifee Valley Harvest
description: This delicious IPA was brewed and dry hopped with mosaic, citra and zythos hops. Very citrus forward and incredibly delicious.

name: Mentol
description: This super hoppy and super malty brown IPA was brewed with our friend James from Brodie’s Fabulous Ales in the “fashionable” East End of London.

name: Mephistopheles'
description:
Mephistopheles is the crafty shape shifter, the second fallen angel. Amazingly complex, coal black, velvety and liqueurish, this demon has a bouquet of vine-ripened grapes, anise and chocolate covered cherries with flavors of rum-soaked caramelized dark fruits and a double espresso finish. Cellarable for 10+ years.

Mephistopheles is the final installment of “The Demons of Ale” series.

name: Mephistopheles’ Metamorphosis
description: Begian Tripple brewed with 100 percent Pilsner malt and a blend of three Belgian yeasts which impart a fruity and spicy flavor and aroma.

name: Merci Buckets Saison
description: Merci Buckets Saison Ale Brewed with Lavender, Linden flower and Coriander. This French Styled Saison is infused with elegant french herbs to create a light refreshing fall beer that tastes amazing either alone or paired with food. This herbal elixir engages the senses with a unique floral remedy that will have you politely saying thank you before ordering another one. Merci Buckets Saison is the herbal cure from the ordinary beer that ales ya.

name: Mercury - Belgian Style Small Beer
description: Messenger of the gods, Mercury symbolizes commerce, travel, thievery, wit and wealth. MERCURY cleverly stole its essence from mistress lover VENUS. Second runnings of the voluptuous quadrupel created this small yet fascinating beer. Indian coriander acknowledges the traveler; a distinct Belgian yeast contributes wit & charm.

name: Mercy
description: Our Belgian style Grand Cru is a full bodied winter warmer. It has an aroma of dark fruits and rich caramel flavors in perfect balance with the slightly sweet finish. Part of our Limited Asylum seasonal series, Mercy is available on tap and in six packs at your favorite craft beer outlet from November through January-ish.

name: Meredith Marzen
description: The Meredith Marzen is our first ever true lager brewed at Avondale. The Marzen style of beer is also known as an Oktoberfest style, traditionally brewed in March and cellared in caves until the end of summer. It was a special beer to be drank at Oktoberfest in Bavaria. The finest malts from the previous year crops were used to brew this premium lager in celebration of the new brewing season. The brew has a deep golden hue. The aroma is clean and malty. Malt is the major player in this brew and it dominates the palate. The rich malt character is derived from mostly vienna and munich malt. The vienna malt adds a toasty and biscuity flavor that is balanced by the sweet munich malt.

name: Merica
description: Merica is a single malt, single hop farmhouse ale. It’s brewed with floor malted pilsner and 3lbs per bbl Nelson Sauvin hops. The beer is conditioned with 2 brett strains and wine yeast. The Nelson hops provide white wine flavors while Brettanomyces add a juicy quality to the beer.

name: Meridian
description: An IPA dry hopped with meridian and mosaic, hazy & juicy.

name: Meridian Fresh Hop Pale Ale
description: This traditional pale ale is brewed within 24 hours of harvesting the fresh hops from a local hop farm in Parma, Idaho. With being the first brewery in Meridian, it was an easy decision to use Meridian fresh hops which adds crisp flavors of lemon and tropical fruit. Available early fall until its gone.

name: Meridian Kolsch
description: From Meridian Hill across the Prime Meridian, wherever you’re headed, travel light with our classic Kolsch. The perfect companion to keep you fresh even days after your last real shower.

name: Meridiano Ø
description: The "zero" Is The Prime Meridian, That Goes From Greenwich, On The Hills Overlooking London: Hence The Creation Of Our Bitter Ale, Fundamental In Its Simplicity. Amber-colored Hues, Has Its Fulcrum In The Qualities Of The Hops And Of The Caramel Malts. Excellent As A Simple Drink, Goes Perfectly With Fresh Cheeses, Cold Cuts, Risotto, Grilled Vegetables And Roasted White Meats.

name: Merlot à Trois
description:
A Belgian Triple aged in oak Merlot barrels from a local winery for 4
months. The fruit flavors picked up in the barrel compliment the character of the Belgian yeast.

name: Mermaid Pilsner
description: A dry hopped American Rye Pilsener. Obey the siren song of the mythological Coney Island Mermaid. Four spicy hops flow into seven golden malts. Perfect as a momentary distraction, or equally enchanting as a parade towards deeper delights. When beer tastes this good, and you don’t have scurvy, you don’t need a lime!

name: Mermaid's Red Ale - Bourbon Oak Aged

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

beer_variation.description: A well balanced, medium-to full bodied beer, red in color and very flavorful. The red color and slight caramel-roasted flavor comes from generous amounts of caramel malts and a touch of chocolate malts. Well hopped to balance the malty sweetness, and dry-hopped with cascade for a full hop flavor and aroma.

style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.
style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale

beer_variation.name: Mermaids Red Ale

name_display: Mermaid's Red Ale - Bourbon Oak Aged

name: Mermaids Red Ale
description: A well balanced, medium-to full bodied beer, red in color and very flavorful. The red color and slight caramel-roasted flavor comes from generous amounts of caramel malts and a touch of chocolate malts. Well hopped to balance the malty sweetness, and dry-hopped with cascade for a full hop flavor and aroma.

name: Merry Buffing Christmas
description:
Piney and resinous with a bit of spice from the rye, you'll want this beer full of holiday cheer and our Christmas present to Houston: a rye IPA with spruce tips.

It's dank with a subtle citrus nose. Fresh spruce tips give a strong pine forward flavor and Chinook and Amarillo hops meld with the rye to brighten up the finish with a nice bit of spice.

name: Merry Christmas
description: Ale handcrafted with cinnamon, vanilla beans, nutmeg, and allspice

name: Merry Christmas & Happy New Year (Our Special Ale)
name_display: Merry Christmas & Happy New Year (Our Special Ale) (2016)
description: A deliciously smooth winter warmer with notes of seasonal spices and a malty backbone, our 2016 Christmas Ale marks the 42nd annual release of this celebrated Anchor tradition.

name: Merry Maker
description: This rich dark gingerbread stout entices with the aromas of the holidays.  The flavor of gingerbread comes alive, beginning with the smooth sweetness and heartiness of dark roasted malts and a touch of wheat.  But it’s the intensity and spices of cinnamon, clove, nutmeg, & ginger that add a wicked kick for a jolly playful brew full of merry mischief.

name: Merry Monks
description:
Merry Monks’ is a Belgian-style Tripel. Pilsner malt combined with an abbey yeast strain yields a remarkable and complex flavor packed with notes of spice, banana and pear. Nicely balanced, with a moderate to dry finish.

Merry Monks is bottle conditioned which imparts a special effervescence to the beer and a creamier carbonation. 9.3% ABV. The ongoing fermentation inside the bottle will change the character of the beer as it ages and you’ll find it becomes dryer with age. You may want to lay down a few bottles for future evaluation. We suggest storing at cellar temperatures – around 55°F – and away from light.

This 9.3% brew is available year-round. Keep your eye out for Merry Monks’ Ale in 25 oz. cork-and-cage champagne bottles for an exceptional experience!

name: Merry Widows
description: We brewed this Russian Imperial Stout to honor the legendary Joe Cain, Mobile's savior of Mardi Gras, and the women who love him, his Merry Widows. Each year on the Sunday before Mardi Gras, they gather at Joe's grave to mourn his passing, and we hope this namesake beer makes that mourning just a little easier as they toss black roses and beads from Joe's eternal resting place.

name: Merseyside Barleywine
description: An English style Barleywine coming in at 10% abv. This brew highlights huge malty richness with flavors of toffee, biscuit, and caramel lending a chewy mouth-feel. Mild alcohol warmth. Hopped with traditional English hops Fuggles and EKG. Great beer for cellaring.

name: Mershon's Artisan Cider
description: Our original artisan cider made from only fresh pressed apple juice and  wildflower honey, No suplhites or preservatives added.

name: Mershon's Death Valley Dry
description:
Our newest offering, dry as a scorching summer in the Southwest. 
This honey apple wine is a stronger counterpart to our original cider. 
Made with more wildflower honey, this mead like cider finishes at 10%.

name: Mershon's Mystic Berry Cider
description:
Mershon's Mystic Berry Cider is the culmination of sweet midwest 
flavors.  Made with fresh strawberries, blackberries, and raspberries
fermented with fresh pressed apple juice and wildflower honey.  
This berry cider will excite the senses through notes of tart and sweet
berry and apple, to remind us of all the good things that grow in 
Wisconsin after the harsh winters.

name: Millions Of Peaches
description: A bright saison aged briefly of fresh North Carolina peaches.

name: Mills Big Brew
description: Inspired by the winning entry from our annual Big Brew Day & Michigan Homebrew competition, which drew over 300 brewers who brewed over 1,000 gallons of beer in our parking lot. This year's winning entry (an Imperial IPA) was submitted by homebrewer Zachary Typinski.

name: Mills Pils
description: The Mills Pils is light golden color and crystal clear. Hops are very prevalent with a spicy bitterness and a floral flavor and aroma. Smooth and crisp with a clean palate making this an enjoyable early summer brew. One of the most eagerly anticipated Seasonal Releases at the pub and a brewers favorite.

name: Milly's Famous Pumpkin Ale
description: This is one of our most popular beers. Brewed with fresh picked New Hampshire grown pumpkins and lightly spiced. Try a pint rimmed with our house blend of sugar and spices. Get this one fast, before it's all gone!

name: Milly's Oatmeal Stout
description: A semi-sweet oatmeal stout packed with lots of rolled oats to make it full bodied and smooth.

name: Milly's Oatmeal Stout
description: Our award winning ale is a traditional sweet stout. Rolled oats bring out the flavor and richness. It is full bodied and is a meal in itself.

name: Milton's Madness - I Said No Salt!
name_display: Milton's Madness - I Said No Salt!
description: Back up in your glass with the resurrection of our Margarita-Style Melomel. A Margarita-inspired product was begging for an Office Space-inspired label. Milton’s Madness has “no salt”, just the way he ordered it.

name: Milwaukee's Best Ice
description: Ice brewed for a crisp, bold taste

name: Milwaukee's Best Light
description: Milwaukee's Best Light is Miller Brewing Company's lead low-calorie brand in the near-premium segment. Brewed to uncompromising standards using select pale malt, cereal grains and yeast, this is a smooth, highly drinkable beer at an affordable price. Available nationwide, Miller first rolled out Milwaukee's Best Light in 1986 with an ambition to become the beer choice for guys. Our marketing, including sponsorship with the World Series of Poker and award-winning TV spots, takes a humorous approach to reinforce the idea that \Men should act like men and light beer should taste like beer.""""

name: Milwaukie's Better Pilsner
description: If this beer were any more Portland, it would own the Timbers. It's made with 100% Pilsner malt and German-derived, but Northwest-grown noble hop varieties - Mt. Hood and Liberty. With no adjuncts or dilution with carbonated water, this is a quality, flavorful pilsener.

name: Mimbres Red Ale
description: A malty Red Ale brewed with 5 different malts.

name: Mimi's Breakfast Stout
description: The foundation of Mimi’s is crafted from dark roasted malts, flaked oats and resiny whole cone hops. Doses of pure maple syrup, Dutch cocoa and semisweet chocolate are added directly to the boil kettle. As a finishing touch, we infuse the fermented beer with locally roasted Guatemalan coffee beans. Mimi’s is a jet black full bodied stout with complex flavor and smooth coffee aroma.

name: Mimi's Tabernacle
description: Bourbon Barrel Aged Breakfast Stout.

name: Mind Control
description: This tart, refreshing wheat was brewed with local strawberries and rhubarb from our friends at Barr's Farms. A perfect way to celebrate the Summer!

name: Mind Drive
description: Like it's little brother Tribal Rite, Mind Drive is dark black with a thick, khaki-colored head. This extremely robust porter pushes forward strong notes of milk chocolate and roasted barley to later be subdued by a rich sweetness from an abundance of oats. Complimented with a soft amount of pleasantly mild hops, Mind Drive is a world class treat.

name: Mind Left Body
description: Brewed with Phil “Brewdaddy” Bannatyne’s favorite hop variety, Centennial, throughout the boil and extensive dryhopping. This beer has the hop character of a IPA but the low-ABV of a session-able pale ale. Grassy/citrus hop character dominates the nose and palate with notes of white grapefruit and pine needles, finishing with an aggressive grapefruit-pith bitterness. You can ask Brewdaddy about the name.

name: Mind's Eye P.A.
description: Burnt copper color and giant hop aroma come to the forefront in this traditional American IPA. Rich caramel malt and red wheat balance the dry bitter finish of this full-flavor craft brew.

name: Mindbender IPA
description: Assertive notes of grapefruit and pine, balanced by American 2-Row Pale and Munich malts.

name: Mindolas Granola Oatmeal Stout
description: Our Oatmeal Stout is smooth and creamy and includes English toasted wheat, roasted barley and oats.

name: Mine Is Bigger Than Yours
description:
This beer is a big fat beast packed with every potent ingredient we had at the brewery. This has tons of malts and hops combined in one big fat, yet balanced brew.

It jumps higher than yours, it builds houses bigger than yours, Its mama is fatter than yours, it chops wood faster than yours, its father could beat yours…. No reason to say, but Mine is bigger than yours!

name: Mine Shaft Kolsch
description: Brewed with our house yeast; our Kolch is a clean crisp light colored Ale. Made with a variety of 3 different German hops, this brew leaves you with a prominent but not extreme hoppiness flavor. Not one to abandon so tap into this brew and take pleasure.

name: Miner
description: Miner is a grisette-style ale made with wheat and sweet orange peel. While farmers' wives once served their farmhand husband's saison's in the belgian countryside, coalminers' wives did the same for their husbands--in their "gris" smocks. Wouldn't we all love to see our wonderfully talented wives standing outside our proverbial coal mines with a small, sweet, refreshing beer.

name: Miner Extra Pale Ale (XPA)
description: This flagship XPA is crisp right from the start. It goes down smoothly, and satisfies with a tingly mouth feel throughout. It has a nice light hoppy flavor lingers on the tongue long after the swallow. It represents a nice session beer that would be best served by the pitcher, as just one wouldn’t be enough.

name: Miner Light
description:
Delicate white head, simple, very mild beer character with a crisp, refreshing and dry finish

Sandi’s signature: Two-Row barley & German Hallertauer hops.

name: Miner's Dopplebock
description: Limited Release

name: Miner's Gold
description: Our most popular beer is brewed as an unfiltered Hefeweizen in American Wheat Style this beer is light in body and very refreshing ready to quench even the most powerful thirst. This beer won a Gold Medal at the North American Brewers Association Brew Fest!

name: Miner's Gold
description: Golden ale with a strong malt aroma from the 2-row, 6-row and Munich malts within. Has a matching front-end sweetness, but finishes clean with an accent of Lublin hops.

name: Miners Wheat Ale
description: An All-American filtered wheat ale. American grown Pale and wheat malts with Willamette Valley hops combine to give Miner's Wheat Ale a crisp malt presence that is swept away by citrusy floral hops. A real summertime crowd pleaser!

name: Miner’s Daughter Oatmeal Stout
description:
Coal Black and creamy smooth, this beer holds a light tan head and is surprisingly light in body – so it won’t fill you up. 5.3% ABV.

Thomas, WV’s heritage was based on the hard-working immigrant coal miners who worked the mines from the 1890s-1940s. The tap handle is the silhouette of a local coal miner’s daughter.

name: Miner’s Treasure Amber Ale
description:
One of our most popular offerings, this ale is deep amber to mahogany in color and has a clean toasted and caramel malt taste.

The beer has a medium to light mouth feel that is lightly hopped. It has a sweet finish which is reminiscent of sweet raisin bread.

name: Minesweeper IPA
description: Rustic, West Coast-style IPA with a pronounced juicy, citrus-forward hop aroma & flavor. Dry hopped at a rate of 3 lbs per barrel with Simcoe, Citra, and a few mystery hops.

name: Minglewood 2.0 IPA
description: This American barley wine has a sweet candy-like aroma with notes of citrus, peach, and plum.  Centennial hops decorate the sweet caramel flavor and linger long into the blushing finish.

name: Minglewood American Blonde Ale
description: Made with American Malts, Yeast, and Hops, this brilliantly clear Blonde Ale has a malty backbone with a sweet and refreshing finish.  It’s a light sessionable beer brewed with the recent craft beer converts in mind.

name: Minglewood American Brown Lager
description: A light, smooth brown lager with a crisp lager finish.  This is a clean beer with a smooth mouthfeel, light roastiness  and small hints of caramel.

name: Monkey Paw Cornelius IIPA
description: Cornelius is an archetypal san diego iipa. the beer pours a bright gold with a sticky white head. the aroma explodes out of the glass with pine, orange and grapefruit. the taste follows the nose, with a nice distinct bitterness. a perfect iipa at 9.6% abv and 100+ ibus, with a deceptive, easy to drink side to it.

name: Monkey Paw Free Ken Allen Robust Rye
name_display: Monkey Paw Free Ken Allen Robust Rye

name: Monkey Paw Howler IPA
description: Bright, clean, citrus, floral, tropical, dry… everything a san diego-style ipa should be. with a liberal addition of centennial and meridian hops, you get a good note of orange and pine. the malt takes a back seat in this beer, and really leaves the hops to be the star. an easy to drink, fantastic ipa for every day drinking.

name: Monkey Paw Kong Barleywine
description: Kong is a big beast of a beer, from the hop, dark fruit, and apricot aroma, to the bold grass notes on the palate, to the bitter finish. kong weighs in at 11.8% abv, and is a beer that can unleash the beast in you if not treated with respect. despite the size of this beer, the balance of hops and malt are well-executed, with an interplay throughout the beer. plums, earthy malt, and jam compliment the columbus hop base. truly a beer worthy of the name kong.

name: Monkey Puzzle
description: extra strong ale - Belgium style ale full of … everything.  10% abv - ya don't mess with the Monkey!

name: Monkey Stones
description: Monkey Stones is a collaboration between Monkey Paw and brewer Jeremy Moynier from Stone Brewing Company. After some discussion, we decided to make a black lager, with a bit of Stone flair. This is a strong, 7.7%, black, toasty beer with attitude. Roast, toasted almonds, and a pine-filled hop aroma are first on the nose. As the beer warms up, you notice a lot of chocolate and orange, with a solid hop bite. The taste is similar, but smooth, hoppy, and delicious. This is not your typical black lager. Do you have the stones to drink it?

name: Monkey Tail
description: Chocolate Banana Stout

name: Monkey Wrench
description: An outstanding example of a classic Saison Ale, with refreshing hints of lemon and pepper. An epic tale of adventure and exploration, this crisp golden-colored ale is brewed to impart the secrets of a higher intelligence through its monolithic flavor. Brewed with an imported Belgian Saison yeast strain for a complexity that’s tart and crisp, with an array of earthy and mineral tones.

name: Monkey's Uncle Munich-Style Dunkle Lager Beer
name_display: Monkey's Uncle Munich-Style Dunkle Lager Beer

name: Monkey-Boy
description: Swinging from tank to tank around here, we've come up with the perfect way to enjoy a bright sparkling taste of summer, no matter what the season may be.  Now a year round offering, this fresh local hefeweizen carries a distinct banana ester profile, and crisp finish. No bananas were harmed or peeled in the brewing of this beer. It's just a little side benefit that our German yeast strain gives us.

name: MonkeyBoy Ale
description: Made for Wedding

name: Monkeynaut IPA
description: Albert. Able. Gordo. Miss Baker. Bonny. Goliath. Between 1948 and 1961 these primate pioneers and others bravely went where no man had ever gone before, paving the way for manned U.S. spaceflight. This hoppy little monkey of a beer is a tribute to those Simian heroes of yesteryear. It has a citrusy, floral hop aroma, a strong malt body and a crisp finish.

name: Monkey’s Dunkel
description:
This is a traditional Munchener Dunkel (Dark Munich) style bier, fashioned after the original lagers of Europe before the advent of pale biers. Dunkels still enjoy great popularity in Bavaria and for good reason. Their nutty and toasty maltiness is neither too sweet nor overly roasty, making for a beer that is satisfying and very drinkable. The use of Munich malt as a base gives this beer its dark brown color and unique malty aroma and flavor. German hops give this beer a subtle earthy undertone with a clean finish. Monkey’s Dunkel is a signature series of Cory Buenning, whose love for traditional styled lagers is very apparent in this brew. The alcohol content is 4.6% .

North American Brewers Fest 1998 -Silver  - Munich Dark Lager

name: Monkey’s Uncle
description: Monkey’s Uncle is COTU’s take on a classic beer style from Belgium – the Tripel.  Pilsner malt is the primary building block, providing a light crisp body and straw color.  Small amounts of German Munich and Vienna malts add further color and sweetness.  Belgian Candi Sugar and fresh lemongrass, added during the boil, contributes more fermentables and aromtaics, while at the same time lightening the body further.  Lightly hopped, this beer was fermented with a yeast strain originating from one of Belgium’s celebrated breweries.

name: Monkmans Slaughter
description:
Champion Beer of Britain - GOLD MEDAL WINNER YEAR 2000 - Strong Beer Category

A full bodied powerful brew, dark brown with a very distinct malty flavour using finest crushed pale, crystal and roasted malts, which combine perfectly with Kent Challenger and Goldings hops. Very strong and extremely moreish.

Named after Mr. Monkman who grows the malt, and Mr. Slaughter our brewer and chemist. Unwittingly we have given the two chaps an ideal alibi: they now feel duty bound to sit at the end of the bar and check that the end product is worthy of their names!

name: Monks Belgian Ale
description: This beer uses a Belgian Bastogne yeast that gives the brew a banana aroma and a clove flavor.

name: Monks' Ale
description: Monks’ Ale is an excellent session ale with a distinct aroma of cloves and moderate fruity esters (particularly stone fruits).  The yeast lends a note of clove and in combination with the malts, hints of plum and apricot.  The malts provide a distinct honeyish quality up front and round full middle.  The malts and yeast leave a clean, crisp, dry, finish to Monks’ Ale.

name: Monks' Dark Ale
description: Monks’ Dark Ale is a well-balanced medium bodied ale with a smooth creamy mouthfeel, good carbonation, and no alcohol warmth or astringency.  The aromas are predominantly hazelnut and chocolate with hints of raisins and stone fruits, with no diacetyl evident.  This ale pours with nice lacing and a lasting tan head.  Flavors include toasted hazelnuts, raisins, caramel malt, and mild green apples. No phenols are evident.  The subdued, yet present hops create a light, crisp, refreshing, taste.  The finish is dry with mild caramel and green apples and a slight roastiness, inviting another sip of this all-season dark signature ale.

name: Monks' Dubbel Ale
description:
Monks’ Dubbel® Ale is a full-flavored and well-balanced ale with an attractive amber glow.  Enticing yeast-driven aromas of banana bread, cotton candy, and treacle are a pleasant prelude to flavors of toasted walnut, dark fruit, and caramelized sugar.  Mildly spicy and earthy hops artfully balance its full-bodied maltiness, yielding to a long, crisp, complex finish. This pleasant old world hop character provides a delightful counterpoint in this remarkably harmonious ale.

Awards:

Gold Medal - NM State Fair, 2014

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

beer_variation.foodPairings: Monks’ Dubbel® Ale pairs well with beef or lamb, especially barbecues or meat stews and makes an excellent chocolate dessert accompaniment.  It is also a wonderful pairing to washed rind cheeses and dried fruits.

style.description: This medium-bodied, red to dark brown colored ale has a malty sweetness and chocolate-like caramel aroma. A light hop flavor and/or aroma is acceptable. Dubbels are also characterized by low-medium to medium bitterness. No diacetyl is acceptable. Yeastgenerated fruity esters (especially banana) are appropriate at low levels. Head retention is dense and mousse-like. Chill haze is acceptable at low serving temperatures. Often bottle conditioned a slight yeast haze and flavor may be evident.
style.name: Belgian-Style Dubbel

beer_variation.name: Monks' Dubbel Ale
beer_variation.description:
Monks’ Dubbel® Ale is a full-flavored and well-balanced ale with an attractive amber glow.  Enticing yeast-driven aromas of banana bread, cotton candy, and treacle are a pleasant prelude to flavors of toasted walnut, dark fruit, and caramelized sugar.  Mildly spicy and earthy hops artfully balance its full-bodied maltiness, yielding to a long, crisp, complex finish. This pleasant old world hop character provides a delightful counterpoint in this remarkably harmonious ale.

Awards:

Gold Medal - NM State Fair, 2014

name: Monks' Dubbel Reserve
description: Monks’ Dubbel Reserve® Ale is a full, complex-flavored and balanced ale with an attractive dark amber glow. Enticing yeast and hop-driven aromas of banana bread, cotton candy, herbs, spices, treacle, and hint of mint are a pleasant prelude to flavors of toasted walnut and caramelized sugar. Distinctly herbal, spicy and flowery hops artfully balance its full-bodied maltiness, yielding to a long, crisp, complex finish and showcasing a delightful counterpoint in this remarkably harmonious ale.

name: Monks' Tripel Ale
description:
Monks’ Tripel Ale is distinctly fruity and spicy with a light body, pleasant alcoholic warmth, and a crisp, dry finish.  The yeast lends notes of peach, apricot, and plum, which support a complex chorus of traditional flavors.  European hops bring balance to the long layers of yeast character by providing a spicy and herbaceous harmony of flavor.  A subtle and soft malt character provides the perfect foundation to showcase this beer’s unique and intricate complexity.

Awards:
Silver Medal - Denver International Beer Competition, 2014

Silver Medal - NM State Fair, 2014

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

beer_variation.foodPairings: Spiced foods, lamb, roasted foul, poultry, and any creamy, soft-ripened cheese or fruit.

style.description: Tripels are often characterized by a complex, sometimes mild spicy character. Clove-like phenolic flavor and aroma may be evident at extremely low levels. Yeast-generated  fruity esters, including banana, are also common, but not necessary. These pale/light-colored ales may finish sweet, though any sweet finish should be light. The beer is characteristically medium and clean in body with an equalizing hop/malt balance and a perception of medium to medium high hop bitterness. Traditional Belgian Tripels are often well attenuated. Brewing sugar may be used to lighten the perception of body. Its sweetness will come from very pale malts. There should not be character from any roasted or dark malts. Low hop flavor is acceptable. Alcohol strength and flavor should be perceived as evident. Head retention is dense and mousse-like. Chill haze is acceptable at low serving temperatures. Traditional Tripels are bottle conditioned, may exhibit slight yeast haze but the yeast should not be intentionally roused. Oxidative character if evident in aged Tripels should be mild and pleasant.
style.name: Belgian-Style Tripel

beer_variation.name: Monks' Tripel Ale
beer_variation.description:
Monks’ Tripel Ale is distinctly fruity and spicy with a light body, pleasant alcoholic warmth, and a crisp, dry finish.  The yeast lends notes of peach, apricot, and plum, which support a complex chorus of traditional flavors.  European hops bring balance to the long layers of yeast character by providing a spicy and herbaceous harmony of flavor.  A subtle and soft malt character provides the perfect foundation to showcase this beer’s unique and intricate complexity.

Awards:
Silver Medal - Denver International Beer Competition, 2014

Silver Medal - NM State Fair, 2014

name: Monks' Tripel Reserve Ale
description: Monks’ Tripel Reserve Ale is distinctly fruity and spicy with a light body, low alcohol notes, slight crispness, and nice mouthfeel.  The yeast lends notes of peach with some apricot and plum.  The hops bring balance and add a slight earthy and light herbal, spicy (pepper) flavor.  The barley malts provide a rich quality up front, and a round fullness in the middle.  The finish is clean and dry with light hints of citrus fruits and mint.

name: Monks' Wit
description: Monks’ Wit has a complex yeast character that lends a robust profile that accentuates the imported coriander, tangy orange peel, and other spices.  The pale malt provides a sweet, bready quality that is the perfect backdrop to the intricacy created by the traditional yeast and spice. The wheat and oats lend a creamy taste and a velvety elegance. The imported hops and spices give a clean, dry finish to this light, refreshing ale.

name: Monkshine
description: Belgian yeast and American grains provide the distinct character and flavors of this blonde ale.

name: Monk’s Lunch
description:
While most savvy beer consumers have heard of Belgian Dubbels, Tripels and Quadruples, few have ever had a Belgian-style Enkel, meaning “Single”. This is an ale rarely, if ever, brewed on the West Coast, let alone America.

Typically, Monk’s Lunch is brewed only at Trappist Monasteries for the monks to enjoy with meals. They often drink only half a bottle with lunch and the rest with supper, despite the beer’s low alcohol content. This beer is modest in strength, robed in warm, golden hues and soft on the palate with a smooth, dry finish.

name: Monogamy
description:
Single Hop Series

Our single hop series has been a delicious and interesting experiment into the diverse world of hops. Following an identical recipe but only changing one variable each time (the hop) we've been able to study the exact aromatics and flavours imparted by specific varieties. Not unlike the series launched by Mikkeller, here at Bellwoods our Monagamy brews are all about settling down with one love. Yes, when ordering this beer in the brewpub the jokes are endless (ie. “I'm not so sure about monogamy” or “I tried monogamy once and never really liked it” or the oft hilarious “I guess I'll have it because my girlfriend/boyfriend is sitting beside me”) but stop being a wise-ass. Even the polygamous can't deny the allure of this beer.

name: MONOLITH
description: Our American Imperial Stout aged in bourbon barrels! It's a smooth and chocolatey stout with a touch of rye.

name: Monomoy Kriek
description: Two year old Nantucket Flemish-style red aged on whole sour cherries for 10 months. This is similar to sipping the idea of what a "cherry" is... UNREAL.

name: Monsho
description: Belgian-style lager w/ chrysanthemum

name: Monsoon
description: For all of you Hop-Heads out there! Hopped with Tim Etter’s home grown Mt. Hood and Cascade hops.

name: Monsoon Mud
description:
Deep rich stout, 
medium body with a 
great creamy character.
Hints of coffee, chocolate & 
caramel from the blend of malts.

name: Mr. Frederiksen
description:
Even when poured into the glass, felt it right away that Mr. Frederiksen is a gentleman with both power and great personality. Pitch-black as Mr. Frederiksen's humor is this "Imperial Stout" on the American model with a dense and creamy, light brown head that leaves nice lace in the glass, as it reluctantly settles.
We admit it - we went crazy with the malts in this beer throughout 8 different we have used, and it is the black and burnt, which gives the beer its color and almost extreme fullness - this is almost a fudbyrdet meal bottled . Also bitterness deliver the roasted malts backed by the American Centennial hops. Oh, Mr. Frederiksen is an experience to bid up to dance, he should be enjoyed slowly, but then he in turn will last all evening, where you can warm up by his alcohol and challenging charm. 

We have named this beer for a good friend without whose amazing support and assistance Amager Brewery was not where it is today.

name: Mr. Fusion
description: Mr. Fusion is a green tea and mint infused India Pale Ale with light, sweet lemon-lime aromas.  Golden in color, this beer has bright green and grassy hop flavors followed by pleasant hints of mint.  A good sized bitterness builds and lingers, before ultimately finishing clean.

name: Mr. Green
description: Dry Hopped Pale Ale with Simcoe, Cascade and Centennial.

name: Mr. Huff Pale Ale
description: The only thing we take more seriously than Mr. Huff’s head of hair is our beer: flavourful and complex. Mr. Huff is a 5.4% ABV, 40 IBU pale ale brewed using both American and UK hops, and a unique blend of 7 malts. Slightly sweet, with a medium body, and a flavourful and aromatic hop finish.

name: Mr. Huff Persuation Pilsner
description: Light straw in colour, Mr.Huff is a unique blend of the best in German and Czech styles. It has a slightly spicy aroma and pronounced hop taste that comes from its blend of German and Czech noble hops. Clean, crisp, and refreshing, this pilsner is highly drinkable with a pleasant and mellow hop finish.

name: Mr. Locomotive
description: Smoked Rye Porter. Raven color, toffee and roast aroma, chocolate flavor, charcoal finish.

name: Mr. Marmalade
description: Double IPA brewed with Seville Oranges & Brown Sugar.

name: Mr. Mayhem
description: Brandy Barrel Aged Imperial Brown Ale.

name: Mr. Mean
description:
Mix 1970's Dayton American funk with a trumpet load of hops and what do you get? Mr Mean. Inspired by the 13th album recorded by Dayton, O group The Ohio Players.

Mr Mean Imperial IPA is pale orange in color. It has copper highlights and a funk load of Amarillo and Centennial hops providing citrus and fruity aromas to a very bitter climax. The malt character is slightly bready/nutty with a dry finish. This beer will keep your thirsty soul groovin’!

name: Mr. Mephisto's
description: A Russian Style Imperial Stout named after the late nite TV host of ‘Lenny’s Inferno’ than ran in the ‘70’s and early ‘80’s.  Deceptively smooth.

name: Mr. Nice Guy
description: When Steve and Ken sat down to brainstorm the collab beer, there was only two things in mind; hops and IPA. A simple grain bill of 2-Row , wheat, and crystal malt allows the hops to do all the talking. Loaded with Amarillo, Simcoe, Galaxy, and Mosaic hops; this beer has a distinct tropical flavor. Huge notes of guava, papaya, and pineapple are big on the palate and nose; followed by a slight touch of dank.

name: Mr. Nice Guy
description: This full bodied Double IPA starts by lifting your senses with a mildly spicy herbal front, then it balances with a fantastic malt taste and mouth feel and ends with an intense hop lovers finish. Perfect.

name: Mr. OG
description: Malty, caramel & fruity aroma followed by toasty, toffee & dried fruit character in the flavor.

name: Mr. Orange
description: Belgian Oat Witbier brewed with Blood Orange, Chamomile and Rose Hips

name: Mr. Ouroboros
description: Mr. Ouroboros is the follow up wet hop beer to Sticky Fat. Both are brewed with freshly picked, whole cone hops straight from the harvest. Both are hop forward, juicy potions demonstrating the perfume quality you can extract from the cones. And, both are odes to the lore of the fields. We were joined by friend and fellow brewer Jonathan Cutler of Piece Brewpub to bring this beer to you. We utilized a kolsch yeast strain and bags & bags of whole cone Citra to land on a beer all its own.

name: Mr. Owl Double India Brown Ale
name_display: Mr. Owl Double India Brown Ale
description: Dark brown with a khaki head, cocoa-orange rind aroma, flavor profile includes milk chocolate and juicy citrus. Mr. Owl knows how many licks it takes to get to the center of a tootsie pop. 8.8% abv, 75 IBU

name: Mr. Pineapple
description: A stylish wheat with a tropical personality, infused with fresh pineapple juice from Fair Trade Costa Rican farms, takes traditional wheat beer and adds some seriously cool character.

name: Mr. Porter
description: A brewer called Harwood made single beer called Entire, which recreated the flavor of "Three Threads" and became known as Porter. Made with black malt, chocolate malt, and peat malt, to give this beer a traditional English taste.

name: Mr. Robusto
description: The WBB Robust Porter is brewed to be hearty but smooth to the taste buds.  Smell the roasty character before the goodness hits your tongue.  Specialty malts in this one include vienna, caramunich,crystal 20, crystal 80, chocolate, carafa, amber and victory.  Hopped with perle, aurora and fuggles.  For a special treat, watch for the oatmeal version.

name: MR. SESSION: CHINOOK
description: Single hop session beer featuring the classic hop: Chinook.  Bold pine-like and grapefruit aromas.  Subtle spicy, smoky notes.  Smells like a pine tree. Brewed with German pilsner malt and spelt, which lends a nutty, biscuity flavor which controls the strong pine character nicely.  Overall light, balanced, and thirst – quenching.

name: MR. SESSION: CHINOOK
description: Single hop session beer featuring the classic hop: Chinook.  Bold pine-like and grapefruit aromas.  Subtle spicy, smoky notes.  Smells like a pine tree. Brewed with German pilsner malt and spelt, which lends a nutty, biscuity flavor which controls the strong pine character nicely.  Overall light, balanced, and thirst – quenching.

name: Mr. Sparkle
description: A joint venture of Metsumura Fishworks & Tamaribuchi Heavy Manufacturing Concern.

name: Mr. Stout
description: This Imperial Stout is so top secret we have to keep you in the dark. Drink up, this Imperial Stout will get you asking for more!

name: Mr. Tallymon Hefeweizen
description:
A traditional wheat-based ale originating in Southern Germany that is a specialty for summer consumption, but generally produced year-round.   Refreshing, fast-maturing beers that are lightly hopped and show a unique banana-and-clove yeast character. Rod ‘discovered’ this, his favorite, style while stationed in “West” Germany from 1985-1988.  Enchanted by the light banana and clove combination as well as the traditional slice of fruit added to the glass he still enjoys and brews it today to the strictest German standards, always in search of the perfect pint.
Malts: By German law, at least 50% of the grist must be malted wheat, although some versions use up to 70%; the remainder is Pilsner malt. We use a 50:50 blend of German Pilsner and German White Wheat malt.

name: Mr. Tea
description: Ale brewed with minimal hops, with black and green tea additions. Fermented with fresh seasonal fruit.

name: Mr. Todd's
description: Mr. Todd's brown is a Belgian Brown Ale. This special dark ale is brewed with roasted malts to give it a roasted, nutty flavor and dark hues of deep mahogany. Our special Belgian yeast lends a slightly tart and fruity flavor that is balanced with a crisp finish. Just like Mr. Todd, this ale is deceptively good and an easy sipper.

name: Mr. Weisse Guy
description: Traditional Berliner settled soured with our house Lactobacillus culture.

name: Mrs. Adams Oatmeal Stout
description: Super rich, thick, malty and roasty.  Dark chocolate milk-like flavor with dark toast notes.  Just a touch of bitterness to balance it all out.  You'll have no argument when Mrs. Adams tells you to finish your beer.

name: Mrs. Frederiksen
description:
It is said that behind every harsh, brusque and brutal man stands a chaste, loving, and not least wise woman.
 
Of course this is also in the beer world. For where our perhaps best known beer, Mr. Frederiksen is a powerhouse who enjoy stand and admire own muscles, then Mrs. Frederiksen as a wise woman who very well know that you can actually achieve almost as much by save a little on forces.
 
The Lady is not just any light beer, yet toned down compared to the Lord. Slightly sweeter and less wasted albeit with plenty of black malt, chocolate malt and roasted barley is not exactly a hero bet slut. And the U.S. Centennial hops kicking off with his 60 + IBU.
 
Bid wife welcome - she's here to stay.

name: Mrs. O'Leary's Chocolate Milk Stout
description:
Don't fight it, Spite It!

So this is what we heard...

Mrs. O'Leary was excessively milking her cow, because

she owed money all over town. One day she tugged too hard

and the cow had enough!

With one spiteful kick, the lantern exploded and flames

engulfed the city. The cow watched with a smirk as

the Great Chicago Fire burned the city to the ground,

because she knew full whom the Chicagoans would blame.

That's our story and we're sticking to it!

name: Ms Pancho Peach & Plum Berliner
description: Ms Pancho (our brewery dog) Peach + Plum Berliner is an absolute summer crusher. Slightly tart with a huge addition of flaked oats and conditioned on peach and plum purée. We added hefty whirlpool additions of centennial and columbus and knocked out on even more centennial. Bright, fruity, and super juicy this is not one you want to miss.

name: Ms. Lucy's Weimaraner Wheat
description: A filtered American-style wheat beer with a refreshingly clean character. Blond in color and lightly hopped with Saaz hops.

name: MSLP
description: A malty nose, hints of vanilla and cocoa, and a drizzle of caramel suggest a heavier beer. But this was made for summer drinking! Light on the palate, this ale was brewed with a bit more caramel malt to create a color that’s closer to brunette than redhead.

name: Mt Prevost Porter
description: A silky smooth dark ale with savoury cocoa and roasted malt flavours, our porter has a slightly smoked finish that is both alluring and illusive.

name: Mt Rainier Hop Party
description: Unfiltered hoppy light ale brewed from the second runnings of our Willi Whammer Barleywine 2012. Hopped with Mt Rainier for a crisp bite.

name: NatureLand Organic Lager
description:
Organic Lager: Dry character with noble aroma hops
We have created an exceptional organic lager with an inviting flavour and a clean, refreshing taste. NatureLand is brewed with the world’s finest organic malted barley, hops and our own naturally pure spring water. A stunning beer that is brewed using only the best two-row malt, Hallertau Hops and our own pure spring water – NatureLand Organic Lager is among Nature’s finest unadulterated products.

Every pour of NatureLand Lager is a veritable glass of alpine-meadow sunshine, complete with hints of green apple. Great with spicy food or roast chicken.

name: Naturtrüb
description: The natural beer specialty from the Salzkammergut has all the valuable ingredients and is brewed strictly after the Reinheitsgebot by the traditional family recipe. Well cooled and opened once this unfiltered beer unfolds its full taste.

name: Naughty 'Nana
description: This is a well-balanced Belgian that gives you plenty of caramel as well as hints of bananas both up front and on the finish.  The fruity esters, a hallmark byproduct of fermenting with most Belgian yeasts, are wonderfully present without being overly dominating.  Brewed at the request of and with Ted Schneider of Moe’s Original BBQ – Fort Collins, when Ted prepared his 5th Anniversary beer dinner at Moe’s he paired this beer with pork belly and a strong herbal/garlic/anchovy sauce that perfectly complemented both the sweetness and the “nana” flavor in the beer.  The only thing naughty about it is, perhaps, the ABV, which is cloaked a bit by the balance of the beer.

name: Naughty 90
description: Our Naughty 90 Oaked IPA was inspired by ocean bound, oak barreled brews of the 1800’s. Packed with hops on a 90-minute schedule, uniquely malted, then aged on a bed of oak, this IPA delivers a taste that is both innovative and timeless.

name: Naughty Aud
description: Black as the moonless night, Naughty Aud Imperial Stout boasts a profusion of complexity in flavor and aroma possessed by few other styles of ale. A sturdy crosshatch of molasses, mocha and caramel malt imbued with soft, luminescent aromas of smoked bourbon and vanilla. Illustrated by the renown artist Alan Forbes, this is an unfiltered ale. Please decant slowly and enjoy responsibly.

name: Naughty by Nectar
description:
(Nectarine IPA)

A juice-bomb IPA brewed with 600 pounds of fresh nectarines from Bleue Farms in Hendersonville, NC. An enticing stonefruit aroma blends beautifully with heavy citrus and mild bitterness from Citra and Azacca hops.

name: Naughty Hildegard
description: Showcasing Mosaic hops and a delicate blend of malts, this Extra Special Bitter was brewed with the very finest ingredients available. Naughty Hildegard ESB supports big flavours of guava, mango and citrus to deliver a juicy hop-malt balance that is deceptively easy to drink. A Pacific Northwest jam on a UK classic.

name: Naughty List
description: For the holiday week, we offer up our Naughty List.  Every year Santa plagues the poor naughty people of the world with coal in their stockings. This is a problem that we at NoDa have decided to fix. We give you Naughty List, a succulent winter warmer with bourbon soaked vanilla beans, aged on dark rum infused oak chips offering that even Santa himself can’t cart away from you.

name: Naughty Marilyn
description: A Belgian-style Tripel, Naughty Marilyn is a marriage of flavors - spice, citrusy fruit, alcohol. She is temptingly drinkable, yet devious.  If you have one, you'll want another.

name: Naughty Native
description: Full-bodied with a dark amber color. Very hoppy, featuring bold flavors and aromas with complex citrus, pine and herbal characteristics. A nice sharp finish

name: Naughty Neighbor
description: Sometimes our neighbours are just too enticing to resist! In this case, our newest ward-winning product pays homage to our naughty neighbours to the south, as our American Pale Ale has something for everyone! For hop lovers, the huge aroma of citrus and pine greet the nose and the hops continue on the palate as hoppy flavour persists, leaving a remarkably easy drinking crisp, dry finish. We pack all this hop aroma and flavour in a brew that is only 4.9% on purpose, which leaves a hugely sessionable beer that is perfectly refreshing on hot summer days!

name: Naughty or Nice
description: A spiced Winter Ale. This delicious brew has chamomile, all-spice, cinnamon and cloves, giving an aroma and taste that will remind of the Yuletide season. This style is limited to select bars as a draft-only release.

name: Naughty Redhead
description: Righteous hops and cherry aromas tell you this is not your ordinary red ale. A sexy complexion with buttery malts make this exotic brew something to be desired. Nuts and caramel build to form the perfect union of awesomeness in your mouth.

name: Naughty Rye
description: Naughty Rye is a thirst-quenching pale ale that pours with a beautiful white head and is light golden in color. Greeting you with a citrusy aroma of grapefruit with hints of melon, she entices you to further explore and enjoy the full flavor imparted by the bountiful use of rye malt and citra hops. While predominantly hoppy upfront, her flavor quickly transcends to a spicy and crisp finish provoking another savory sip.

name: Naughty Sauce
description: Golden Milk Stout w/ Coffee on Nitro – Head Brewer Evan Price worked together with Roast Master Jeff Duggan from Portola Coffee Lab for this paradox. It’s a stout beer made with oats and milk sugar, coffee instead of roasted grain and then served on nitro to add even more creaminess! Full bodied, deep golden in color, with smooth and flavorful layers of pecan pie, cinnamon and cookie dough.

name: Naughty Temple

available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.
available.name: Seasonal

beer_variation.description: Our Naughty 90 Oaked IPA was inspired by ocean bound, oak barreled brews of the 1800’s. Packed with hops on a 90-minute schedule, uniquely malted, then aged on a bed of oak, this IPA delivers a taste that is both innovative and timeless.

style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale
style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale

beer_variation.name: Naughty 90

description: Naughty 90 India pale ale aged in a Templeton Rye barrel.

name: Naughty Wheat
description: An apricot wheat style beer. Easy drinking Summer beer.

name: Nautical Reference Pale Ale
description: It's the NW so we need some sort of nautical reference for at least one of our beers, right?  We figure this'll cover them all.  Maris Otter base with a touch of Chocolate malt for color and complexity, Summit and Cascade hops from Yakima for aroma and restrained bitterness.

name: Nautilus
description: A traditional Belgian Saison made with coriander, bitter orange, and Hibiscus flowers. The finished beer has a complex floral aroma with a slight tartness from the Hibiscus flower and a refreshing light finish. Oh and it’s pink.

name: Nautilus
description: Sour Ale with Blueberries, Lactose Sugar & Vanilla.

name: Niner Bock
description: A Hoppy nose gives way to the subtle toffee and caramel malt characteristics of this earthy German style lager.

name: Nineteen
description: Brewed to the classic “Weyerbacher anniversary requirement” of a strength of 10% ABV or more, Nineteen fits the mold and brings a new dimension to the anniversary pedigree: tartness! Two brews were made: a high-ABV mango-infused wheat beer and a tart blending beer, both using pale and wheat malts and a blend of Belgian yeasts. The final blended beer features both tropical sweetness, as well as the tart citrusy character of a spontaneously fermented beer. Nineteen should cellar quite well. Cheers!

name: Ninja Chicken Pale Ale
description: The tastiness of this beer sneaks upon you with ninja like powers. A light aroma of caramel and hops slowly roundhouse kick you in the face with your first sip. Utilizing the power of dry hopping this brew will surprise you with the intense hop flavor, some may even feel the need to call it an IPA but that is just how Ninja’s work. Please note no chickens were harmed in the making of this beer (nor were any ninjas but they cannot be harmed, DUH).

name: Ninja Porter
description: Everyone loves a good ninja, and we're no exception.  This beer has chopped, flipped and posed its way to its pedestal as one of our most popular and asked-about offerings.  "How?" you may ask.  Part of it is pure stealth power and part of it is pure secret, and we'd hve to kill you.  But the other part is the rich, satisfying body and hard-hitting chocolate finish with notes of coffee and caramel.  Carefully measured quantities of Mt. Hood, Northern Brewer, and Cascade hops added with masterful precision balance it all out.  Of course, winning a gold medal in the porter category at the 2008 Carolina Championship of Beer festival doesn't hurt one's killer reputation either.

name: Ninja Vs. Unicorn
description: Ninja vs. Unicorn celebrates the epic battle between two of the biggest hop-heads of lore. Brewed with over five pounds of hops per barrel, this unfiltered double IPA is sure to please the most discerning hop lover. Whether you’re rooting for the mythical horned horse or the deadly assassin of the east, we hope you’ll enjoy Ninja vs. Unicorn.

name: Ninkasi
description:
A Celebration Beer, with apple juice, wild yeasts, NZ hops and champagne fermentation

Named after the ancient Greek goddess of beer, this is an equally divine Belgian-style Saison with a copious amount of New Zealand hops, freshly harvested Somerset apple juice and wild yeast. However, just to take things that bit further — once bottled, it undergoes a secondary champagne yeast fermentation.

Serve as an aperitif or alongside Westcombe’s Unpasteurised Aged Cheddar, whose deep creamy flavour and citrus aftertaste is the perfect accompaniment.

On the nose there’s a bouquet of playfully aromatic notes. Take a sip and enjoy a further cascade of striking and sensuous flavours alongside the carefree champagne-like spritziness. The long, dry finish is both refreshing and complex.

name: Niobrara Stout
description: Colorado resides over a large portion of the Niobrara formation. TheNiobrara is important for a couple reasons, the chalk, which stout water requires, and the black liquid energy, which stouts resemble. Available on the nitro faucet (most of the time) this stout has the chocolate, coffee flavors you’re craving when a stout is on your mind.  Too many different malts to list and a couple varietals of hops balance this stout well.

name: Nippert
description: Our English Barleywine is malty sweet with hints of herbal English hops. We caramelize the wort in the kettle and boil for 3 hours to develop the deep, rich malty tones of toffee, leather, and brown sugar.

name: Nirvana IPA
description: Ommegang's first IPA, and hop lovers will adore the transcendent combination of rich aromas and hoppy goodness.  We built this IPA through lots of late-addition hops as well as dry-hopping - creating a beer that's fruity, hoppy, floral and citrusy.  Nirvana is all about the flavor and aroma of seven hops married into one elegant IPA, with a touch of honey malt sweetness.

name: Nirvana Nut Brown Ale
description: Our regulars have many reasons for frequenting our premises. Some come for the comfy chairs, a game of pool, or to exude some seriously suaveness at the oyster bar on a Friday evening. For the truly devoted, however, who come in search of truth, it's the Nut Brown they're after. Often they arrive with a glazed look in their eyes, having endured days of office drudgery or the unknowable hardships of securing a parking spot. Set your cares aside, for all can find solace in this ale's yin-yang of nutty maltiness and delicate, dryish hoppiness. For our Nut Brown, an ale deep auburn in colour, we use a blend of Munich, caramel and chocolate malts to create a rich malty palate with a lingering dry chocolatiness.

name: Nissos Pilsner
description: NISSOS Pilsner is locally brewed and bottled in Tinos, Cyclades, Greece. Artisanal using the finest quality, all natural ingredients and a traditional slow fermentation process.

name: Nit Wit
description: Nit Wit® is a traditional Belgian-style witbier. Unfiltered and spiced with orange peel and coriander. Immensely refreshing and flavorful.

name: Nite Wolf
description: A robust porter with hints of chocolate and orange, brewed by Ken. He is the night wolf.

name: Nitro
description: This is our nitro version of the Ponquogue Porter.

name: Nitro
description: As most connoisseurs of Amager beer by now probably have experienced, then we here at the small brewery like to screw a little extra up the throttle and mix a little extra in the tank for maximum effect. How we brew beer, we think it is more fun to design conformity and challenge all the senses. With Amager Nitro we recognize again that we are nothing more than big boys who love to play with hops. IPA is a clear favorite style, and in this we have bøffet everything up and made ​​a Double IPA (DIPA) on the American model. With Northern Brewer, Columbus, Centenniel, Cascade and Amarillo in the tub, we guarantee that no hop heads will go in vain.

name: Nitro - House IPA
description: SAME AS ON REGULAR TAP, BUT NITRO!

name: Nitro Annealed Coffee Stout
description:
The NITRO version of our annealed coffee stout seasonal....

When steel is annealed, it is heated up and cooled slowly to make for a more malleable metal. Similarly, this variant of our famous stout has been heated up with a higher ABV and then slowly cold-infused with locally-roasted, ethically sourced coffee beans from Winchester, VA’s own Hopscotch Coffee. Careful selection of ingredients, including the addition of Midnight Wheat, allows for a thick, frothy head and deep, dark color.

name: Nitro Blonde Ale
description: A smooth, easy-drinking Blonde Ale with a slightly sweet malt body and a crisp, hop finish.

name: Nitro Bloodline
description:
Brewed exclusively for the 2013 Craft Brewers Conference (and a collaborative project with Reyes Beverage Group), Bloodline is an intensely-hopped IPA brewed with Blood Orange peel and juice.

According to our Brewmaster Matt Brophy, the result is a flavor profile that harnessed the best aspects of both the hops (Warrior, Citra, and Galaxy) and the citrus. He and his brewing team are very fond of hop-based citrus aromas, so experimenting with actual citrus was a natural extension of that.

name: Nitro Burbon Barrel Aged Pinko Russian Imperial Stout
name_display: Nitro Burbon Barrel Aged Pinko Russian Imperial Stout

name: Nitro Cacao Bender
description: Bender made with cacao nibs, vanilla beans, and coffee.

name: Nitro Chocolate Stout
description: Six different malt varieties, cacao nibs, dark chocolate, lactose, oats, and vanilla combine to produce a decadent Chocolate Stout. Dispensing via nitrogen yields a lush, velvety texture and rich, smooth finish.

name: Nitro Common Necessity
description: A silky smooth stout brewed with hazelnut and coffee.

name: Nitro Compass IPA
description: This is an ale with zip. Our india pale ale brings together copious amounts of Columbus, Chinook and Cascade hops in a tasty combination that lingers through the finish and beyond. Compass delivers big hop flavor with malt in a nice supporting role. A hands-down favorite with the regulars in our Tasting Room.

name: Nitro Cream Ale
description: Squatters first nitro beer in draft distribution. This blonde English style cream ale is silky smooth with delicate hop aroma, the first one won't even touch the sides.

name: Northern Hemisphere Harvest
description:
The cornerstone of our Harvest series is the beer that started the modern-day fresh hop ale phenomenon in America, our original Harvest Ale.

Created in 1996, Harvest Ale features Cascade and Centennial hops from the Yakima Valley in Eastern Washington. These hops are harvested and shipped as “wet” un-dried hops—the same day they are picked—to our brewery in Chico where our brewers eagerly wait to get them into the brew kettle while their oils and resins are still at their peak

name: Northern Liberties
description: A well-hopped I.P.A. inspired by the revolutionaries of Cincinnati’s historic Northern Liberties district – an area known for tolerance of beliefs and behaviors prior to 1849. This free-spirited brew features three hop varieties and three malts creating this well-balanced, pale golden ale.

name: Northern Light
description: The light touch of Horizon hops marry well with Pilsner malts to create this crisp, clean and refreshing beer.

name: Northern Lights
description: Northern Lights is an extra-special India Pale Ale that is now available year-round. Characterized by its full-flavored bitterness and floral aroma, a perfect blend of barley and hops make this a very balanced IPA. For the craftbrew connoisseur, Northern Lights is a deliciously crafted piece of the heavens.

name: Northern Pine Porter
description: Light roast and subtle wood on the nose. A soft and smooth, medium bodied porter. Very drinkable with notes of vanilla, chocolate and oak.

name: Northern Spy
description: Made with Northern Spy apples alone, this single varietal cider is indubitably a showcase of one proud apple. Bright and acidic with a touch of sweetness and loads of character, the Northern Spy is an exceptional addition to your personal reserve.

name: Northern Spy Dry Cider
description: Freshly Pressed Hard Cider made from an iconic heirloom apple.

name: Northern Star
description: Coffee flavours in dark beer are always a glittering combination. Our Northern Star Mocha Porter takes this to another level, as we blend in ground coffee beans to the brew, full of bitterness and hazelnut hints, along with rich dark chocolate and milk sugar to balance this full bodied dark ale. A collaboration with Leeds' North Star Coffee Micro Coffee Roasters, Northern Star will guide you to a new taste experience.

name: Northern Star
description: Delicious, fruity, hoppy beer from Somerset, made with American hops.

name: Northman
description: Northman is a French farmhouse-style ale aged in Calvados barrels for four months. Taking after the bière de garde style of northern France, this beer has aromas of toffee, toasted grains, and candied apples. Flavors of apple brandy, vanilla, and graham cracker form a balanced palate. Brewed with 2-row malt, red wheat, and specialty malts including caramel and midnight malts. It ferments with our saison yeast before being transferred to the Calvados barrels in which it ages.

name: Northsea IPA
description:
Jopen Northsea IPA (aka Mooie Nel) is an IPA containing plenty of American hops, which creates bitterness with lots of fruity tones. Back when long journeys by sea were the norm, IPA was brewed to be extra-strong, and extra hops was added so that it could be drunk in the colonies. In the 17th century The Netherlands produced its own version of IPA, or ‘duraebel scheepsbier (long-life ship’s beer)’, for the Dutch East Indies.
IPA has returned to Europe thanks to the American Craft Revolution. It is the fastest growing style of beer in the USA. Jopen Northsea IPA is our Dutch take on the modern IPA; Every swig of this beer is a pleasure.

name: Northstar Imperial Porter
description:
Our Imperial Porter is a deep, robust ale brewed with only the finest ingredients.  This winter seasonal has a full-bodied chocolate malty flavor with steady sweetness and a slight warming sensation.  It pours black with a creamy brown head.  Cellarable for 5+ years. 

Hops -Northern Brewer, East Kent Goldings, Czech Saaz

Awards: Silver Medal World Beer Cup 2006, Bronze Medal Colorado State Fair 2008, Gold Medal Colorado State Fair 2010

name: Northtown Native
