description: The beer you have at the end of the shift or just a long day. Northtown Native is a light, refreshing, full bodied ale that is brewed and fermented as if it were a lager. Up front the taste is light and crisp with a malt backbone and American Sterling hops finish, to create a great session beer.

name: Northumbrian
description: A new Blonde ale. Fresh and zesty with a hoppy lemon / grapefruit aroma.

name: Northwest Breakfast Stout
description: Oatmeal Stout with Coffee. Then we add Woodinville Whiskey Co.Bourbon and a whole mess of toasted oak and age it for 140 days. We change the process up a bit each year but rest assured, this is a massively tasty beer bursting with flavors of coffee, oak, oats, bourbon, toasted things, and chocolate.

name: Northwest IPA
description: This beer greets you with floral and citrus aromas, the result of aggressive Cascade dry-hopping. The addition of Chinook hops leave you with a lingering pineyness reminiscent of a hike in the mountains. A light malt sweetness provides balance while maintaining the hop forward character.

name: Northwest Pale Ale
description: A medium bodied, copper colored, well-balanced North West style Pale Ale. Brewed with just a pinch more hops to make it “Northwesty.”

name: Northwest Passage IPA
description: The hoppiest IPA in the Midwest at 115 IBU! The Northwest Passage, once a virtually impassable route through Canada it has become the "secret" submarine route. Made with Canadian malts and four American hops, Northwest Passage goes well with Pho, Buffalo wings & bon fires.

name: Northwest Red
description: A.K.A “John Doe, Jason Evers, Doitchin Krasev” Northwest Red.  A Northwest American-Style Red Ale with deep red color. Big malty aroma with hints of caramel, slightly roasty. Aroma is balanced with citrusy American hops. Flavor comes through as a nice balance of specialty malts, NW hops, and a firm bitterness. Medium to full bodied mouthfeel. Finishes fruity, hoppy, and slightly sweet.

name: Northwest Territory
description:
Our nod to the West Coast style of IPA's. Maris
Otter base malt creates this behemoth malt 
profile. Dry on the finish, and egregiously 
hopped at almost 4 pounds per barrel! 
Hop Heads Rejoice!

Tasting Notes:  Dry, Pine, Resin, Grapefruit
#nwt

name: Northwest Wheat
description: One of the oldest styles of beer in the world, the history of hefeweizen goes back as far as the 14th or 15th century. And we say, when something's working, just get out of the way. That's why Henry Weinhard's Northwest Wheat is made the traditional way, like Germans have been doing for centuries. Made with American hops and a touch of honey, this beer has a really incredible depth of flavor.

name: Northwest Winter Ale
description: Our take on winter ale with subtle spice notes and a rich malty body.

name: Northwestern Gold
description: Clean, crisp, golden German Helles style Lager. Made with Pilsner and Munich Malts.

name: Northwind Imperial Stout
description: Dark delights like this were once shipped to the Imperial Court of Russia. With a firm roasty maltiness balanced against a generous helping of hops, Northwind can stand up to the worst its namesake can dish out! Enjoy it by a roaring fire.

name: Northwoods Lager
description: Aged longer than most American lagers for a smooth, rich flavor and a beautiful deep golden color.

name: Norton Lager
description: Norton Lager pays tribute to Bernie and his freewheeling, risk-taking spirit. Locally grown hops transform this classic Munich Helles lager into the ultimate Australian session beer.

name: Norweald Stout
description: Malty American Stout. Norweald covers the spread of dark malt flavors perfectly. Dark chocolate, charcoal, smoke, burnt toffee, cream, and caramel. Intense maltiness is balanced by roasted malts and just enough hops to taste.

name: Norwegian Wood
description: Once every farm in Norway was required by law to brew its own ale. All of that ale had a natural smoky taste and most of it was spiced with juniper. With Norwegian Wood we have recreated this traditional beer style brewing it the traditional way with juniper branches and berries picked by us in our local woods.

name: Norwegian Wood
description: We are happy to revive the first IPA ever brewed at the Grumpy Troll. We use the finest English malts and hops.

name: Nosdunk Stout
description:
Nosdunk Stout offers a tasty flavor profile that combines roasted, slightly burnt malt notes, coffee, and even a touch of chocolate. A dark colored beer nice creamy head of foam.  Brewed with Fuggle hops.

Nosdunk Stout has  been released in 22oz bottles.

name: Nose Candy
description: This 2015 GABF Bronze Medal winner in the Session IPA category is pale golden in color, light-bodied and the ultimate treat for your nose with big hoppy aromas and flavors reminiscent of pink Nerds, white Airheads and melted Big Sticks. 4.4% abv

name: NOSE OVER TAIL
description: Meet our first lager, Nose Over Tail Maibock. More info soon!

name: Nosedive Porter
description:
This robust vanilla porter is dark brown with ruby highlights. The aroma is heavy on notes derived from aging with Madagascar vanilla beans. The use of roasted barley, chocolate and black malts give this brew slight notes of chocolate, coffee and roast.

This medium to full bodied beer features a warm alcohol finish with a medium to low presence of hop bitterness. Primary bittering derived from the dark, roasted malts. 

Limited, Vermont-only release is available in 22oz. bottles and on draught.

name: Nosegrind
description: A tribute to Granite Park Skatepark next to the brewery. Crisp, bright and clean-finishing.

name: Oat Stout
description: Brewed with large oat additions in the grist, Oat Stout has a velveet mouthfeel with chocolate, dark candied cherry, and dark roasted coffee.

name: Oatgoop
description: This Oat Wine was brewed with our friends at Mikkeller.

name: Oatis Oatmeal Stout
description: A rich, complex oatmeal stout with just enough hops to balance the copious quantities of dark roasted malts and the addition of oatmeal for a creamy smooth drinkability.

name: Oatis Redding
description: This awesome red will warm you up on the chilliest of Fall nights. Maris Otter, Munich, oats and several dark specialty malts comprise our malt bill, which provides a delicate roast character and smooth mouthfeel. Columbus is used to bitter. Aroma additions include Centennial and Simcoe.

name: Oatmeal Brown Ale
description: English Maris Otter and chocolate malts are complimented by a generous portion of flaked oats.  This medium bodied, creamy session ale features notes of chocolate and toffee with a hint of fruity esters from the English ale yeast.

name: Oatmeal Chocolate Milk Stout
description: A full-bodied, rich and decadent stout. Slightly sweet with hints of chocolate and roasted malt.

name: Oatmeal Cookie Ale
description: Brewed with toasted oats and real pecans. Sweet amber ale.

name: Oatmeal Cookie Imperial Stout
description: Oatmeal Imperial Stout with a touch of rye, rolled oats, and six pounds of home made, vegan oatmeal raisin cookies.vegan because who wants chicken eggs or butter in their beer? Available when we make it. No seriously, this beer is a lot of work.

name: Oatmeal Cream Pie Ale - Big Debbrah Series
name_display: Oatmeal Cream Pie Ale - Big Debbrah Series

name: Oatmeal Ellie
description: This coffee-like beer will finish with the smooth taste of oatmeal. The flavor conjures up a bowl of oatmeal. Tastes much lighter that it looks, but has a complex flavor with a dry smooth finish.

name: Oatmeal Fission ESB
description: Our newest addition, the Oatmeal Fission ESB is a full bodied Copper Ale with a hint of chocolate malt and Oatmeal. It derives its name from the Nuclear reaction with which the nucleus of an Atom splits into smaller parts often producing free neutrons and protons (in the form of Gamma rays) and releasing a very large amount of energy!  After a pint it is sure to produce a large amount of energy within you!

name: Oatmeal IPA
description: The landscape of the American beer scene is incredibly dynamic. At heart, the IPA began on the West coast and evolved into a movement. Every brewery takes the idea and puts a unique spin on the style to make it their own. The Oatmeal IPA is a product of ingenuity, encompassing the essences of the craft beer spirit.

name: Oatmeal Milk Stout
description: A velvety smooth Stout brewed with oats and milk sugar that create a creamy finish over a dark malt base

name: Oatmeal Milk Stout (Aged in Whiskey Barrels)
name_display: Oatmeal Milk Stout (Aged in Whiskey Barrels)

name: Oatmeal Milk Stout (Oak Bourbon Barrel Aged)
name_display: Oatmeal Milk Stout (Oak Bourbon Barrel Aged)

name: Oatmeal Pale Ale
description: A central Texas take on the classic American style, Ranger Creek OPA is an American Pale Ale at heart that has new dimensions of flavor imparted by oats. It has smooth, sweet, and toasty malt flavors with an underlying creamy nuttiness from the oats. The malt profile is balanced nicely by U.S. grown Centennial and Amarillo hops. The nose and finish are full of toasted coconut, pineapple, lime zest, apricot, and herbaceous spice.

name: Oatmeal Porter
description:
A unique Highland creation, this robust beer is black in color, very malty with hints of chocolate-roasted flavor and a well balanced hop character.

This style was born on the docks of the Thames of London where dock workers or porters delighted in the strong dark ales brewed by the local pubs with roasted malts. This gave rise to the name by which this style is still known. A porter was traditionally served with oysters, the least expensive food available to the dock workers. Highland Brewing has taken this style a step farther with the addition of a judicious amount of flaked oatmeal which helps attain the smooth silky character of our porter.

name: Oatmeal Porter
description: Our Oatmeal Porter boasts a serious malt backbone. Premium pale and Munich malts, and a custom oatmeal roast create a rich flavor drenched in the velvety mouthfeel of toasted oats and dark chocolate malt. Hints of caramel and toffee provide a touch of sweetness and the perfect complement to an enticing mocha aroma and smooth finish. Prost to roasts!

name: Oatmeal Porter
description: This hearty dark ale with pleasing hints of molasses and chocolate is robust and full bodied. Fresh rolled oats compliment the brew by creating a nice silky texture and a creamy, rocky head. This style originally was a blend of three different beers that was called “Entire Butt” – we’re not kidding!  Porter became a style of its own during the early 1700’s when it was the favorite drink of the porters in the produce markets of London, England.

name: Oatmeal Porter
description: All the dark chocolate and coffee notes you excpect from a porter with locally sourced, rolled oats delivering an uncommonly silky smooth finish.

name: Oatmeal Pumpkin Brown
description: Smooth brown ale brewed with local, freshly caramelized pumpkin and accented with hand milled pumpkin pie spice.

name: Oatmeal Raisin Cookie
description: Brewed to taste like an oatmeal raisin cookie. This beer is brewed with British malt, toastediats and caramel malts. Spiced with cinnamon cloves vanilla and nutmeg.

name: Oatmeal Raisin Cookie
description: We add 200 lbs of raisins and 3 lbs of vanilla beans (close to 300 whole beans) go into the making of one of our favorite brews.  Tastes like an oatmeal raisin cookie!

name: Oatmeal Raisin Cookie
description: Amber Ale with raisins, cinnamon, brown sugar

name: Oatmeal Raisin Cookie Stout
description: Our seasonal winter ale, and a new customer favorite. A big oatmeal stout with hints of cinnamon & raisin. You know Santa would rather have this than a plate of cookies.

name: Oatmeal Sout
description: English-inspired with notes of rich milk chocolate, dark fruit — soft, comforting finish.

name: Oatmeal Stout
description: These aren't your Grandpa's oats! A stick-to-your-ribs full bodies stout that's sure to warm you with it's roasty finish. It's brewed with flaked oats, giving it a velvety smooth feel, chocolate notes and a touch of sweetness. Rich malt quality, dark and drinkable; it's part of a balanced beer fest!

name: Oatmeal Stout
description: Deep, rich, and malty with hints of chocolate and coffee. It's what espresso would be if it had the gumption to be beer. We use three different hop additions, specially selected crystal malts, roasted barley, and oatmeal to give it a soft and silky mouth feel. Makes a great dessert. Or meal.

name: Oatmeal Stout
description:
Brewed with well water (the original well at the Old Brewery, sunk in 1758, is still in use, with the hard well water being drawn from 85 feet underground); fermented in ‘stone Yorkshire squares’ to create an almost opaque, wonderfully silky and smooth textured ale with a complex medium dry palate and bittersweet finish.

Serving Suggestions • pizza and salad; pasta and other Italian foods; lobster with drawn butter; steak and kidney pie; ploughman’s lunch; dark flavourful bread; British and French cheeses.

Best served at about 55°F (13°C).

Ingredients • Water, malted barley, cane sugar, roasted malt, yeast, hops, oatmeal, seaweed finings, carbon dioxide.

name: Oatmeal Stout
description: Brewed with flaked oats and a blend of three roasted malts, this luxurious stout has a creamy texture with dark notes of espresso and chocolate.

name: Oatmeal Stout
description: Smooth, creamy and mildy sweet with hints of chocolate and coffee flavors. GABF gold medal winner 1992, 1993, 1995; silver medal winner 1997, 2006. Approx. 6% alc/vol.

name: Oatmeal Stout
description: This smooth drinking Stout is English and not Irish in style. It is made with all English ingredients and is not as dry as typical Irish Stouts. This beer would be traditionally enjoyed in pubs in Southern England. It is a very basic Stout that lets the grains shine through but has a very mild coffee flavor and a pleasant after taste.

name: Oatmeal Stout
description: rich dark brown with prominent coffee, chocolate & roasted malt barley character. Oats provide it’s silky smoothness on the tongue.

name: Oatmeal Stout
description: Silky smooth, full-bodied with roasted notes. Hearty maltiness rounds out the roasted coffee flavors.

name: Oatmeal Stout
description: Rich and creamy, this beer is a mouthful that can satisfy any beer lover. The flavor is chocolatey, roasty, and reminiscent of coffee with cream. The oatmeal provides a luscious body while the roasted character helps create a clean finish.

name: Oktoberfest
description:
Our Oktoberfest is a traditional Märzen style lager, brewed entirely with German malts and hops. This beer is a brilliant amber with gently sweet flavors of crusty bread, leading to a clean, dry finish punctuated by just a touch of noble hops. Served in the ‘keller’ or ‘Zwickel’ style – unfiltered and completely naturally carbonated – our Oktoberfest is full-on authentic. 
GABF - 2013 Silver - Vienna-style Lager

name: Oktoberfest
description:
Oom-pah! Here’s our rift on the popular German style Marzen – aka Oktoberfest bier.  Using the finest German malt, hops and lager yeast, this beer is malty and clean, with a beautiful orange hue.  Ready to be shared by the liter! 

Ziggy Zaggy Ziggy Zaggy Oy Oy Oy!  Ein Prost!

name: Oktoberfest
description: This week, we are celebrating German Oktoberfest with our own fall brew! Our Oktoberfest beer is 6.3% ABV and has 20 IBUs. This full-bodied beer is brewed with German Bach yeast, German malts including Vienna, Munich, and Pilsner, and, you guessed it, all German hops. The malty-sweet taste is balanced by the crisp, dry finish. Come by the tap room and give it a taste! Prost!

name: Oktoberfest
description: This classic German lager is noted for its smooth, clean, and rather rich malt character. The maltiness is often described as soft and complex. There is a light to moderate toasted malt aroma that is brought out by its Initial malty sweetness, but the beer has a moderately dry finish.

name: Oktoberfest
description: Brewed in March and lagered through summer, Oktoberfest (Marzen) is lager brewed to be enjoyed in the fall. It’s copper in color with a rich malty backbone and mild hop profile. Because traditional Oktoberfest and Breast Cancer Awareness Month loosely coincide, a percentage of the sales of OHB’s Oktoberfest is donated to a Breast Cancer Awareness Charity.

name: Oktoberfest
description: Our Oktoberfest Lager is rich, complex and malty.  This copper-orange lager has a soft malt sweetness, pleasant mouth-feel and a slight hop spiciness.

name: Oktoberfest
description:
We brew Oktoberfest in tribute to the world’s biggest beer party. Vienna and Munich malts produce the deep golden color, nutty undertones, and toasted malt flavors characteristic of this renowned Bavarian beer style. Perle hops imported directly from the Hallertau region of Germany give the beer a smooth balanced finish. This celebratory lager puts the ‘fest’ in the month of October.

What started as a community celebration of a royal Bavarian wedding in 1810 has turned into a beer tradition like no other. Over 16 days each fall, some 6 million people head to Munich, don lederhosen and funny hats, gather in enormous tents, and drink oversized steins of beer. We brew this beer true to the original style so you can enjoy some Oktoberfest cheer from the other side of the planet.

name: Oktoberfest
description:
An amber/red lager with a slightly sweet, malty body & a smooth flavor. Modeled after the seasonal beers brewed in Germany for the Bavarian festivals. 

Malt Varieties: Pale Malt, Caramel Malt, Munich
Hop Varieties: Perle, Mount Hood, Saaz

name: Oktoberfest
description: This coppery colored concoction is a tribute to classic German brewing styles.  Modeled after the old-world German Oktoberfest, this bier starts modestly malty and has a harmoniously hoppy culmination. So forgo the far-flung follies of a tedious trip to Germany and grab a glassful of College Street Oktoberfest!

name: Oktoberfest
description: Our Oktoberfest marzen lager is a rich, ruby colored lager fest beer that is extremely smooth and mellow. We use only the finest munich malts, and spicy german hops to give our octoberfest its wonderful aromas, and full bodied flavor. Best served at 55ºf in a beer stein.

name: Oktoberfest
description: Our full-bodied German style lager is perfect for times when the mornings turn crisp and the afternoon sun is still warm on your face. Brewed in the style of the modern day Oktoberfest, our beer is on the lighter side of a Marzen and is brewed with traditional European malts and hops, which combine to create a beer with a pleasant roasted malt flavor and robust hop character. Pairs well with bratwurst and pretzels with spicy mustard.

name: Oktoberfest
description:
This traditional Oktoberfest beer celebrates the arrival of Fall. It is a medium-bodied, smooth and malty brew made with German Vienna malts and German hops.

Bronze Medal, GABF 2013

name: Oktoberfest
description: Comprised of 7 different malts and German Noble Hops, Big Storm Brewing Co.'s first-ever lager pays homage to the traditional German Oktoberfest. This beer pours a rustic, copper-like color yielding the rich aromas of sweet malts.

name: Oktoberfest
description: When Bavarian Prince Ludwig and Princess Therese tied the knot in 1810, the couple invited about a hundred thousand of their closest friends to celebrate on Munich's front lawn and the world's largest annual festival was born. Lucky Bucket salutes this fine tradition with an authentic Oktoberfest lager for the fall season. Using only the finest German malt and hops, we've created a beer with a wonderful malty flavor, full body, and crisp finish that would make Prince Ludwig and Princess Therese proud. Prost!

name: Oktoberfest
description: Brewed with German Pilsner, Munich and Vienna malts for a rich but smooth maltiness, and spiced with herbal and floral German Tettnang and Saaz hops. German Bock yeast was used for a cold ferment, coming together to form a symphony of malt ending with a clean lager finish. Prost!

name: Oktoberfest
description: medium body, malty, clean finish

name: Oktoberfest
description: A traditional Munich-Style Oktoberfest, this malty amber lager provides a full-bodied and smooth taste. German Noble hops take a backseat in this “celebration for your mouth.”

name: Oktoberfest
description: Prince Ludwig was a man of the people. Which is why, when he married in 1810, he invited the entire town of Munich. This Oktoberfest was born, along with the sweet, dark amber lager that has become the namesake of that annual celebration. Ours stays true to the classic style, with notes of toasted bread and roasted almonds. Prost!

name: Oktoberfest
description: "O'zapft is!" The cry of happy beer drinkers at the start of the Munich Oktoberfest, which in German means "The keg is tapped!" Rahr's Oktoberfest Celebration Lager is a traditional Marzen-style Oktobefest lager - dark amber in color, super smooth, medium body with a sweet malty finish. True to tradition, this is a classic Oktoberfest Lager.

name: Oktoberfest
description: A sweet and malty, full-bodied lager with a deep amber hue. This beer style was traditionally brewed in March for Munich’s Oktoberfest celebration in the fall, and is sometimes known as Märzen.

name: Oktoberfest
description: A traditional Marzen Lager with imported Pilsen, Munich and Vienna Malts, German Hallertaurer and Saazer Czech hops. Malty rich and warming with a rich amber orange hue this is a special harvest time treat.

name: Oktoberfest
description: Our fall seasonal is a traditionally brewed amber lager that is brewed once a year to be enjoyed in the early fall. It exhibits a clean and crips German hop character, but the flavor is dominated by a sweet and malty smoothness. Oktoberfest is extremely drinkable despite its higher alcohol content.

name: Oktoberfest
description: Oktoberfest is typically available from August to November and has toasty caramel and malty flavor. It is made from German Noble Hops and massive amounts of Munich Malt, which give it an orange color.

name: Oktoberfest
description: There’s plenty to celebrate when fall arrives in Colorado. The warm days grow shorter, the cool shadows grow longer, and the aspens put on their golden, grand finale. Brewed with biscuity sweet Munich malts and spicy, herbal noble hops, our Oktoberfest is a reminder to stop and enjoy the show.

name: Oktoberfest
description: Legend Oktoberfest is a celebration of malt harmony! This copper hued lager is brewed on a base of Vienna malt and owes its rich flavor profile to generous helpings of Munich and Caramel varieties. This beer is on the sweet side of balance, but the soft complex maltiness is countered by a touch of German Spalt hop bitterness for a clean finish. Legend “Fest” complements hearty cool weather food like stews, sausage dishes, and smoked meats.

name: Oktoberfest
description: Traditional German marzen. Cold conditioned for 6 weeks to create a smooth, drinkable, festival beer. A hearty load of caramel malt notes leas to a lingering sweet finish.

name: Oktoberfest
description: This medium bodied amber lager elegantly combines a touch of malty sweetness with a pleasingly subtle aromatic hop character. Stoudt’s Oktoberfest is brewed from the finest imported ingredients in the style of the original German Oktoberfest celebrations beers.

name: Oktoberfest
description: This is a traditional German-style Marzen characterized by a medium body, light copper color, low but notable hop aroma & flavor and a sweet, light-toasted/biscuity maltiness dominating slightly over a clean hop bitterness.

name: Oktoberfest
description: September into Oktober is a time for festivals loaded with drinking copious amounts of beer and eating a lot of food. Festival beers are usually a little stronger than the standard lagers, and ours is a little above the traditional level. It is a deep red/orange lager with a big malty nose and just enough bitterness to keep it from being sweet. A delicious take on a German traditional lager.

name: Old No 58
description: Congrats to Mary and Matt , wed on 7/16/2011 in Barbados. This is their wedding beer brewed by proud Papa, Dan McGovern. A dark, strong, and malty ale, this beer is a combination of both bride and groom's heritage.

name: Old No. 23 Barley Wine
description: An annual Bristol tradition, Old No. 23 revives an English farmhouse brewery practice of making a complex ale to set aside for special occasions. Our version, while painstaking and time-consuming to brew, rewards the connoisseur with an ale that has the depth and complexity of a good brandy or single malt scotch. Massive quantities of malt and hops, a long aging time and limited availability make this a special ale worthy of its reputation.

name: Old No. 56
description: An American Light Lager? That's not craft beer! Eh, we still like to drink it. Named after the fire truck the city of Lucan bought in 1956, this crisp light lager is for hot days, cold days, and every day in between. And don't worry, we utilize 100% Pilsner malt and Sterling hops, thus keeping our beer-geek cred intact. Now if we could just hook up the lagering tank to that old pumper...

name: Old No.38 Stout
description: Named for a retired California Western Railroad steam engine on the Fort Bragg to Willits run through the Redwoods, Old No. 38 Stout is a smooth, firm-bodied stout with the toasted character and coffee notes of dark malts and roasted barley.

name: Old North State Stout
description: Stout began as a porter style beer in London, England and originally described a beer that was stronger and drier than the sweeter porters. Old North State Stout is made with roasted, pale and caramel malts and English hops. Together they combine to make a full flavored ale with notes of dark chocolate.

name: Old Numbskull
description: Caramel and toffee notes abound in this deep copper-colored American Barleywine-style ale alongside toasted malt and a hint of ripe dark fruits. Old Numbskull showcases malt sweetness, intense American hops, and an aggressive bitterness. Extremely well-balanced, the full-bodied mouthfeel and assertive hop profile leads into a deceptively smooth finish. Old Numbskull can be enjoyed now or laid down for years to come.

name: Old Oak Amber Ale
description: A well balanced American Amber Ale. Smooth malt character balanced with a healthy dose of Cascade hops aged on oak chips - our most popular beer.

name: Old Odense Ale
description:
A Danish Sour Gruit ale based on a 15th century recipe, this ale is a collaboration between Sam Calagione and Anders Kissmeyer from Norrebro Bryghus Brewery in Copenhagen. Ingredients included pale and dark barley malt, oats, fine syrup (maple syrup from Sam's dad's farm in Massachusetts), smoked dark syrup, fir branches and bark, wood sage, hyssop, blackthorn berries, woodruff, and star spice.

The beer has a bright copper color with a very sparse and fragile head. The aroma is extremely complex and spicy, with notes of anise, tobacco, brettanomyces, leather and dried fruits. The body is rich and with a delicate sweetness that balances the sour tartness, making it far more accessible than a Belgian lambic, which would be the only well known style to which one could possible remotely compare Old Odense Ale.

This beer, which pretty much defies any known style or category (if pressed, you could remotely compare it to a Belgian Lambic).

name: Old Oscars Brown Sugar
description: Old Oscar's Brown Sugar is a special blend of barley malts and hops, along with a healthy measure of brown sugar that results in a surprisingly smooth dark ale. Slight toffee and raisin notes, with a mild hop finish, this ale is a perfect transition brew from the chilly nights of winter to the breezy days of spring.

name: Old Paddle Pilsner
description: A tribute to our broken canoe-turned-mixing paddle, Old Paddle Pilsner has a clean malt profile and a hopped finish. Rase a glass to honour our beloved paddle with a mountain of hot wings.

name: Old Pavilion Pilsner
description: Old Pavilion Pilsner was inspired by Brewmaster Eric Marshall’s time as an apprentice brewer in Germany. Crisp and clean with a distinct and pleasurable hop flavor and aroma, Old Pavilion Pilsner is brewed in the North German “Pils” style. Brewed with American malts, a mixture of American and German hops, and fermented with a German strain of bottom-fermenting lager yeast, this beer is crafted with a deep reverence for one of the world’s most successful beer styles..

name: Old Peculier
description: One of the great beers of the world - rich, dark, smooth and mellow tasting, with a character all its own.  Brewed using the traditional Fuggle hop, Old Peculiar is our best known beer and has a large and enthusiastic following across the globe.

name: Old Perseverance
description:
Ale aged in Bourbon Barrels with maple syrup and Dark Muscoado Sugar added.
'Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.' - Winston Churchill

name: Old Powderhouse
description:
A grand old wheatwine made with Massachusets malted wheat

A tribute to the history and stature of the famous Somerville landmark, ‘Old Powderhouse Wheat Wine’ features a varietal of hard, red winter wheat that was grown at Four Star Farms in Northfield, MA and malted by Valley Malt in Hadley, MA. Praised by artisanal bakers, the flavors contributed by this hardy grain are earthy and complex helping to create a robust and powerful beer worthy of its name and the history to which it pays homage.

For hops, only domestic varieties were used for ‘Old Powderhouse,’ combining perfectly with the rich flavors in the wheat for a bright and wonderfully aromatic beer reminiscent of fresh, ripe fruit. On the dry side for a beer of its strength and style, ‘Old Powderhouse’ is remarkably drinkable at 11% ABV with only subtle hints of alcohol coming through the fruity bouquet during the finish.

name: Old Pro
description: A dash of salt. A touch of tart. That's what makes this German-Style wheat beer a seasoned professional at serious summer thirst quenching. With its glowing golden color & citrusy peach nose followed by a prickly mouthfeel that leaves a gentle tartness and a dash of salt on the palate, the Old Pro never fails to bring you back for another sip

name: Old Prospector
description: A true American style Pale with a rodeo twist. The best North American malts blended with English 2-row and hammering of NW hops to create a well balanced, smooth finishing brew with a hint of citrus.

name: Old Prospector Barleywine
description:
Rich and vibrant this Brewer's Private Reserve has been cool-aged in Zinfandel barrels acquired from our favorite local Placer County Wineries.
With over 6 months of aging this "wine-strength" ale has been greatly enhanced by its long slumbering contact with the Zinfandel soaked barrels. A bouquet of soft oak, plumb and raisin give way to a peppery Zin profile which balances nicely with complex malt and a gentle hop presence.
If you can find the willpower, cellar this unique Ale as it will continue to mature and reward.

name: Old Pueblo Barleywine
description: The Barleywine style obtained its name by being a beer brewed of wine strength.  TCB'S is deep copper colored and full bodied.  Old Pueblo Barleywine is intensely malty with a complex fruity-ester character, balanced by a healthy hoppiness and high alcohol content.

name: Old Rag Mountain Ale
description:
Scottish-style Ale Mid-Atlantic Regional and Grand Champion at the 2002 US Beer Tasting Championship!  Gold Medal, 1998 World Beer Championships. Gold Medal, 1998 National Brew-on-Premise Competition. Old Rag Mountain is a heavy Scottish-style ale and is brewed with light additions of hops. The result is a sweet, malty flavor that can be enjoyed by beer lovers and those just entering into dark beers.


The popularity of this beer is greater than the dark color would lead you to believe. Since it is not heavily hopped, it is not very bitter. Therefore, a lot of people who would otherwise avoid dark beers will enjoy this beer. The alcohol content by volume is 7 percent.

If you like Old Rag Mountain Ale, check out what they say about the Oak Barrel Conditioned version (a Platinum Medal Winner!!)!  After its primary fermentation, it spends six weeks aging in a former bourbon oak cask.

name: Old Rasputin
description: Produced in the tradition of 18th Century English brewers who supplied the court of Russia's Catherine the Great, Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout seems to develop a cult following wherever it goes. It's a rich, intense brew with big complex flavors and a warming finish.

name: Old Redwood Porter
description: Several varieties of chocolate malt flavor this robust porter style. Balanced with English east Kent Golding and Cascade hops, Old Redwood Porter is sure to quench the thirst of any dark beer lover. Served unfiltered. 5.5% Volume

name: Old Redwood Square Barleywine
description: Imported English floor malted barley is the corner stone of this traditional ale. Noted as Barleywine for it’s incredible strength, this ale is created to celebrate special occasions and winter holidays. 9.7% Volume

name: Old Reliable
description: Traditionally an English style, restrained and lightly hopped, modern craft brewers have tended to throw buckets and buckets of hops removing any form of detectable subtleties from the yeast and malt. We’ve pegged our hopping rate back, somewhat, to produce a beer with balance and heightened drinkability.

name: Old Richland
description: Old Richland - Our spin on a barley wine and by "our spin" we mean incredibly hoppy. This American-style barley wine oozes with pine and citrus hop character, but the hop bitterness is nicely rounded with the malty backbone of this 9% abv ale.

name: Old Rip Oatmeal Stout
description: Old Rip is one of our most requested specialty beers. Generous portions of dark malts, a heavy hand with the hops and a secret ingredient combine to make this beer one that stout lovers shouldn't miss. Original gravity 14 plato, alcohol by weight 3.75%.

name: Old River Stout
description: An American style stout with a moderate hop bitterness and a surprisingly medium-light body. We start by using caramel and roasted barley malts and mash at a lower temperature that is common for this style. We then use American hops to balance the bitterness to make a unique flavored dark beer.

name: Old Rosie Cloudy Cider
description: Old Rosie is Weston Cider's flagship traditional unfiltered cloudy cider, matured in oak vats.

name: Old Ruffian
description: This special release of our acclaimed, hefty barley wine has been aged for 9 months in Stranahan's Colorado Whiskey barrels. The process tempers Old Ruffian's edges for a mellowed version with heady whiskey flavors and subtle oak notes. Bottle conditioned, it'll age nicely for years. If you can resist it that long.

name: Old Saint Chango
description: This year’s winter warmer is complemented by cocoa nibs and Mexican Chocolate, while the German wheat beer yeast strain lends banana-rama goodness. Old Saint Chango, patron saint of our monkey friends, requested this beer himself.

name: Old Salt IPA
description: Our India Pale Ale is hoppy and bitter with a nice sweet malt finish. Slow dry-hop conditioning brings out the herbal hop aromas.

name: Old Sammy Coffee Porter
description:
The Story:
Our Old Toby Porter infused with cold-brewed toddy coffee from our friends at Hunter Bay Coffee and the recipe was inspired by homebrewer Sam Jones.
The Beer:
Coffee and porter, the perfect flavor combination. The clean, coffee of the toddy leans an aromatic nose and soft tones of the bean on the palette.

name: Old School
description: Sometimes you've just got to take it back to where it all began.  And we took it way back with this offering.  Old School is a British-style pale ale brewed with organic malts for an easy-drinking yet full-bodied character.  The real darling of Old School, though, is in the hops.  We went back and dug up some East Kent Goldings, traditionally used in all ales of British origin with a floral nose and an earthy, spicy, slightly sweet flavor.  From start to finish, this is great beer for celebrating the good times:  past, preset, and future.

name: Old School American Lager
description: Our lightest beer is a throw-back  to how beer was  brewed in America 100 years ago. Crisp, light and refreshing with a delicate malt body and a snappy hop finish.  Try it in our giant 32oz mason jar or in a pint.

name: Old School IPA
description: The first in our series of rotating IPAs, this light blonde ale has very little malt character to get in the way of the big, bold burst of dank, piney, citrusy, and herbal hop characters.  Featuring all old school hop varieties; Cascade, Chinook, & Columbus, this IPA is plenty bitter but doesn’t go overboard in bite or ABV like many of today’s versions are wont to do.

name: Orange Whip IPA
description: This brew is dry hopped with Citra hops from our friends in Yakima at Hopunion.  The kettle additions of Citra hops, brings this brew in at a whopping 75 IBU’s and the hops flavors are much more pronounced with citrusy hints of pineapple, orange etc.  This version is also loaded with malt flavors with plenty of crystal malt, medium to full bodied and deep copper colored.

name: Orange Zest Saison
description: A light-bodied wheat based saison that pours with a straw color. This saison is infused with orange peel and orange zest.

name: Orange-A-Peel
description: This seasonal beer is an American Pale Wheat Ale brewed with oranges and orange zest. It pairs perfectly with the warmer, sunny days of the spring season. It is pale and cloudy in color, and has aromas and tasting notes of citrus and oranges, balanced with a wheat malt backbone. Orange you glad that spring is finally here?!

name: Orangutan IPA
description: Orangutan is a sessionable, heavily hopped Northwest style IPA. It's dry hopped with generous amounts of Summit and Cascade hops. Orangutan is one of our best sellers.

name: Oranje Brett
description: A rustic saison aged in red wine barrels with four strains of Brettanomyces. Funky, fruity, spicy and dry.

name: Oranje Crush
description: A somewhat fruity and easy drinking Belgian ale which is less aggressive than many other Belgian beers.

name: Oranje Weisse
description:
A refreshing flemish style white beer brewed with two types of orange peel, coriander, and a touch of ainse. A truly unique flavor combination of citrus and light spice. All natural ingredients, unpasteurized.

Canadian Brewing Awards: Silver 2011
Ontario Brewing Awards: Gold 2012, Gold 2011
US Open Beer Championships: Gold 2011

name: Orbital Mirror
description: DDH Oat DIPA w/ Simcoe & Azacca

name: Orca™
description: The perfect beer for a frigid day, our late-Winter seasonal packs loads of malt complexity. Made with real molasses and a variety of dark and roasted malts, you’ll get tones of chocolate, coffee, burnt sugar and raisin. Be careful though, just like the animal it’s named after, Orca is strong and powerful.

name: Orchard Peach
description: This delicious peach cider captures the refreshing taste of the ripest Okanagan peaches because it's made from homegrown Okanagan fruit. It's Seriously Good Cider.

name: Orchard Wheat
description: American-style unfiltered wheat beer with peach juices and lime leaf added.

name: Orchard White
description: Orchard White is an unfiltered, bottle conditioned Belgian-style witbier. This hazy, straw yellow beer is spiced with coriander, citrus peel and lavender added to the boil and whirlpool. A spicy, fruity yeast strain is used to add complexity, and rolled oats are added for a silky texture.

name: Orchard's Edge: Knotty Pear
description: Knotty Pear’s main ingredient is juice from American apples, and also features pear juice, which adds a new dimension to the cider, creating a pleasantly dry flavor. Cardamom imparts a slight spicy flavor. With notes of citrus and mint, this cider showcases fresh acidity, lasting tannins, and a pleasantly dry finish from oak aging.

name: Orchard's Edge: The Old Fashioned
description: The Old Fashioned is made with a blend of American apples and is aged on oak with dried tart cherries, California grown navel orange peel, and charred bourbon barrel staves, offering citrus and cherry aromas with a bright apple flavor and slight vanilla notes. It has lasting tannins and a full, round mouthfeel.

name: Orchid
description: To continue the edible flower theme, we decided to change our flora this year from Viola to Orchid. Specifically edible orchids from the Dendrobrium genus, as the entire orchid family is thousands of species in number. A mild, sweet and pleasant floral fragrance and flavor accompanies the textured sour and caramel notes of the small beer.

name: Order of the Rabbit
description: This full-bodied ale gets your attention with a combination of rich fruity flavors and tartness from Belgian yeast and dark crystal malt. The higher alcohol content helps warm your pallet without dominating the flavor profile

name: Orderville
description: A wet-hop bonanza, created from two entirely separate beers: one with wet Simcoe, another with wet Chinook. The wet Mosaic showed up late—naturally—so we dry-hopped the Simcoe beer with the wet Mosaic. But we ordered so much Mosaic that we literally couldn’t fit anywhere near enough of it into the fermenter, so we filled the hopback with the wet Mosaic and recirculated the beer through it over and over and over and over again. The resulting beer was piney, grassy, dry, and bitter.

name: Ordinary Bitter
description: An easy drinking session ale in the English style. Fruity and malty aromas at the start, with plenty of hops leading into a dry finish. Hopped exclusively with Comet.

name: Ore House™ IPA
description: Golden IPA with a balanced hop bitterness and wonderful citrus and pine aroma and flavor.

name: Oregon Alley IPA
description: This Imperial India Pale Ale is loaded with hops. A combination of spicy, citrus and herbal hopes deliver lots of bitterness while our blend of Marris otter, Caramel 120, and a hint of roasted barley malt lend a supporting backbone to this highly hopped IPA.

name: Oregon Export Lager
description: This is a true to style Dortmonder Lager. Brewed with pilsner malt and Oregon hops the Oregon Export is light, crisp, floral with a slight lemon citrus finish. Just right for end of summer

name: Oregon Golden Ale
description: Oregon Golden Ale is the original Rogue brew dating back to 1988 and the days of the old Ashland brewpub location (which was destroyed by a flood several years ago). Deep golden in color with a rich malty aroma. Delicately smooth and crisp flavor and an herbal finish. Oregon Golden Ale is created from Northwest Harrington and Klages, and Maier Munich Malts (18% speciality grains, .19 lbs grain per bottle). Kent Golding and Cascade hops. Oregon Golden Ale is available in a 22-ounce bottle (the 12-ounce 6-pack was phased out in early 2005), and on draft.

name: Oregon Honey Beer
description: Here’s the original honey beer. Crisp and refreshing, with a hint of sweetness. To craft the beer, we enlist the talents of several million local bees for their pure, white clover honey. Our brewmaster then blends the ambrosia with select, two-row barley malt and balances it with prized Willamette hops. While the bees reluctantly part with their honey, The Great American Beer Festival enthusiastically receives it, as they’ve awarded OHB a silver medal in a category with more than 60 blonde ales.

name: Oregon Session Ale
description: A great introduction to craft beer, the OSA is a light, smooth, easy-drinker. Pilsner malt makes the base, flaked maize makes the creamy white head, and a subtle Willamette hop presense reminds you that you're in Oregon.

name: Oregon Trail Raspberry Wheat
description:
Light amber with an almost pinkish hue thanks to the use of natural raspberry. While similar to domestic fruit beers, this lightly hopped unfiltered wheat beer is brewed with American and German malted barley, giving it a refreshing and smooth classic wheat beer start. The raspberry flavor comes through in aroma and in it's subtly-sweet, semi-dry finish. 

Medals: GOLD - Fruit Beer, Great American Beer Festival, 1998

name: Oregonberry Wheat Ale
description: Oregonberry Wheat Ale is a light, refreshing, tart summer beer brewed with pale malt, organic wheat malt, cherries, blueberries, and plums. This beer has a rich berry nose and flavor and subtle wheat malt tones.

name: ORENDA
description: Defined as “The force of human will, in opposition to fate or destiny, to change the world,” Orenda represents our never-ending optimistic mindset and the idea that each of us has the capabilities and strength to effect outcomes seemingly preordained. Rich mahogany in color with a slight garnet hue, this Belgian Quadruple is sweet and malty with lots of toffee and plum-like dark fruits, but perfectly balanced and soft on the palate. This complex beer is for those empowered enough to break the mold.

name: Orenthal’s Blonde Ale
description: American Style Blonde Ale enhanced with 3 types of orange juices.  Blonde candi malt sweetness with light orange notes.  A light, smooth, bright mouthfeel.  Finishes clean & dry & leaves you wanting another sip.

name: Organic Acai Berry Wheat
description: A delicate crystal wheat beer with a light, thirst-quenching body, balanced by the equally tempting aroma of organic acai, pomegranate, and other mixed berries.

name: Organic Ale
description: When we asked about the green energy we celebrated with to create this fruity and flavorful american pale ale brewed with organic malt and hops. Sigtuna Organic Ale is a hommage to the ölstil which was developed by mikrobryggare in the early 1980s on the u.s. West Coast, then aromatic hops was something new and exciting – a delicate beer with a lot of attitude where the malt and the hops supports each other.

name: Organic Ale
description: Propeller Organic Ale is an easy-drinking blonde ale. This brew has a clean body, subtle malt sweetness and crisp finish. We believe brewing a certified organic beer means being all in. That's why we use only organic Pale and Pilsen malts carefully balanced with select organic hops to give this brew it's special character. Enjoy.

name: Organic Ale
description: Water is extracted from our own 300 deep borehole and combined with Soil Association accredited light malted barley from Norfolk. Organic hops provide the distinctive palate. The yeast used is St. Peter's own single strand variety. The result is a delicate, clean, crisp, lightly carbonated, traditional English Ale with a full citrus hop aftertaste. This lovely beer won the Soil Association's top prize in 2002 and a silver medal in 2006.

name: Organic Amber Ale
description:
This refreshing amber ale is brewed with premium pale and caramel malted barley and aromatic hops. The flavor is malt driven but the essence of the hops shine through in the aroma.

2008 Bronze Medal Winner, English Bitter, North American Brewers' Association
2007 Silver Medal Winner, Bitter or Pale Mild Ale, Great American Beer Festival

name: Organic Amber Ale
description: Medium-bodied with an appealing amber hue, this is the First Ale of the Republic. Its organic pale, Munich, and crystal malts create a gentle sweet character that is difficult to resist.  From organic Hallertauer hops come a zesty flavor and aroma that beautifully balance Organic Amber's malt profile. The result: Truly delicious ale that salutes organic farmers and all the goodness they bring to our tables.

name: Organic Best Ale
description:
A delicately flavoured golden ale in which subtle fruity esters from the Samuel Smith yeast strain interact with a background of maltiness and fresh hops. Brewed with water, organic malted barley, organic hops and yeast; fermented in ‘stone Yorkshire squares’.

Serving Suggestions • Crab salad; free range herbed chicken; hummus; smoked salmon and masala.

Ingredients • Water, organic malted barley,  yeast, organic hops, seaweed finings, carbon dioxide.

Best served at about 51°F (11°C).

name: Organic Best Bitter
description: Soil Association accredited, organically grown barley is used to make the mash for this excellent beer. To provide the distinctive fully hopped flavour we add organically grown hops. The result is a unique, full-bodied organic best bitter with a refreshing after-taste, highly commended by the Soil Association. Gold medal – International Beer & Cider Competition IFE. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Organic Blonde Seasonal Ale
description:
Light bodied and golden, Fish Tale Organic Blonde Ale is a matchless companion to the glories of a Cascadian summer. Brewed with just a schmatering of rye, Organic Blonde sports subtle spicy tones that complement the honey sweetness of its pale malt to a tee.

To balance its deliciously delicate malt character, we brew this Organic seasonal ale with Glacier hops. These impart a savory aromatic finish with just the gentlest tang. Whether served with saucy summer barbecue, or as a thirst quencher in its own right, Fish Tale Organic Blonde Ale perfects the sweet leisure of the summer days. Or nights.

name: Organic California Blonde Ale
description: A light, crisp Blonde Ale created with delicate malt characteristics, this brew is balanced by a very subtle touch of citrusy spice from Pacific Northwest organic hops.

name: Oyster Stout
description: This Stout is brewed with 50 pounds of oyster shells added to the mash. Black in color with a roasted malt aroma and a light mineral flavor with a dry finish.

name: Oyster Stout
description: Brewed with dark chocolate and dark caramel malt for notes of cocoa, chocolate and toasted grain, this stout also features malted wheat to provide a smooth body and creamy head. In the final five minutes of the boil, we add Totten Inlet Pacific oysters to give this sweet but balanced stout a subtle briny essence that brings to mind the flavor of the Puget Sound.

name: Oyster Stout
description:
Traditionally in London at about the time of Dickens, Stout and Oysters were the poor man's meal, taken as good hearty tasty food.

There are no Oysters in Oyster Stout, but the association is well established and you can now enjoy this great tasting traditional English Stout.

The unique character of Oyster Stout is brought about by fermentation with the Marston's strain of yeast. Taken from the Burton Unions, this yeast is very active and gives full attenuation of beer giving a dry clean after-palate.

English Aroma Hops, Fuggles and Goldings are added for their fruity, floral and spicy contribution to the taste with the majority of the bitterness coming from the roasted malts. The final result is a rich, dark and extremely creamy smooth stout with good character and strength.

name: Oyster Stout
description:
Brewed in collaboration with Jason McAdam of upcoming Alchemy Brewing using an old English method of incorporating oysters into the kettle.

Hops: magnum, ahtanum
Malts: organic pale, caramel, chocolate wheat, black
Unmalted: black barley, rolled rye
Also: oyster juice, whole oysters
Yeast: Scottish ale

name: Oyster Stout
description:
Rapidly becoming our best selling stout. A superbly balanced brew, smooth and rounded without being bland. More sweetness derived from fresh oysters shucked into the conditioning tank, what a way to go!

But of course not suitable for vegetarians.

name: Oyster Stout
description: Our Oyster Stout gives off a creamy body, giving it a nice and smooth mouth-feel. We used Rappahannock Oysters, because of its sweet and smooth flavor profile to match the body of the beer. Rapp's are also some of the least salty oysters in which case gives off just slight hints of brine at the back end of the beer

name: Oyster Stout
description: A Stout brewed in the tradition of our brethren in Ireland, a nod to a bygone era.  Made with real oysters from Joe's Butcher Shop and Fish in Carmel, Indian and a fair amount of malted Rye, this light, dry and zesty stout finishes on a mineral note with a hint of fresh sea spray. Anyone who has had gulf oysters with a beer can agree that this one would be perfect for a kick starter to a night of Mardi Gras shenanigans in NOLA.  ***WARNING*** This beer was produced with real shellfish, do not consume if you have allergies.

name: Oyster Strong Ale
description: Burnside Oyster Strong Ale was brewed with 18 gallons of Hama Hama oyster liquor, and 4 pounds of lemon peel. This unique offering has a complex malt flavor profile and deep garnet color. Aged for 6 months, this is as limited and special a release as they come.

name: Oysterhead Stout
description:
The history of such beers is murky and there are modern examples that are called oyster stouts but contain no oysters, rather they are meant to be paired with the bivalves and evoke images of the sea. Some modern versions simply use the shells, for the way in which they alter the water chemistry (lots of calcium), which creates a roundness in the mouthfeel of the beer.

Oysterhead Stout uses shell, meat, and liquor from the oyster, however, adding additional depth through the brininess of the meat and liquor. It’s subtle, but it is definitely there.

name: Ozark Firefly Wheat
description: A night in the Ozarks should be enjoyed outdoors with friends…the moon, the stars and dozens of fireflies twinkling in the darkness.  Our handcrafted wheat beer is like friends and fireflies…there should always be more than one.

name: Ozzy
description: Brewer's Art's answer to the Belgian \devil"beers (i.e. Lucifer etc.). Both rich and dry this beer is all too easy to consume in large quantities. Hopped with Styrian Goldings."""

name: O’Beardsley’s Stout
description: Our Stout is opaque black with a tan head and slightly sweeter than a dry stout.  Aromas are of roasted malt blended with some chocolate and coffee notes.  Following a similar pattern, the flavor is a balance between chocolate and coffee supported by some background sweetness.

name: O’Dark:30
description:
Dawn has not arrived, but we are awake – cooling one small batch of delicious beer, or starting the next.  O’Dark:30 is a beguiling combination of dark malt and NW hops, a tribute to the brewers of our region.

Black IPA

name: O’FALLON CHERRY CHOCOLATE
description: A dark wheat beer that tastes like a chocolate covered cherry…only better! Brewed with four kinds of grain and two hops varieties for a smooth, delicious beer…the perfect sipping beer for the cooler winter months.

name: O’FALLON KING LOUIE TOFFEE STOUT
description: King Louie Toffee Stout is full-bodied, velvety, and balanced between soft chocolate, caramel and roasted notes. Our friends at Bissinger’s worked with us to develop a proprietary toffee blend with hints of caramelized sugar and vanilla to round out this confectionery collaboration.

name: O’Fallon Smoked Porter
description: Dark, rich and smoky…this classic porter is brewed with 63% German smoked malt and makes a perfect after dinner (or anytime) sipper for those who love a “bigger” beer. Winner of the Gold Medal in the 2004 Great American Beer Festival® for best Smoked Beer in America!

name: O’FALLON STRAWBERRY BEST
description: Try our new refreshingly light and crisp Strawberry Best! We start with an American Wheat style recipe that’s a perfect compliment for fruit. We add real strawberry puree to the secondary fermentation, which gives the beer a naturally subtle strawberry flavor and aroma with a slight tartness. Light in color and soft in bitterness this beer is designed specifically to be enjoyed during the hot summer months.

name: O’hooley’s Irish Red
description: Brewed Every Spring for Jackie O’s St. Patrick’s Day party, O’hooley’s Irish Red is a high gravity take on an Irish beer style. The aroma is filled with delicious nutty caramel character. The bitterness is not overwhelming but helps balance out the abundance of caramel malts. The flavor is malt driven with some great spicy hop notes and soft fruitiness from our house yeast. Flaked Oats and White Wheat add a smooth mouth feel and a dense tight head. At 7.5%abv this Irish red will leave you feeling lucky.

name: O’Leary’s XXX Stout
description: An ultra dark and rich imperial Stout with chocolate and coffee flavors.

name: O’reilly’s Irish Red
description: Amber-Red color with an off-white head.  Light, clean malty aroma with slight fruity esters.  No hop aroma.  Light-bodied mouth feel.  A malt focused beer with a dry, grainy character.  Not sweet, but surprisingly crisp & dry with just enough hop bitterness to balance the malt.  An easy drinking, low-alcohol session beer.

name: O’Rye-N Galaxy Pale
description: Made with a touch of rye and Australian Galaxy hops which create distinct citrus, peach and passion fruit notes; you will find this session-able beer sweet, spicy and out of this world!

name: P 'Ale' Sner
description: Welcome back old friend. An original brew from the first menu, this is an easy-drinking pilsner style ale. If you like the yellow and fizzy, you'll be in a tizzy.

name: P St. Pale Ale
description: One of our signature ales first brewed for the garage bar gang.  Dry hopped and late addition hopped with Citra hops giving this beer a fantastic nose and imparting very interesting citrus and tropical fruit characters to the beer.

name: P'tit Blanc
description: Bière de blé aux baies de genévrier et lime

name: P-2
description: Belgian-inspired Pale with tropical fruit, clove, and resiney aroma. Heady carb and medium body with sweet malt and Belgian candy sugar middle. Finishes dry with an aggressive, yet balanced, hop bitterness.

name: P-51 Coconut Porter
description: P-51 is a robust and clean-finishing porter. Rich malty flavors highlight hints of chocolate, coffee, nuts and smoke. At 8% ABV, this dark beer will warm even the coldest South Sound nights.

name: P-Dub
description: Bobby's Pale Ale is a refreshing American Pale Ale made with Crystal and Cara-Pils for color and head retention. This APA has a citrusy bouquet on the nose with fruity citrus on the palette and a touch of pine and spice on the back end. The malt and hops balanced out perfectly.

name: P-Trois
description: This version of our Belgian Pale Ale primarily fermented with two strains of Brettanomyces offers a more subdued hop aroma, a drier body and more bite.

name: P-Value
description: This Pale Ale is light and hoppy with just the right amount of malt depth. This beer challenges the notion that hops and grain can't be balanced. Reject the null hypothesis.

name: P.A.C. Forever Double ESB
description:
Don't fight it, Spite It!

People always ask us, why Spiteful?

Well, here's an example: our good friend's hockey (and favorite)

number is between 25 and 27. Because of this, that number is forever

known as 25B at Spiteful. So we brewed this double ESB for our

batch #25B to spite him. And just in case you were wondering,

P.A.C. stands for People Against Colin.

It takes a lot to have an entire organization against you,

but trust us, he's an idiot!

name: P.D.Ogg Porter
description: An Imperial Brown Porter reminiscent of English toffee. Chocolate, caramel, slight coffee notes with a barely perceptible hint of smoke dance over the palate. This recipe is the brainchild of Dr. Paul D. Ogg, developed during his home-brewing days.

name: P.F.D. Pale Ale
description: Pale orange in color with upfront citrus aroma and slight bitterness. Light in body and refreshing.

name: P.H.A.T Ass
description: What do you get when you take our St. Elmo Smart Ass and hop it up a bit? You get an ale that is Pretty Hoppy At That.

name: P.O.C. Pride of Cleveland Pilsner
description: The new P.O.C. is a Euro-style Pilsner has unsurpassed flavor and body. Just enough pale malt to give off complex, floral, grainy notes supported by handfuls of authentic East European hops (even in the storage vessel) to bring a deep rooted bitterness to the palate.

name: P.Y.T (Pretty Young Thing)
description: This might be the first Black APA possibly created. This has a more malty flavored brew compared our King of Hop because of the reduced hop presence. Dry hopped with Falconer’s Flight to give that roastiness something to compete with.

name: P2 with Black Currant
description: This light burgundy beer with frothy pink hues has a perplexing nose with mixed berry, herbal and vinous aromas. Flavors of underripe berries fade into a dominant lingering bitterness drawing out floral, orange pith qualities.

name: Pallet Jack IPA
description: The awesome blend of columbus, citra, amarillo and simcoe hops bombard this ipa with flavors of citrus, tropical fruit, and a little bit of pine. the light malt flavor comes from 2-row barley and a touch of crystal malt. 2012 gabf silver. 2013 national ipa champion.

name: Pallisade Common
description: Our take on the beloved California Common, this beer will be a creamsicle in a pint glass. Caramel, vailla, malt sweetness, and Palisade peaches will make this one of the greatest beers you can have on a summer day

name: Palm Nonalcoholic
description: For beer drinkers who enjoy alcohol-free beers with honey-soft PALM malts in harmony with fine aroma hops from Kent.

name: Palm Reader
description: A tribute to our beautiful state, this refreshing ale is made with Michigan-grown, at Hop Head Farms, Zuper-Saazer hops. Imparting intense and fruity aromas combined with the citrus notes of the Crystal hops and the simple malt bill, this beer is crisp, bright and delicious.

name: Palm Speciale
description: Since 250 years Palm, a top-fermented amber beer, is brewed in the Belgian province of Brabant.  It has a soft, full and fruity taste.  It is only available in the Benelux.  In France it is known as Palm Belgique with 6% alcohol percent.

name: Palm Stout
description: Oatmeal Stout Aged with Pomegranate

name: Palm Tree Caribbean Lager
description: An homage to the islands, with hints of spice and a strong malt character, this pilsner is light, refreshing, and sure to make you feel like you're relaxing on a tropical beach. In short, it's pretty darn tasty.

name: Palmarès
description: A Cyclist Palmarès is quite simply a list of the individual riders accomplishments. Our Russian Imperial Stout was a defining moment for Cyclers Brewing, and landed high on the list of our achievements. One accomplishment for the majority of us might be just getting on a Bike with our family, or friends, or staying true to our training regimen, despite the conditions. Regardless of our individual Palmares, a basic rule of training is to train what you aim for. Training with an intensity close to your Maximal Oxygen consumption (Vo2 Max) is the most effective way to increase your performance. We took this same frame of mind in creating this jet black, smooth, slick, masterpiece!

name: Palmbender Pale Ale
description: The Palmbender Pale Ale has a sweet citrus aroma and a mellow hop bitterness. The subtle warm spice is balanced by sweet caramel malt flavors.

name: Palmistry
description:
Double Berliner Pale Ale with Guavas, Kumquats, and Pineapples

Reading the lines on your palm is an ancient method of looking your future and determining your character. We see enduring love and great flavors ahead!

This Double Berliner Pale has 620lbs Pineapples, 250lbs Kumquats, 300lbs White Guavas, and 30g Vanilla Bean per 30 BBL batch.

abv: 8.5%
pH: 3.6
Wild Cultures: Urban Artifact Lactobacillus, Saccharomyces cerevisae

name: Palo Comado Pale Ale
description:
Our newest flagship ale is pale gold in color with a well-formed, bright white foam head. Moderate hop aromas of pine and lychee are followed by light yet bright malt tones from English crystal and Canadian honey malts. Finishing with bright and zesty hop flavors, it’s a light and refreshing ale that does not skimp on flavor or character. Perfect after a local hike in beautiful namesake Palo Comado Canyon.

Formerly: Palo Comado XPA

name: Palo Santo Ahumado
description: Palo Santo Ahumado is a London Style porter brewed with about 44% Palo Santo smoked malt.  This is the same type of wood that makes up the aging vessels for our Palo Santo Marron.  Though, the smoking process lends an entirely different and unique character to this ale when compared to the Marron, which is aged “on the wood”.  Unlike most smoked beers which tend to have a camp fire and almost bacon-like character at times, the smoke from Palo Santo wood lends a much more perfume-like aromatic quality to this beer, similar to the aroma of pinon incense.  Notes of coconut, vanilla, and sandalwood dominate the nose with just a touch of ash of coming through.  These notes also come through in the flavor along with chocolate, caramel, dark fruit, bourbon soaked oak, and a sweet but spicy finish, with minor supporting hints of the familiar smokey camp fire coming through.  Despite its deep black color with mahogany highlights, this is one truly quaffable ale.  Perfect on its own, or a great match up with any of our wood grilled offerings or one of our delicious homemade desserts like the bread pudding or brownies and ice cream.

name: Palo Santo Marron
description: An unfiltered, unfettered, unprecedented brown ale aged in handmade wooden brewing vessels. The caramel and vanilla complexity unique to this beer comes from the exotic Paraguayan Palo Santo wood from which these tanks were crafted. Palo Santo means "holy tree" and it's wood has been used in South American wine-making communities.

name: Paloma-Rita
description: A San Diego style gose with key lime, Meyer lemon, grapefruit & La Jolla sea salt

name: Palomar Pale Ale
description: Refreshing, thirst quenching combination of caramel malts. A medium bodied ale with a citrusy hop finish.

name: Palomares Pale Ale
description: Palomares Pale Ale is brewed with the finest of pale malts and hopped generously with Centennial and Summit hops.  Great beer for warm days with a hint of citrus.

name: Palomino
description: Yummy and awesome

name: Palomino Pale Ale
description: Palomino Pale Ale is our interpretation of an American style Pale Ale. We brew this beer using only the finest American barley and hops and add even more hops as it ages to give it a great balanced citrusy taste and aroma. This beer is sure to please anyone who enjoys the refreshing taste of American hops.

name: Pamola Xtra Pale Ale
description: Brilliant clarity, bright golden in color. Pamola Pours with a nice creamy head and subtle malt and hop aroma. Crisp, clean, effervescent start with a touch of malt character and a balanced bitterness. Hop flavors linger nicely. Finishes clean, crisp and dry with a light body. Pamola is brewed with pure, soft Maine water from Lake Auburn; three different hop varieties, plus domestic and imported “Character” malts provide complexity, color, and body while making use of a clean, well attenuating, top-fermenting American ale yeast. The beer is then cold conditioned for a smooth, clean and crisp flavor. This one is extremely drinkable!

name: Pampelmousse Citrus IPA
description: This deep golden, medium bodied Citrus IPA offers up refreshment that will satisfy all your senses. Four hop varieties along with real grapefruit juice build a solid hop bitterness highlighted by citrus notes, both on the tongue and in the nose.

name: Pamplemead
description: Honey wine with grapefruit and juniper berries.

name: Pan American Stout
description:
A truly multicultural beer.  We started with a recipe of a classic oatmeal stout, and then started heading south.  We picked up some vanilla beans in mexico, and then made a stop in columbia for some coffee before heading back north to blend it all together in our fermenters.

The oatmeal gives a hint of sweetness that helps to balance out the black-as-night malts that we use to bring this beer to it’s dark and rich final color.  We add some hops for balance, but let’s be honest, they aren’t the star of the show here.  The subtle yet present flavor of locally roasted coffee and mexican vanilla beans is why you should be ordering up a pint of this alongside your chili, to go with your creme brulee, or to sit next to that slice of chocolate cake.

The result is a deliciously drinkable beer with enough coffee and vanilla in it to give you an impression that one of these might be just as good with your morning cereal as your dinner tonight……

name: Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster
description: Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster is a Double Belgian IPA brewed exclusively with Galaxy hops. The nose is an impressive blend of citrus aromas reminiscent of guava and lemons. It also has subtle Belgian yeast esters. An intense, clean bitterness dominates the flavor profile, with little malt character to compete with. A fruity yeast sweetness is noticeable in the finish, alongside a resounding bitterness.

name: Peach Hefeweizen
description: An American-style hefeweizen with real peach juice and puree.

name: Peach Lager
description: Fresh Louisiana peaches are handpicked for this smooth lager. Pale malt gives the beer a sweet, crisp taste, with abundant amounts of ripe, juicy peaches added in the brewhouse to capture the flavors and aromas of real, fresh fruit. All our Harvest Series brews are made with the finest Louisiana-grown ingredients.

name: Peach Lotus Saison – SEASONAL
description: In the farmhouse tradition of brewing with “what you got”, we brew and ferment with a generous portion of Halifax County peaches and Conetoe Family Life Center honey. Light and tart, this beer borrows a hint of dry white wine and a light and crisp head. Pairs well with love and puppies and long walks on the beach.

name: Peach Mr. Tea
description: Tea ale brewed with black and green tea additions – minimal hops. Fermented with fresh local peaches.

name: Peach Nouveau
description: Light, crisp gluten free ale brewed using honey, sorghum, and quinoa and infused with peaches.

name: Peach Pecobbler
description: A semi-dry peach cider with a hint of pecan and notes of brown sugar.

name: Peach Pit Cream Ale
description: This seasonal brew is light, crisp, and refreshing. We have created a classic cream ale then aged it with fresh peaches before nitrogen conditioning it to create a truly unique summer brew. With a pleasant aroma and flavor from the peaches and real creamy body from nitrogen this beer is sure to please.

name: Peach Rush
description:
Summer peaches from RUSHville, Ohio mixed with wildflower honey.
Sweet

name: Peach Saison
description: Saison – A Saison with Colorado ingredients.  Saisons were originally brewed in French Farm houses.  We took this beer and added our own local ingredients.  A great example of the one of the funky things we like to do.  An early fall brew for sure.

name: Peach Saison
description: A dry, spicy, and well balanced Belgian style ale with a complex profile containing black pepper and other herbs (all yeast derived), a moderate hop balance and some sour notes to round it out.  Fresh Peaches impart a sweet peach finish and aroma.

name: Peach Tripel
description: Hardywood Peach Tripel displays a voluminous head, a sunshine golden hue, notes of white pepper and honeysuckle, and is refermented on over 50 pounds per barrel of peaches, apricots and nectarines, lending a subtle but luscious stone fruit character, and a pleasantly dry finish

name: Peach Wheat
description: An American Wheat beer brewed with 40% malted wheat. This beer starts sweet, but finishes with a refreshingly tart smack.

name: Peach Wheat
description: Don't let the color of this beer fool you! Flavored with natural ingredients, this lager brings memories of juicy peaches, fresh from the field. A light beer with a refreshing wheat taste accompanied by lots of peaches and a nice malt backbone. A very subtle fruitiness blends with a golden quench to make for an enjoyable summer beverage. Excellent with salads and some of our lighter fare. Enjoy!

name: Peach Wheat Ale
description: A light and refreshing pale wheat made with fresh peaches.

name: Peach Wheat Ale

beer_variation.description: An american style wheat beer.  Light in body with the refreshing flavor of wheat blended with the malty flavor of american 2-row barley.  Lightly hopped for balance.

style.description: This beer can be made using either ale or lager yeast. It can be brewed with 30 to 75 percent wheat malt, and hop rates may be low to medium. Hop characters may be light to moderate in bitterness, flavor and aroma. Fruity-estery aroma and flavor are typical but at low levels however, phenolic, clove-like characteristics should not be perceived. Color is usually straw to light amber, and the body should be light to medium in character. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Because this style is served with yeast the character should portray a full yeasty mouthfeel and appear hazy to very cloudy. Chill haze is also acceptable. Yeast flavor and aroma should be low to medium but not overpowering the balance and character of malt and hops. These beers are typically served with the yeast in the bottle, and are cloudy when served.
style.name: Light American Wheat Ale or Lager with Yeast

beer_variation.name: Wheat Ale

description: A subtle peach aroma introduces your nose to this fruity variation of our american style wheat beer.  A hint of peach flavors this light refreshing brew.  Not for girls only.

name: Peach Wheat Beer
description: This style of beer is classified in the "Fruit Beer" category. The focus is obviously on the fruit used in the brewing process. The aroma is of "fresh picked peaches", but the taste is only lightly-laced with peaches.

name: Peach Wit
description: A complicated, long mash schedule and high volume of un-malted wheat contribute an Earthy breadiness to the beer. There is a strong herbal tea note and a hint of peach flavor.

name: Peaches and Creme in my Pants
name_display: Peaches and Creme in my Pants

name: Peaches n' Cream
description: Light, crisp, refreshing lawnmower beer with all natural peaches added to give it a little more flavor. The beer has a golden straw color to it and the nose is like a basket of fresh picked peaches. Life's a peach.

name: Peaches the Friendly Ghost
description: Mead with Peach and White Tea

name: Peachicot Blonde Ale
description: River Company’s Peachicot Blonde Ale is a light and fruity blonde ale brewed with a 2 Row Brewers Malt, Dextrine malt, a hint of corn, and peach and apricot flavors. Light and refreshing without being overly sweet, it is the perfect summer day beer. We called it Peachicot because Aprieach sounded stupid!

name: Peachkin
description: A beautiful red ale with the aroma of fresh peaches.  Caramel malty sweetness is balanced by moderate hop notes, which are then followed by a sweet blend of peaches and pumpkin.  Always lady brewed!

name: Peachless Kombucha
description: Osmanthus, citrus, white pu-erh, hibiscus, galangal, birch bark and vanilla.

name: Peachtree Cherry (Barrel-Aged)
description: Our beloved hefeweizen brewed with generous amounts of cherries from the Crabtree's very own backyard and aged in Zinfandel barrels for over a year. Subtle fruit complexities, a dry finish and the essence of peach for an intricate mingling of flavors.

name: Peachtree Wheat Ale
description: This drinkably tamed German Hefeweizen makes the brewers at Crabtree emit poetry, their descriptions evoking everything from an orange-sunset Colorado orchard to the mellow "nirvana" of an outdoor European beirgarten. No matter where you drink it, Peachtree is a flavorful elixer for a hot summer day.

name: Pete's Wicked Strawberry Blonde
description:
Pete's Wicked Strawberry Blonde is truly a unique beer experience. Reward yourself with our golden lager made of the finest pale and wheat malts and Cluster Hops, with a kiss of natural strawberry flavor.

Availability ceased with the entire Pete's line in spring 2011.

name: Peter Brown Tribute Ale
description: Peter Brown Tribute Ale is malty American Brown Ale, brewed with molasses, brown sugar, and hopped with Cascade and Centennial. It's just the way Pete would have wanted it.

name: Peter Peter
description: This sweet and light bodied brown ale is full of Autumn flavor. A pumpkin start with a harvest spiced finish including notes of cinnamon and allspice. A seasonal favorite.

name: Peter Peter Pumpkin Drinker Porter
description: Our seasonal pumpkin offering is a porter with plenty of pumpkin flavor and lightly spiced.

name: Peter Peter Pumpkin Pleaser
description: A sweet and spicy seasonal pumpkin mash.

name: Peter Piper's Pickled Pepper Purple Peated Pale Ale
name_display: Peter Piper's Pickled Pepper Purple Peated Pale Ale

name: Peter the Great Russian Imperial Stout
name_display: Peter the Great Russian Imperial Stout
description: Brewer Pete’s ego beer, perfectly balanced between hops & Malts, bitter & sweet, with rich chocolate and coffee notes, full bodied and warming...make sure you get you some before Pete drinks it all!  Released in September.

name: Peter's Mild
description: Peter’s Mild is brewed to commemorate the life of Peter Austin, founder of the Ringwood Brewery and innovator in the development of modern craft/micro-brewed beer in England. Ruby-tan in color with a fluffy off-white head, this classic English mild ale bears an American influence, with its generous, yet judicious, hop profile. The flavor and aroma hold layers of malt depth, from toasted bread and hazelnut spread to chocolate-covered salted caramel, glossed-over by gently herbal, fruity hops. Our carefully-selected hops and malt conspire to compliment and contrast simultaneously, each slightly out-balancing the other, leaving a sense of intrigue after each sip. Arcadia’s house Ringwood-style yeast brings with it a pleasantly aromatic English influence, with notes of overripe strawberries, dark pie cherries, and exotic stone fruit. All in all, this is an eminently drinkable, “moorish” pint of ale that compels the drinker to dive deeper into its coppery depths, and particularly enjoyable on cask or served “real”.

name: Petey's Porter
description: More than a brown ale, not quite a stout, this porter pours dark and rich, with plenty of chocolate malt, offset by a late addition of Cascade hops for aroma.

name: Pete’s Greens Barn Raising Brown Ale
name_display: Pete’s Greens Barn Raising Brown Ale

name: Petit Ardennes
description: The Ardennes Forrest is a region in Belgium where some of the world's best beers are produced. We used these beers as inspiration in brewing this Belgian session ale. Petit Ardennes is a light bodied blonde beer with notes of spice, herb, and tropical fruit. A very sessionable beer with a low alcohol content that still has great flavor.

name: Petit Jean Pear
description: When our building was first built, Arkansas was the leading fruit producer in the nation; Petit Jean Mountain was home to numerous apple & pear orchards. We salute those fruity pioneers with our first cider & gluten free offering. The distinct flavor of pears stands out in this refreshing brew. Enjoy after a hike to Cedar Falls!

name: Petit Obscura
description: Telegraph Petit Obscura is a small beer brewed from the sour-mash second runnings of a batch of our Rhinoceros Rye Wine.
